Teaser: Psychostimulant medication for ADHD appears to be safe and well tolerated with low abuse potential in adolescents in treatment for co-occurring substance abuse.

Headlines: Younger HIV-Positive Patients Less Likely to Quit Smoking
Teaser: Only older age was significantly associated, although marginally so, with successful completion of a smoking cessation program.

Headlines: Progression to Daily Cannabis/Tobacco Use Linked to Earlier Psychosis Onset
Teaser: Escalating frequency of substance abuse may be a modifiable risk factor for psychosis, new research shows.

Headlines: Opioid Contracts in Primary Care
Teaser: Opioid contracts are not prevalent in primary care.

Headlines: Physician Impairment due to Substance Use Disorders
Teaser: A family physician starts self-prescribing narcotics abuse after a bike accident.

Headlines: Folic Acid and Cancer
Teaser: These results provide further reason not to recommend folic acid supplements for most middle-aged and older adults.

Headlines: Lifestyle Interventions in the Prevention and Treatment of Cancer
Teaser: Certain lifestyle factors continue to be causally related to certain cancers, and other cancers have lifestyle-based etiologic factors. Lifestyle changes and cancer prevention/treatment are discussed.

Headlines: Alcohol Use and Patterns of Delinquent Behaviour in Male and Female Adolescents
Teaser: This study explored the relationship between patterns of delinquent behaviors in relation to adolescent alcohol use.

Headlines: Use of Methadone in Chronic Pain Management--A Video Lecture from CSAT/SAMHSA
Teaser: An important video lecture on prescribing methadone for chronic pain, from the Center for Substance Abuse Treatment, Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration

Headlines: Smoking and risk of RA
Teaser: Does smoking contribute to the risk of developing RA in certain patients?

Headlines: Part 2: The Case of the Emergency Room Physician Who Burned Out: Diagnosing and Treating His Substance Abuse
Teaser: In part 2 of the new series on the Impaired Physician, substance abuse develops in Dr. X. Is it now time to turn him in?

Headlines: Part 1: The Case of the Emergency Department Physician Who Burned Out: Risk Factors, Impact, and Early Interventions
Teaser: In part 1 of the new series on The Impaired Physician, Dr. X shows signs of burnout that put his personal and professional life at risk. Would you turn him in?

Headlines: Alcohol Use and Patterns of Delinquent Behaviour in Male and Female Adolescents
Teaser: Does alcohol use vary between groups with different delinquent behavior patterns in a sample of male and female adolescents?

Headlines: Medications Used in Opioid Maintenance Treatment
Teaser: How have sublingual buprenorphine products altered the treatment landscape for opioid dependence?

Headlines: War on Drugs
Teaser: Doctors who prescribe opioids are targets of discipline and investigation.

Headlines: Teen Prescription and Over-the-Counter Drug Abuse
Teaser: Read this eye-opening article about generation Rx, and check your medicine cabinet.

Headlines: Interactions Between Transdermal Selegiline and Cocaine Infusion
Teaser: For potential treatment of cocaine dependence, researchers investigate whether an interaction exists between selegiline and cocaine.

Headlines: Does Gender Matter? A Study of GP Management of Alcohol-Related Problems
Teaser: Is gender of the patient and gender of the primary care provider of importance when identifying and handling alcohol-related problems?

Headlines: The Association Between Alcohol Use, Alcohol Use Disorders and TB
Teaser: Is heavy alcohol use a risk factor for tuberculosis?

Headlines: Comparative Effects of Three Heart-Healthy Behaviors on Life Expectancy
Teaser: What are the relative effects of three key factors--non-smoking, weight reduction, and increasing physical activity--on preventing heart disease and extending life expectancy?

Headlines: State Medicaid Coverage for Tobacco-Dependence Treatments -- US, 2007
Teaser: Smoking rates are higher among Medicaid enrollees than the general population, yet few Medicaid programs pay for smoking cessation treatments.

Headlines: Does Gender Matter? A Vignette Study of General Practitioners Management Skills in Handling Patients with Alcohol-Related Problems
Teaser: Does gender make a difference for physicians or the patients when assessing the severity of a patient's drinking problem?

Headlines: Towards DSM-V: Exploring Diagnostic Thresholds for Alcohol Dependence and Abuse
Teaser: Are alcohol use disorders best conceptualized as dimensional or categorical constructs? This study investigates the current diagnostic thresholds for alcohol dependence and abuse.

Headlines: Smoking and Mental Illness: Results From Population Surveys in Australia and the United States
Teaser: Strategies that address cigarette smoking in patients with mental illness and mental illness in cigarette smokers are important directions for tobacco control, this research shows.

Headlines: A Randomized Clinical Trial of 5 Smoking Cessation Pharmacotherapies
Teaser: This paper presents the first head-to-head comparison of five commonly used, effective smoking cessation pharmacotherapies.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation or Reduction With Nicotine Replacement Therapy
Teaser: Is the use of nicotine inhalers and gums a safe and effective means to quit or reduce smoking?

Headlines: Smoking Major Risk Factor for Mortality in Adults Treated for Heart Disease
Teaser: Smoking is a major risk factor for death from heart disease and cancer in adults who already have heart disease and receive clopidogrel.

Headlines: Pharmacologic Management of Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: Alcohol dependence is a serious and prevalent issue in the United States. Learn more about medications available to help patients abstain from this drug.

Headlines: Smoking and Clopidogrel
Teaser: More data suggesting that clopidogrel may have a greater effect in smokers than in nonsmokers have been reported.

Headlines: Quitting Smoking, Increased Calcium May Lower BMD Loss Linked to DMPA Use
Teaser: Quitting smoking and increasing calcium intake may reduce the risk for higher bone mineral density loss associated with use of depot medroxyprogesterone acetate.

Headlines: CDC Reports Show Downward Trend in Current Smokers, Rates of SHS Exposure
Teaser: The percentage of adults who are current smokers trended downward during 1998 to 2008 but remained unchanged from 2007 to 2008.

Headlines: Genetic Map Reveals Mutations From Cancer
Teaser: Gene mutations show roles of sunlight and smoking trigger two forms of cancer.

Headlines: Substance Abuse Medications May Offer Effective Treatment Option for Pathological Gamblers
Teaser: A new study shows that urge-driven pathological gamblers respond better to opioid blockers and glutamatergic modulators, whereas those with inhibition control issues respond well to COMT inhibitors.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Confers Survival Benefits After First AMI
Teaser: Lifetime nonsmokers and those who quit before or after a first acute myocardial infarction have lower mortality rates than current smokers.

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking May Increase Colorectal Cancer Risk
Teaser: In a large, prospective cohort study, long-term cigarette smoking was associated with colorectal cancer, even after controlling for screening and multiple other risk factors.

Headlines: Teen Use of Marijuana Tied to Later Depression
Teaser: Adolescents who use cannabis are at risk for depression as young adults, findings from a new study suggest.

Headlines: Obesity Threatens Benefits From Declines in Smoking in US
Teaser: The first study to examine the effects of both obesity and smoking together on life expectancy and quality of life in the US population shows that weight gain continuing at current levels will override the beneficial effect of the decline in smoking over the next 10 years.

Headlines: Alleviation of Opioid Withdrawal Symptoms Primary Driver of Illicit Buprenorphine Use
Teaser: Illicit use of buprenorphine is primarily driven by a desire to alleviate symptoms of opioid withdrawal and not to get high.

Headlines: OROS-MPH, Placebo Show Equal Efficacy for Teens With ADHD, Substance Abuse Disorders
Teaser: Improvements in the placebo group matched those seen in the active treatment group in a study of osmotic-release methylphenidate plus CBT for adolescents with ADHD and substance abuse disorders.

Headlines: Web-based Screening and Intervention Program May Reduce Drinking in University Students
Teaser: In this Medscape Psychiatry Minute, Dr. Peter Yellowlees talks about how a Web-based screening and intervention program reduces drinking in university students and could be implemented widely.

Headlines: Individual Interventions May Be More Effective Than Family-Based Therapy in Reducing Teen Alcohol Abuse
Teaser: Individual-only interventions have larger effect sizes than family-based interventions in reducing adolescent alcohol abuse, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Alcoholic Liver Disease
Teaser: Don't miss this succinct review of the diagnosis and management of alcoholic liver disease.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Drug Varenicline Safe and Effective in CVD Patients
Teaser: The smoking cessation agent varenicline is safe and effective to use in patients with stable cardiovascular disease, a new study concludes. The agent should be part of the physician's armamentarium when it comes to smoking cessation, an often-neglected part of the treatment of CVD, says the lead author.

Headlines: Smoking and Alcohol Consumption Risk Factors for AMD in the Oldest Old
Teaser: Smoking is associated with a higher chance of developing age-related macular degeneration in individuals aged 80 years and older.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Linked to Higher Short-Term Risk for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Cigarette smoking predicts incident type 2 diabetes, but cessation leads to higher short-term risk, highlighting the need for diabetes prevention and early detection.

Headlines: What Should We Do About Medical Marijuana?
Teaser: In Dr. Sandra Fryhofer's column, "Staying Well," she discusses the challenging issues surrounding medical marijuana from the point of view of a professional and a mother.

Headlines: QALY Decline Greater for Obesity Than Smoking
Teaser: Data from 1993 to 2008 show quality-adjusted life-years lost from obesity recently surpassing those lost from smoking.

Headlines: Caffeine Intoxication and Addiction
Teaser: Energy drinks are loaded with caffeine and sugar, infused with herbal additives, and marketed particularly to youth. Learn more about the health effects.

Headlines: Cocaine Accounts for 3% of Sudden Deaths, Most of Them in Nature
Teaser: Cocaine-associated sudden deaths are not so rare, and the majority are cardiac in nature, according to a Spanish postmortem case-control study. The findings also indicate there is no such thing as "safe" recreational use of small amounts of the drug, something doctors and the public need to realize, say the researchers.

Headlines: Pregnant Women's Attitudes Towards Alcohol Consumption
Teaser: Most pregnant women find information and advice about safe levels of drinking in pregnancy confusing and lacking in evidence and detail, this research hints.

Headlines: Green Vegetables Protect Smokers From Genetic Changes Associated With Lung Cancer Risk
Teaser: A new study found an association between folate intake and the promoter methylation of genes often silenced in lung cancer.

Headlines: The Benefits of Risk Factor Prevention in Americans Aged 51 Years and Older
Teaser: What are the potential health and economic benefits of successfully treating hypertension and other common cardiovascular risk factors in older Americans?

Headlines: Little Risk for Addiction From Long-Term Opioid Use in Select Chronic Pain Patients
Teaser: Long-term opioid therapy is associated with little risk for addiction when given to select patients with chronic noncancer pain and no history of substance abuse.

Headlines: Stopping Smoking Has Large Survival Benefit in Early Lung Cancer
Teaser: A new analysis indicates that smoking cessation can improve survival in patients with early-stage lung cancer.

Headlines: Changing Risk Health Behavior
Teaser: Does seeing the physical damage caused by an unhealthy lifestyle get individuals to change their behavior? Results are mixed, according to researchers, with behavior changing in certain circumstances, such as seeing the arterial damage caused by smoking or the damage to skin caused by prolonged exposure to the sun.

Headlines: Prenatal and Postnatal Tobacco Exposure and Behavioral Problems in Children
Teaser: Tobacco exposure has been linked to behavioral problems in children. But which is the bigger culprit -- prenatal or postnatal exposure?

Headlines: Childhood Respiratory Illness and Lung
Teaser: What effect does childhood respiratory illness have on adult lung function?

Headlines: Nicotine Replacement Therapy in Critically Ill Smokers in the ICU
Teaser: Nicotine replacement therapy is not associated with increased hospital mortality in critically ill active smokers, according to a new observational study.

Headlines: Screening for Personality Disorder with the SAPAS
Teaser: Is the Standardised Assessment of Personality: Abbreviated Scale (SAPAS) useful to screen for personality disorders? This study tests its use in a clinical sample of substance abusers.

Headlines: Transdermal Nicotine for 24 Weeks vs 8 Weeks May Improve Abstinence
Teaser: This intervention increased biochemically confirmed point-prevalence and continuous abstinence at week 24 and reduced the risk for lapses in smoking.

Headlines: Results of US Health-Risk Surveillance System Reported
Teaser: Controlling health-risk behaviors and using preventive health-care services can reduce or prevent morbidity and premature mortality from chronic diseases.

Headlines: Pipe and Cigar Smoking Linked to Decreased Lung Function and COPD
Teaser: Pipe and cigar smoking increased urine cotinine levels and were linked to decreased lung function and increased odds of airflow obstruction, even in people who had never smoked cigarettes.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Decreases Risk for CVD in HIV Patients
Teaser: The first study to assess the effects of smoking cessation among HIV patients finds that stopping smoking significantly decreases the risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD).

Headlines: New Federal Report Details Health of US Population
Teaser: The CDC's annual report describes the state of the nation's health; use of diagnostic imaging procedures has tripled, and overall life expectancy is now estimated at 77.9 years.

Headlines: Trends and Risk Factors for Mental Health Diagnoses Among Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans
Teaser: Could soldiers with longer tours of duty be at increased risk for posttraumatic stress disorder?

Headlines: Agranulocytosis Associated With Cocaine Use in Four States, 2008-2009
Teaser: Could levamisole in cocaine be to blame for a cluster of unexplained agranulocytosis cases?

Headlines: Overdose Deaths Involving Prescription Opioids Among Medicaid Enrollees
Teaser: Which opioid prescribing patterns are contributing to a higher overdose rate among Medicaid vs non-Medicaid patients?

Headlines: Medication-Assisted Treatment and HIV/AIDS
Teaser: Substance abuse and HIV infection remain serious public health issues and the interaction of the two poses challenges for clinicians. Can "medication-assisted treatment" help improve health outcomes in this population?

Headlines: Relationship between Alcohol Consumption and Active Helicobacter pylori Infection
Teaser: Is alcohol or smoking consumption associated with active H. pylori infection in functional dyspepsia patients?

Headlines: HIV Infection Among Injection-Drug Users: 34 States, 2004-2007
Teaser: Injection drug users continue to make up a substantial portion of new HIV cases. What needs to be done to curb infections in this population?

Headlines: How Is Zolpidem Dependence Managed?
Teaser: Zolpidem use can result in abuse, dependence, and withdrawal, often necessitating medical intervention.

Headlines: Smoking During Pregnancy Increases Risk for Preterm Birth
Teaser: The risk for both medically indicated and spontaneous preterm birth is higher for smokers than nonsmokers, new research shows.

Headlines: Physicians Are Talking About:  Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors and the Choice to Numb Out
Teaser: Results of a recent study show that some patients experience "blunted" emotions when taking SSRIs. Medscape Physician Connect members discuss their experiences -- both professional and personal.

Headlines: We Quit Smoking and Got Fat. So How Long Will Americans Live?
Teaser: Henry Black, MD, reports on a NEJM study that looks at trends in life expectancy and asks whether the negative effects of obesity will outweigh the positive effects of smoking cessation.

Headlines: Investigating Opioid Misuse
Teaser: Dr. Lynn Webster discusses the role and selection of physicians in legal investigations of opioid misuse.

Headlines: Early Marijuana Use Heightens Psychosis Risk in Young Adults
Teaser: Study participants who used marijuana were more likely to have hallucinations or delusions, report researchers.

Headlines: How Events in Your Personal Life Can Jeopardize Your Practice
Teaser: A DUI, steamy affairs, bad behavior, domestic violence, drug conviction, and other events could ultimately cause serious harm to your practice.

Source: Current Opinion in Allergy and Clinical Immunology
Headlines: Secondhand Smoke at Work
Teaser: Second-hand smoke exposure has been definitively related to many severe adverse health effects, yet the workplace remains a common source of SHS exposure.

Headlines: Are Men Shortchanged on Health? Perspective on Health Care Utilization
Teaser: Men are more likely than women to be alcohol and drug abusers, heavy smokers, and overweight. These behaviors and lower utilization of health services may contribute to their lower life expectancy.

Headlines: Relationship Between Carotid IMT and Coronary Angiographic Findings
Teaser: How useful is Doppler ultrasound of carotid intima-media thickness in detecting pre-clinical coronary artery disease?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: A Case-Control Study of Smoking and Bladder Cancer Risk
Teaser: How do smoking patterns affect bladder cancer risk?  .

Headlines: HIV Risk Behavior in Women With Intimate Partner Violence and PTSD
Teaser: Women with PTSD stemming from intimate partner violence are at increased risk for engaging in risky sexual behavior.

Headlines: Smoking May Be an Independent Risk Factor for Suicidality
Teaser: New research suggests that smoking may lead to an increased risk of suicidality and suicide attempts.

Headlines: Workplace Secondhand Smoke Exposure in the US Trucking Industry
Teaser: Laws restricting smoking in the workplace may be less effective in reducing workplace exposure to secondhand smoke among blue-collar workers.

Headlines: New SAMHSA Report Finds Underage Drinking a Problem in the United States
Teaser: A new survey shows that 1 in 4 young people aged 12 to 20 years drank in the past month and nearly 9% purchased alcohol on their own.

Headlines: Guide Shows Advocates How to Improve Health
Teaser: Residents of Nebraska and North Carolina can breathe easier these days thanks to indoor smoke-free air laws that recently took effect, thanks in part to "The Guide to Community Preventive Services."

Headlines: First Gene Linked to Lung Cancer in Nonsmokers
Teaser: Lung cancer risk in many nonsmokers is tied to reductions in GPC5 expression.

Headlines: Combination Therapy Improves Abstinence Rates in Weight-Concerned Female Smokers
Teaser: Bupropion + CBT designed to address concerns about weight gain produce higher rates of abstinence and longer times to relapse than standard CBT + medication or the weight-concerned CBT program alone.

Headlines: Raising Alcohol Prices Curbs Drinking, Deaths, Healthcare Costs
Teaser: Raising the price of alcohol can reduce alcohol-related illness and premature death and alleviate a considerable burden on healthcare systems, new research shows.

Headlines: Smoking, Obesity's Toll on Life Span
Teaser: High blood pressure and high blood sugar levels also contribute to a lower life expectancy.

Headlines: Years of Smoking, Not Number of Cigarettes, Linked to Parkinson's Risk
Teaser: The puzzling relationship between smoking and a reduced risk of Parkinson's disease may be explained in part by long-term smoking rather than the amount, say researchers.

Headlines: Experts Give Tips on How to Collect Urine to Screen for Drugs
Teaser: Because careful attention to urine collection methods can identify patients' attempts to falsify test results, these tips assist physicians in the proper methods of screening patients' urine for drugs.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: Efficacy, Safety, and Potential for Misuse
Teaser: Dr. Lynn Webster discusses the therapeutic role of marijuana and synthetic THC compounds.

Headlines: Preventing Narcotic Misuse
Teaser: Dr. Lynn Webster discusses the need for better collaboration among prescribers, pharmacies, and law enforcement to curb the misuse of narcotics.

Headlines: The Effects of Tobacco on the Fetal Brain
Teaser: More data with which to convince pregnant women to stop smoking.

Headlines: Cases in CAM: Milk Thistle for the Liver -- Any Evidence?
Teaser: A balanced summary of the evidence regarding silymarin (milk thistle) for treatment of liver disease and skin conditions.

Headlines: Obesity and Alcohol May Interact to Increase Risk for Liver Disease
Teaser: Two prospective studies show that obesity and alcohol both increase the risk for liver disease among men and women.

Headlines: Puffed Out! Glasgow, KY, Goes Smoke-Free in Public Spaces
Teaser: Capping what may be one of the most rancorous and divisive fights ever chronicled on theheart.org, a town in the heart of Kentucky's tobacco belt will soon have cleaner air in its public buildings.

Headlines: Alcohol Consumption in Young Adults and Incident Hypertension
Teaser: Is there a relation between alcohol consumption and incident hypertension? The jury is still out.

Source: Journal of Hospice and Palliative Nursing
Headlines: Pain Management in Advanced Illness and Comorbid Substance Use Disorder
Teaser: Don't miss this case study of a patient with advanced illness, pain, and comorbid substance use disorder who was seen in the home care setting.

Headlines: What Effect Does Smoking Cessation Have on Diabetes Risk?
Teaser: Clinicians may be surprised about the short-term risk of type 2 diabetes associated with smoking cessation.

Headlines: Evidence Accumulates for Links Between Marijuana and Psychosis
Teaser: Dr. Michael Compton discusses the potential association between cannabis use and psychosis.

Headlines: State Preemption of Local Smoke-Free Laws in Government Work Sites, Private Work Sites, and Restaurants
Teaser: Exposure to smoke in public places creates known health risks. Judiciary actions that prevent smoking bans in three indoor settings are examined.

Headlines: Passive Smoking Dangers in Adolescents
Teaser: The results suggest that children should not be exposed to tobacco smoke at all.

Headlines: New Nicotine Inhaler May Help Smokers Quit
Teaser: Vapor puffs from a new device carry nicotine deep into the lungs.

Headlines: Good and Bad Health Habits in U.S.
Teaser: Six in 10 Americans drink regularly, but only 3 in 10 get regular exercise.

Headlines: Smoking Magnifies Genetic Risk for Intracranial Aneurysm
Teaser: A new analysis from the Familial Intracranial Aneurysm cohort shows increased rupture risk with certain genetic variants and a strong interaction of this genetic risk with smoking.

Headlines: Public Smoking Ban Cuts Hospitalizations in Toronto
Teaser: Yet another study has shown that hospital admissions for acute MI drop dramatically in the aftermath of public smoking bans. This time, a study shows that Toronto's smoking bans led to lower hospital admissions not only for AMI but also for angina, stroke, and a range of respiratory conditions.

Headlines: Dosing Opioids for Optimal Acute Pain Management
Teaser: Dr. Motov examines the evidence base for drug choice and initial doses of opioid analgesics in the treatment of acute pain.

Headlines: Comparative Effectiveness of 5 Smoking Cessation Pharmacotherapies
Teaser: Dr. Peter Yellowlees discusses the results of a randomized placebo-controlled clinical trial of 5 smoking cessation pharmacotherapies.

Headlines: Vigabatrin Fails to Achieve Efficacy for Cocaine Dependence in Phase 2 US Trial
Teaser: In a phase 1, multicenter trial, vigabatrin was no better than placebo in helping cocaine addicts achieve abstinence, which is a result that contradicts the findings of a recent Mexican study.

Headlines: Preteen Marijuana Use Linked to Comorbid Substance Abuse and Psychological Disorders
Teaser: A new study shows that youths who start using marijuana before age 13 years have increased rates of suicide attempts, PTSD, legal problems, and abuse of other drugs, such as hallucinogens.

Headlines: Intensive, Lengthy Treatment Needed for Tobacco Cessation in Substance Abuse Patients
Teaser: A new Canadian study reveals patients in substance abuse treatment are more likely to successfully quit tobacco use when intensive and lengthy treatment--of up to 26 weeks--is provided.

Headlines: Debate Sharpens Over Menthol Cigarettes
Teaser: Public health experts and industry representatives disagree on regulation of menthol cigarettes.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Formulation of Controlled-Release Oxycodone
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new formulation of controlled-release oxycodone HCl designed to discourage misuse and abuse of the medication, which is indicated for the management of moderate to severe pain.

Source: Expert Review of Pharmacoeconomics & Outcomes Research
Headlines: Cancer Prevention: Major Initiatives and Looking Into the Future
Teaser: At least half of cancers are preventable. What prevention initiatives are currently underway?

Headlines: Epstein-Barr Virus Positivity Linked to Increased Interaction Between Smoking and MS
Teaser: An analysis of MS case-control study data highlights the biologic interaction among smoking, MS, and Epstein-Barr virus infection.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation After Diagnosis of Early-Stage Lung Cancer Improves Outcomes
Teaser: It's never too late to quit smoking, even after lung cancer is diagnosed.

Headlines: In-Utero Exposure to Smoking, Alcohol, Coffee, Tea and Risk of Strabismus
Teaser: Strabismis is a fairly common eye disorder in infants. Does in-utero exposure to behavioral risk factors such as smoking and alcohol, coffee, or tea consumption increase the risk?

Headlines: New Policy Statement Underscores Need to Curtail Underage Drinking
Teaser: A new policy statement from the American Academy of Pediatrics highlights the need to curb underage alcohol use.

Headlines: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Effective in Helping African Americans Quit Smoking
Teaser: Smoking cessation rates among African Americans were significantly greater among those receiving cognitive behavioral therapy vs general health education.

Headlines: Disproportional Impact of Lung Cancer on African Americans
Teaser: A new report from the American Lung Association highlights the racial difference in the burden of lung cancer.

Headlines: Q&A With Surgeon General Benjamin
Teaser: 'Transform our sick care system into a wellness system': Benjamin to health workers: 'We must continue to stay the course.'

Headlines: Combined Unhealthy Behaviors Associated With 4-Fold Increased Risk for Death
Teaser: Smoking, lack of physical activity, poor diet, and alcohol consumption, when their effect is considered collectively, appear to be associated with a substantially increased risk of death.

Headlines: Significant Proportion of Abuse Counselors Lack Knowledge of Bupropion for Tobacco Cessation
Teaser: A new study shows that approximately 40% of substance abuse counselors tested from 2002 to 2004 and from 2007 to 2008 have little knowledge of bupropion and its effectiveness.

Headlines: Methadone Maintenance Programs May Reduce Rates of Hepatitis C
Teaser: An Israeli study confirms that methadone maintenance treatment not only is effective in treating substance abuse but also reduces rates of infectious disease.

Headlines: Indoor Tanning May Be Addicting for Some Young Adults
Teaser: New research extends previous findings that indoor tanning may be an addictive behavior.

Headlines: Adult Use of Prescription Opioid Pain Medications -- Utah, 2008
Teaser: Adults often share prescription opioid pain medications with family and friends, sometimes with fatal consequences.

Headlines: Multi-Organ Ischaemia and Infarction in a Baby Due to IV Cocaine Use
Teaser: In this case, the premature baby of an IV cocaine abuser succumbs to multiple-organ failure.

Headlines: Cocaine-related Sudden Death: A Prospective Investigation in South-west Spain
Teaser: The prevalence of sudden cardiac arrest from cocaine abuse is calculated in this epidemiologic study - it's more common than you might think.

Headlines: Smoking Negates Positive Effect of Moderate Alcohol Use on Stroke Risk
Teaser: Any potential benefit of moderate drinking on stroke risk may be counteracted by smoking.

Headlines: Countdown to APA 2010
Teaser: In this video blog, Dr. Robert Findling highlights what not to miss at the American Psychiatric Association's upcoming annual meeting in New Orleans.

Headlines: Addicted to Tanning
Teaser: Young adults who visit tanning salons may not find it easy to kick the habit, despite the known risks.

Headlines: DDW 2010 Expert Video: Chronic Pancreatitis Highlights
Teaser: In this video commentary, Dr. John Baillie discusses findings from DDW 2010 related to chronic pancreatitis, specifically focusing on 3 interesting symposia devoted to the subject.

Headlines: Smoking of Crack Cocaine as a Risk Factor for HIV Infection
Teaser: Dr. Peter Yellowlees talks about how smoking crack cocaine has been found to be an independent risk factor for HIV seroconversion among people who were injection drug users.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Treatment for Infants of Opiate-Addicted Mothers
Teaser: A large American study of the safety of buprenorphine in pregnancy finds that the drug results in lower neonatal abstinence scores than methadone, and shorter infant hospital stays.

Headlines: Economically Deprived Just as Likely to Benefit From Anti-Smoking Legislation
Teaser: New survey data collected before and after England's public smoking ban should help dispel the enduring concern that sweeping antismoking legislation is more likely to benefit the rich and educated.

Headlines: Use of Antidepressants, Nicotine in Pregnancy Linked to Childhood Difficulties
Teaser: New research has linked use of nicotine and antidepressants in pregnancy to sleep and behavioral problems for offspring.

Headlines: Amphetamine and Alcohol Abuse: Associations to Brain Cortical Thickness
Teaser: Does co-morbid alcohol abuse contribute to reduced brain cortical thickness in amphetamine abusers?

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Influence of Cardiorespiratory Fitness on Lung Cancer Mortality
Teaser: Does physical fitness protect people from lung cancer?

Headlines: Religious Involvement and Seroprevalence of Six Infectious Diseases
Teaser: Does attending religious services offer adolescents protection from infections such as herpes simplex and hepatitis B and C?

Headlines: Twelve-Month Follow-up Results From a Randomized Controlled Trial of a Brief Personalized Feedback Intervention for Problem Drinkers
Teaser: As many people who abuse alcohol will never seek treatment, efforts must be made to find ways to take treatment to them. This study assesses the long term impact of an internet-based intervention.

Headlines: Why is Disulfiram Superior to Acamprosate in the Routine Clinical Setting?
Teaser: This study compares the long-term effectiveness of acamprosate and disulfiram in the treatment of alcohol dependence.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Opioid Misuse Among Pain Patients Differ by Sex
Teaser: A large study of patients with chronic pain shows that women who misuse opioids are more likely to be anxious or depressed, whereas men are more likely to have behavioral or legal problems.

Headlines: Prescription Opioid Relapses Associated With Shorter Treatment Course
Teaser: The largest treatment study ever conducted for prescription opioid dependence shows that tapering with buprenorphine during a 9-month period led to nearly universal relapse.

Headlines: Moms' Smoking, Depression Influence Teens' Smoking
Teaser: Teen smoking prevention requires attention to multiple risk factors, including maternal depression and cigarette smoking.

Headlines: Mental Health of UK Troops Remains Stable Despite Prolonged Duration of Wars in Iraq and Afghanistan
Teaser: Mental health of UK armed forces deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan has not deteriorated since 2003 when it was first assessed, new research suggests.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing Will Be Supervised Within the Year, Say Officials
Teaser: The FDA's controversial opioid risk evaluation and mitigation strategies known as REMS are nearing completion and will likely include mandatory education.

Headlines: Combination of Conduct Disorder and ADHD Predictive of Substance Abuse
Teaser: A long-term follow-up study of children with ADHD shows the risk for substance use disorder in this patient population is mainly limited to a subset of children with early conduct disorder.

Headlines: Smoking Linked to Flat Adenomas
Teaser: A prospective cross-sectional study suggests that smokers may require screening with high-definition colonoscopes to detect flat adenomas.

Headlines: Tobacco Roundup at the WCC
Teaser: At the World Congress of Cardiology 2010, experts pulled no punches in their desire to see smoking and secondhand smoke completely eliminated.

Headlines: MI and Smoking Ban in England
Teaser: The study shows a smaller reduction than previous reports, which is thought to be due to better controlling for confounders and marked reductions in smoke exposure before the ban was introduced.

Headlines: Parenting Style Linked to Heavy Drinking in Kids
Teaser: Binge drinking is less likely in teens with strict, supportive parents, a study says.

Headlines: Dramatic Increase in ED Visits Resulting From Prescription Opioid Use
Teaser: In a joint study, researchers from the CDC and SAMSHA find a 111% increase in ED visits involving nonmedical use of prescription opioid pain medications, especially oxycodone, hydrocodone, and methadone.

Headlines: Regular Smoking, Drinking Linked to Headaches in Teenagers
Teaser: The prevalence of any headache was doubled in those who reported regularly drinking cocktails, 1 cup of coffee a day, or being inactive and almost doubled with daily smoking, a new study shows.

Headlines: Addressing Patients' Concerns About Pain Management and Addiction Risks
Teaser: Barriers to adequate pain control may come from both patients and nurses.

Headlines: State Cigarette Excise Taxes -- United States, 2009
Teaser: More evidence that taxing cigarettes cuts smoking rates.

Headlines: Smoking Linked to Increased Depression Risk
Teaser: In addition to harming physical health, a new study suggests smoking can negatively affect mental health and may increase the risk for depression, especially for those who are nicotine dependent.

Headlines: APA 2010 Expert Video: Substance Abuse and Suicidality
Teaser: Drs. Richard H. Weisler and Ashwin Patkar highlight key substance abuse and suicide findings from the APA's 2010 Annual Meeting.

Headlines: Smoking and Skin Disease
Teaser: Why is smoking an aggravating factor for some dermatological disorders, while appearing to mitigate the clinical course of others?

Headlines: Extended-Release Naltrexone Reduces Opioid Use
Teaser: A once-monthly injection of naltrexone is superior to placebo in reducing opioid use and cutting cravings in opioid-dependent patients.

Headlines: Meditation May Improve Drinking and Substance Abuse Behaviors in Active Military Personnel
Teaser: Active military personnel who practice meditation during substance abuse treatment programs may experience significant improvements in recognizing and changing their drinking behaviors.

Headlines: How Do Emergency Physicians Respond to Statewide Prescription Monitoring Data?
Teaser: PMP systems can help emergency physicians differentiate between chronic pain and substance abuse disorders.

Headlines: Unintentional Drug Poisoning Deaths: A National Epidemic
Teaser: Medscape interviews Drs. Leonard Paulozzi, Richard Weisler, and Ashwin Patkar on the alarming rise in unintentional drug poisoning deaths, and what clinicians need to know to reduce harm.

Headlines: Using the Genetics of Smoking Behavior to Optimize Cessation Technique
Teaser: Genetic variants associated with smoking behavior provide insight into why there is no one-size-fits-all technique of smoking cessation.

Headlines: Early Age-Related Macular Degeneration Linked to Modifiable Risk Factors
Teaser: A study shows that early age-related macular degeneration is related to modifiable risk factors including smoking and serum high-density lipoprotein cholesterol level.

Headlines: Secondhand Smoke Linked to Psychiatric Illness, Hospitalization
Teaser: A new longitudinal study shows that high levels of secondhand smoke exposure can lead to high psychological distress and even increased hospitalization risk for nonsmokers.

Headlines: What Should I Know About "Status Offenses?"
Teaser: Be sure that teenage status offenders receive the help they need.

Headlines: Smoking and Mortality in HIV Infection
Teaser: Current smokers with HIV infection have 4 times higher risk for death than those without HIV infection.

Headlines: How Will the REMS Affect Pain Care?
Teaser: You still have until October to express your views about the proposed REMS regulations for opioid prescribing.

Headlines: Genotype Score and Nicotine Dependence Guide Smoking Abstinence Strategy
Teaser: An individual smoker's quit-success score could suggest the best treatment approach to achieve success in smoking cessation.

Headlines: Mental Disorders, Substance Abuse Linked to Increased Emergency Department Visits
Teaser: A total of 1 of every 8 visits to emergency departments involve mental disorders and/or substance abuse problems, according to a new report from the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality.

Headlines: Sex of Alcohol-Dependent Parents May Influence Psychopathology in Offspring
Teaser: A new study shows that the sexes of alcohol-dependent parents and their children can influence the child's risk of developing psychiatric illnesses, especially for female children of alcoholic women.

Headlines: Many Lung Cancer Patients Stopped Smoking Years Before Diagnosis
Teaser: The stigma that people did this to themselves is still attached to lung cancer, although the perception is challenged by a new study.

Headlines: Vitamin B6, Methionine Linked to Lower Risk for Lung Cancer
Teaser: In a large cohort study, serum levels of vitamin B6 and methionine were inversely associated with risk for lung cancer.

Headlines: Symposium Urges Human Rights Approach to Treating HIV in Drug Users
Teaser: To stem the HIV/AIDS epidemic, HIV-infected drug users must have access to adequate healthcare services without penalty, AIDS leaders and activists say.

Headlines: Vienna Declaration Urges Global Decriminalization of Drug Use
Teaser: Eastern Europe typically has extremely strict antidrug laws; not coincidentally, more than 80% of HIV patients are injecting drug users. Hence, the Vienna Declaration.

Headlines: Two Prognostic Indicators in the Early Course of Schizophrenia
Teaser: Dr. Michael Compton discusses using age and mode of onset of psychotic symptoms to predict prognosis and facilitate early intervention in psychotic disorders.

Headlines: Significant Increase in Prescription Pain Reliever Abuse, Subsequent Hospital Admissions
Teaser: In a new study, SAMSHA researchers found a 400% increase in substance abuse admissions due to the misuse of prescription pain relievers -- a finding that cuts across all ages, sexes, and ethnicities.

Headlines: Single Screening Question May Identify Drug Use in Primary Care
Teaser: A single screening question accurately identified drug use in a sample of primary care patients, suggesting that it would be a useful screen in primary care.

Headlines: REMS for Opioids: FDA as a Stakeholder in Problems of Pain and Addiction
Teaser: Dr. Steven Passik offers 4 potential fixes toward a better REMS.

Headlines: What Do Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies Mean for Primary Care?
Teaser: Dr. Bill McCarberg summarizes the potential impact of the FDA's upcoming Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies initiative and how it may affect primary care practitioners.

Headlines: A Man With Unsteady Gait
Teaser: Test your knowledge with this imaging case challenge of a 49-year-old man with difficulty walking and frequent falls.

Headlines: Prescription Monitoring Programs: Do They Work?
Teaser: How well do prescription monitoring programs detect and solve doctor shopping for prescription pain medication?

Headlines: A Tough One to Chew On: Smokeless Tobacco and Teens
Teaser: Learn about all of the trendy -- and dangerous -- forms of smokeless tobacco that are tempting our teens.

Headlines: Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS): A Short Critique
Teaser: Dr. John F. Peppin highlights the shortcomings of the FDA's upcoming REMS initiative and offers his recommendations for improving the plan.

Headlines: Effectiveness of TWEAK and T-ACE in Determining Problem Drinkers in Pregnancy
Teaser: Both TWEAK and T-ACE have been used to screen pregnant women for problem drinking. Is one a more effective tool than the other?

Headlines: Current Opportunities in Tobacco Control: CDC Grand Rounds
Teaser: What techniques are in place to encourage smoking cessation and tobacco control around the world? This new report discusses strategies in the field of tobacco control, such as aggressive media campaigns.

Headlines: Circadian Clock Gene Polymorphisms in Alcohol Use Disorders
Teaser: Do variations in genes that are related to the circadian pacemaker system predispose to alcohol dependence and abuse?

Headlines: The Adult Hepatitis Vaccine Project -- California, 2007-2008
Teaser: The hepatitis B vaccine was first released in the early 1980s. Read this new report that summarizes a California program that provides the hepatitis B vaccine to at risk patients.

Headlines: Treating Opioid Addiction From Your Office
Teaser: Dr. Ashwin Patkar discusses means of optimizing opioid addiction management.

Headlines: Patterns of Methamphetamine Use During Pregnancy
Teaser: This new study looks at the prevalence of methamphetamine use during pregnancy, and how prenatal care may help women who are drug abusers.

Headlines: Tan Addiction
Teaser: Might chronic use of indoor tanning involve the same drives as other forms of substance abuse?

Headlines: Drug-Induced Black Hairy Tongue
Teaser: Predisposing factors for this self-limiting disorder include smoking, alcohol use, and chronic dry mouth.

Headlines: Medication Overuse Headache: Withdrawal and Prophylactic Therapeutic Regimen
Teaser: proposed regimen for the management of medication overuse headache, involving a rapid withdrawal of the overused drug and prophylactic treatment to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

Headlines: Is Dextromethorphan a Concern for False Positives in Urine Drug Screening?
Teaser: Dextromethorphan appears strikingly similar to the opiates when performing an initial drug screen. What approach should be taken to rule out false-positives?

Headlines: Ecstasy Overdoses at a New Year's Eve Rave -- Los Angeles, California, 2010
Teaser: This new study looks at drug overdose data, with a specific focus on ecstasy.

Headlines: Do Symptoms Predict COPD in Smokers?
Teaser: Routine screening of older smokers for COPD may help identify previously undiagnosed cases.

Headlines: Early Cannabis Use and Estimated Risk of Later Onset of Depression Spells
Teaser: Does cannabis use at a young age increase the risk of depression later in life?

Headlines: ED Visits Involving Nonmedical Use of Prescription Drugs -- US, 2004-2008
Teaser: How common are overdoses with prescription drugs? This new study looks at recent emergency room data.

Headlines: Opiate and Opioid ("Narcotic") Therapy for Acute Migraine Headache
Teaser: Short-acting narcotics can be extremely useful in treating acute pain of migraine, but their use must be closely monitored by physician and patient.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Stroke: A Global Study
Teaser: Do you know the nine modifiable factors which account for 90% of stroke incidence worldwide?

Headlines: Practice Guide for Continuous Opioid Therapy for Refractory Daily Headache
Teaser: Guidelines for the use and limitations of continuous opioid therapy for treatment of refractory daily headache.

Headlines: Proteomics in Asthma and Smoking-Related Lung Diseases
Teaser: Read how advances in proteomic analysis are providing exciting potential in the early detection, diagnosis and staging, and improved management of smoking-related lung diseases.

Headlines: Spill Shows Need for Mental Health Awareness as Part of Disaster Preparedness
Teaser: In the wake of the Deepwater Horizon oil disaster, several agencies have joined together to provide tips on recognizing and managing mental health problems in the setting of catastrophe.

Headlines: Binge Drinking Heightens Death Risk in Those With High Blood Pressure
Teaser: Heavy binge drinkers with hypertension have a 12-fold increased risk for cardiovascular mortality, a new study shows.

Headlines: Cigarette Smoke Influences Lung Gene Expression at Lowest Levels
Teaser: Very low levels of tobacco smoke exposure can result in gene expression changes that are less extensive but similar to those of active smokers -- a finding that supports smoking bans.

Headlines: Smoking Addiction Linked to Abnormal Cue Reactivity and Diminished Error Processing
Teaser: More evidence links abnormal cue reactivity to behavioral and substance-related addictions and suggests diminished ability to process errors may underlie nicotine dependence.

Headlines: E-Cigarettes -- Are They Really Safe Alternatives to Real Cigarettes?
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD, discusses electronic cigarettes -- whether they are safe and effective, and the FDA's role.

Headlines: Alcoholism Can Damage Episodic Memory, Awareness of Memory Deficits
Teaser: New research suggests chronic alcoholism can negatively affect executive function, episodic memory, and metamemory -- a deficit that patients themselves are often unaware of.

Headlines: Prenatal Cigarette Exposure Increases Risk for Psychiatric Illness Into Adulthood
Teaser: Prenatal exposure to more than 10 cigarettes per day may have a lasting negative impact on the mental health of offspring.

Headlines: Youth Tobacco Use: Downward Trend Is Slowing
Teaser: A CDC report shows current cigarette smoking by high school students is about 17%.

Headlines: Risky Combo: Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Forms
Teaser: Using a combination of cigarettes and other types of tobacco is linked to higher risk of disease.

Headlines: Association of Amphetamine Abuse and Aortic Dissection
Teaser: In a young adult population, the association of amphetamine abuse with aortic dissection was as strong as or stronger than for some probably better-recognized risk factors.

Headlines: Differences in Cholinergic Function Identified in Brains of Cocaine Addicts
Teaser: Significant differences in cholinergic functioning have been identified in cocaine-addicted patients compared with healthy control patients in regions of the brain involved in the addiction process.

Headlines: Headache in Teens Related to Lack of Exercise, Weight Gain, Smoking
Teaser: Almost a third of teenagers in a new study of adolescents with headache had low physical activity.

Headlines: Methylphenidate May Help Combat Cocaine Addiction
Teaser: A new study shows that intravenous methylphenidate, a drug commonly used to treat ADHD, may help cocaine-addicted patients control their impulses.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sublingual Film Formulation of Buprenorphine/Naloxone
Teaser: Previously only available in sublingual tablet form, buprenorphine/naloxone in the form of a sublingual film will become available in starting in October 2010.

Headlines: Characterization of COPD Heterogeneity in the ECLIPSE Cohort
Teaser: COPD is a complex disease, with clinical, functional, and radiological presentations that vary greatly from patient to patient. The authors aim to find some common characteristics.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: HIV-Infected Crack Cocaine Users Who Have Never Been to Outpatient HIV Care
Teaser: What is the reason why some HIV infected people, drug users in particular, don't seek help with their illness?

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking May Increase Depressive Symptoms in Adolescents
Teaser: A new cohort study suggests that teenage smokers who use cigarettes as a form of self-medication may be more susceptible to increased depressive symptoms.

Headlines: Recent Trends in Exposure to Secondhand Smoke in the US Population
Teaser: This study gives an overview of the dangers of secondhand smoke, and the many adverse health risks that can arise.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Opioid Use in the Treatment of Chronic Noncancer Pain in Older Adults
Teaser: Chronic pain is a highly prevalent, costly, and often disabling disorder in later life. Can opioids provide safe relief?

Headlines: Cigarette Use Among High School Students -- United States, 1991-2009
Teaser: How well do young students respond to non-smoking campaigns? This report reviews the recent data.

Headlines: New Types of Smokeless Tobacco Pose a Growing Threat to Youth
Teaser: What are some of the new smokeless tobacco products on the market, and what danger do they potentially pose to young people?

Headlines: Prescribed Medications and Potential False-Positive Urine Drug Screens
Teaser: Which drugs have been associated with a false-positive urine drug screen?

Headlines: Methamphetamine Abuse May Raise Risk for Parkinson's Disease
Teaser: A preliminary study suggests greater than 2-fold increased risk in regular users; researchers caution more study is needed.

Headlines: Call for Stricter Limits on Tobacco and Alcohol Advertising to Prevent Pediatric Alcohol and Drug Abuse
Teaser: The AAP has issued a new policy statement that calls for a ban on tobacco advertising in all media, limitations on alcohol advertising, and no television advertisements for ED drugs until 10 pm.

Headlines: Smoking Ban at Psychiatric Hospital Linked to Increase in Involuntary Admissions
Teaser: The number of walk-ins decreased and rate of involuntary admissions increased after a smoking ban at Canada's largest psychiatric hospital.

Headlines: Top Investigators Awarded for Novel Approaches to Addiction Research
Teaser: Four top scientists are the recipients of the first annual NIDA Avant-Garde Awards to support their novel approaches to treat tobacco and cocaine addiction.

Headlines: New Tool Detects Illicit Substance Use in Pregnancy
Teaser: The Substance Use Risk Profile-Pregnancy scale detects the use of a range of substances, such as alcohol and illicit drugs, in pregnant women.

Headlines: Acetyl-l-Carnitine for Alcohol Craving and Relapse Prevention
Teaser: Avoiding relapse and decreasing craving are major challenges for recovering alcoholics. Can the endogenous compound acetyl-l-carnitine help?

Headlines: Total Smoking Bans in Psychiatric Inpatient Services: Benefits and Barriers
Teaser: How can smoking bans benefit psychiatric patients, especially in hospital settings?

Headlines: Cannabis Use Increases Psychosis Risk and Persistence of Subclinical Psychosis
Teaser: Cannabis use, usually in relationship with other triggers, appears to increase the risk for psychotic episodes, even among individuals with no previous history of psychosis.

Headlines: Acamprosate May Be Helpful to Treat Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: A systematic review shows that acamprosate appears to be effective and safe for supporting continuous abstinence after detoxification in alcohol-dependent patients.

Headlines: Decline in Adult Smoking in the US Has Ended
Teaser: One in 5 American adults smoke and it's been that way since 2005.

Headlines: Mental Illness Stigma Persists Among Americans
Teaser: Despite efforts to reduce stigma attached to mental illness, Americans still perceive it as shameful.

Headlines: SNPs Used in Smoking Cessation Study Are Public Info, Author Says
Teaser: A study author writes a letter to the editor to correct a potential false impression that the basis of the genotype score used in his study was not publicly disclosed.

Headlines: Using Ecstasy Heightens Sleep Apnea Risk
Teaser: The drug alters serotonin in the brain and can have long-term consequences. Obstructive sleep apnea can lead to cognitive dysfunction, metabolic syndrome, and cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Dietary Restrictions in Adolescents Linked to Smoking-Related Weight Concerns
Teaser: A large cross-sectional study in adolescents showed that dietary restrictions in teenagers are significantly associated with smoking-related weight concerns.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Main Driver of Increase in Rates of Substance Use
Teaser: Illicit drug use in the United States continues to increase and marijuana appears to be a major driver.

Headlines: Association Between Intimate Partner Violence, Alcohol and Depression
Teaser: Can the complex relationship between depressive symptoms, fear of a domestic partner, and hazardous drinking be quantified?

Headlines: Is Hookah Harmful?
Teaser: Many people mistakenly think that hookah is a safer alternative to smoking cigarettes.

Headlines: US Psychiatric Resources: A Country in Crisis
Teaser: Medscape interviews Drs. Richard Weisler, Henry Nasrallah, and Joe Parks on the alarming lack of psychiatric resources in the United States and what clinicians can do to address this problem.

Headlines: Fruit, Vegetable Intake Linked to Lower Lung Cancer Risk in Smokers
Teaser: A prospective cohort study shows that variety in fruit and vegetable consumption may decrease lung cancer risk in smokers, independent from the quantity consumed.

Headlines: RA Prevention: Watch Out for Risk Factors
Teaser: Dr. Kevin Deane reviews 3 recent studies exploring factors contributing to the development of RA.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Naltrexone Extended-Release Injectable Suspension for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: An FDA committee supports the use of naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension for the treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Smoking Ban Reduces Childhood Asthma Hospital Admissions
Teaser: A smoking ban initiated in Scotland in 2006 was found not only to decrease public exposure to smoke but also to decrease asthma hospital admissions for children.

Headlines: Long-Term Opioid Use Linked to Increased ED Visits, Drug and Alcohol Problems
Teaser: Long-term use of opioids with a high potential for dependence and abuse may increase the risk for emergency department visits and drug and alcohol problems.

Headlines: Combination of Bipolar Disorder and Substance Abuse Ups Risk for Violent Crime
Teaser: Patients with BD are more than twice as likely to commit a violent crime as individuals in the general population.

Headlines: AHA Says No Smokeless Tobacco
Teaser: Snuff, chewing tobacco, and other smokeless-tobacco products aren't safe alternatives to smoking cigarettes, nor should they be used to aid in smoking cessation, according to the American Heart Association.

Headlines: E-Cigarette Firms Get FDA Warning
Teaser: Five electronic cigarette companies were cited for "violations" of drug safety laws.

Headlines: Antiepileptics May Increase Nicotine Metabolism, Hamper Smoking Cessation Efforts
Teaser: A new study shows that carbamazepine increased hepatic metabolism in mentally ill smokers, leading to concerns that these medications may increase nicotine cravings and hamper cessation efforts.

Headlines: Recognizing Suicide Risk Factors in Primary and Psychiatric Care
Teaser: Dr. Larry Culpepper discusses how best to recognize and manage suicidality and suicidal ideation in both the primary care and psychiatric care settings.

Headlines: Should Heroin Be Prescribed to Chronic Heroin-Dependent Patients?
Teaser: Dr. Peter Yellowlees talks about heroin maintenance for chronic heroin-dependent individuals.

Headlines: Pipes and Cigars -- Into the Trash With the Cigarettes
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD, debunks the myths that pipes and cigars are not that harmful and that no one inhales.

Headlines: Nicotine Dependence Linked to Suicide Attempts
Teaser: After controlling for comorbid psychiatric conditions, a large cross-sectional study shows a robust association between nicotine dependence and attempted suicide.

Headlines: Current Cigarette Smoking Among Adults Aged ≥18 Years -- United States, 2009
Teaser: Despite the well known adverse effects of smoking, are rates declining in the US? This new report looks at the latest data.

Headlines: Smokers Experience More Postoperative Pain Than Nonsmokers
Teaser: Study shows that smokers experience more severe pain after ambulatory surgery and might be more vulnerable to developing chronic pain.

Headlines: ACOG Issues Recommendations for Providers to Support Perinatal Smoking Cessation
Teaser: Use of the 5A's, healthcare support systems, and pharmacotherapy add to the strategies providers can use to help women stop smoking during pregnancy.

Headlines: More Evidence Light Drinking During Pregnancy May Not Be Harmful to Offspring
Teaser: On the heels of a controversial British study showing light drinking during pregnancy is not harmful to offspring, a new study from Australia that supports the earlier findings has just been released.

Headlines: Fetal Alcohol Exposure Linked to Altered Cognitive Processing
Teaser: Binge drinking in pregnancy may cause altered neurophysiologic processing of response inhibition and recognition memory in the offspring.

Headlines: Once-Monthly Naltrexone Approved for Treatment of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension (Vivitrol), already approved for alcohol dependence, now approved for opioid addiction.

Headlines: Heavy Smoking in Midlife Doubles the Risk for Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Heavy smoking in midlife doubles the risk for Alzheimer's disease and other forms of dementia.

Headlines: Variants in Region of Ethanol Metabolism Gene Predict Alcoholism Risk
Teaser: New findings suggest that drugs targeting CYP2E1 expression might moderate intoxication and alcohol consumption.

Headlines: Sublingual Buprenorphine Relieves Symptoms of Neonatal Opioid Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: A new phase 1 study suggests that sublingual buprenorphine is safe and more effective than oral morphine in treating infants with neonatal opioid syndrome.

Headlines: CDC: Binge Drinking 'Huge U.S. Health Problem'
Teaser: Binge drinking rates are the highest in Wisconsin and the lowest in Tennessee.

Headlines: Low-Cannabidiol Strains of Cannabis May Impair Memory
Teaser: A new study suggests cannabidiol may have a protective effect against the memory-impairing effects of THC in marijuana.

Headlines: Blood Tests Say Drunk Drivers Escaping Conviction
Teaser: Crashing a car while drunk and landing in the emergency room would seem like a direct route to a DUI conviction.

Headlines: Risk for Future Substance Abuse for Anxious Patients Who Self-Medicate
Teaser: New research shows there is an increased risk for future substance abuse among people who self-medicated their anxiety disorders.

Headlines: Nonsmokers' Exposure to Secondhand Smoke -- United States, 1999-2008
Teaser: How dangerous is secondhand smoke? This new report looks at the types of diseases that can result from exposure.

Headlines: Opiate Replacement Treatment Reduces Mortality in Addicted Patients
Teaser: New research from Britain finds that opiate replacement treatment for at least a year by drug misusers can lead to a decrease in overall mortality of more than 85%.

Headlines: Conduct Disorder in Adolescence Predicts Substance Use Disorders in Adulthood
Teaser: Pediatricians should focus on adolescent ADHD when it progresses to conduct disorder, because conduct disorder is a major predictor of substance abuse disorders in adulthood.

Headlines: Anti-cocaine Vaccine Development
Teaser: This new study explains how a vaccine could potentially help those fighting a cocaine addiction.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implants May Be Effective for Opioid Dependence, Phase 3 Study Suggests
Teaser: A large randomized controlled trial suggests a subdermal implant may be effective in treating opioid dependence.

Headlines: Smoking in Top-Grossing Movies -- United States, 1991-2009
Teaser: How is smoking, and tobacco products in general, depicted in movies, and what are the ramifications for young people?

Headlines: Tobacco Use Among Middle and High School Students -- United States, 2000-2009
Teaser: Read this report to get the latest data from this past decade on tobacco use among students.

Headlines: Alcohol Increases Circulatory Disease Mortality in Russia
Teaser: This Russian study looks at the effects of both chronic hazardous drinking and short-term acute episodes of heavy drinking on circulatory disease mortality.

Headlines: Anxiety Disorders Make It Harder to Stop Smoking
Teaser: People with a history of anxiety disorders have an impaired ability to quit smoking and are resistant to pharmacotherapy.

Headlines: Detecting and Dealing With Substance Abuse Disorders in Primary Care
Teaser: Primary care clinicians are in a unique position to diagnose and coordinate treatment in patients with substance abuse disorders.

Headlines: Any Tobacco Use in 13 States -- BRFSS, 2008
Teaser: What are the latest figures on tobacco use in the US? This report looks closely at 13 states.

Headlines: Alcohol and Sleep Problems in Primary Care Patients
Teaser: Alcohol abuse and sleep problems are both prevalent in primary care practice, but how are they interrelated?

Headlines: Tobacco Smoking and Hand Eczema: A Population-Based Study
Teaser: Tobacco smoking has been linked in several studies as a possible risk factor for hand eczema, but findings have not been conclusive. Is there a dose-related association?

Headlines: Smoking Increases Odds of Postoperative Morbidity and Mortality
Teaser: Smokers are at significantly higher risk than nonsmokers for mortality and a wide range of morbidities after noncardiac surgery, including intubation, mechanical ventilation, and pneumonia.

Headlines: Alcohol Is More Harmful Than Heroin, Crack
Teaser: New research shows alcohol is the most harmful drug overall and is almost 3 times more harmful than cocaine or tobacco.

Headlines: Bipolar Disorder Linked to Greater Suicide Risk vs Other Mental Disorders
Teaser: A new study of more than 3 million veterans finds that 9% of those who committed suicide had bipolar disorder, making it a higher risk factor than schizophrenia, depression, PTSD, and other disorders.

Headlines: The Effectiveness of Interventions to Change Six Health Behaviours
Teaser: How can interventions change behavior, and encourage both children and adults to lead a healthier life?

Headlines: No Doubt Now: Smoking Increases Risk for Breast Cancer Death
Teaser: A new study is the strongest to date on smoking and breast cancer mortality.

Headlines: Alcohol Use for Sleep Strongly Linked to Hazardous vs Moderate Drinking
Teaser: In a report from the AAFP National Research Network, moderate and hazardous drinking were linked to few sleep problems, but alcohol use for sleep was strongly linked to hazardous drinking.

Headlines: Dairy Products and Black Tea Deter Lung Cancer
Teaser: Milk and dairy products reduce lung cancer rates in smokers; black tea is more beneficial to nonsmokers.

Headlines: More Details Released on Landmark Lung Cancer Screening Trial
Teaser: Screening for lung cancer with computed tomography has shown a mortality benefit.

Headlines: FDA Proposes New Cigarette Warning Labels
Teaser: New warning labels would be larger and more graphic.

Headlines: Increased Dopamine Release May Make Men More Susceptible to Alcoholism
Teaser: A new study suggests that an increased dopamine release in the ventral striatum part of men's brains after drinking alcohol may be strongly associated with the positive effects of intoxication.

Headlines: Adolescents at Risk for Alcohol Abuse Show Increased Brain Activation
Teaser: A new study suggests that adolescents with a possible genetic risk for alcoholism demonstrate greater frontal lobe activity during response inhibition than those without this history.

Headlines: Consumption of Energy Drinks Linked to Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: Energy drink consumption is associated with dependence on alcohol, new research suggests.

Headlines: FDA Issues Warnings to Manufacturers of Caffeinated Alcoholic Beverages
Teaser: A scientific review of the deleterious health effects of caffeinated alcohol products has prompted the FDA to issue warnings to 4 makers of these products. The companies have 15 days to respond.

Headlines: Binge Drinking: Cause of National Disparities in Heart Disease?
Teaser: The binge-drinking culture that exists in Northern Ireland is likely contributing to heart disease there, French scientists say.

Headlines: Preventing Disease Through Rapid Engagement by Primary Care Teams
Teaser: A protocol for an evaluation of a training intervention for a variety of health risk behaviors is proposed.

Headlines: Tobacco Cessation via Public Dental Clinics: Results of a Randomized Trial
Teaser: Do tobacco cessation programs run out of dental clinics help patients quit? This study takes a look.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Cigarette Smoking and Adenocarcinomas of the Esophagus
Teaser: A dose-response relationship between smoking and esophageal cancer is identified, but can the risk be reversed with smoking cessation?

Headlines: Tobacco Use: A Chronic Illness?
Teaser: What is the connection between tobacco use, cigarette smoking in particular, and the likelihood of contracting other diseases?

Headlines: Adolescent Smoking: Recent Findings on Peer Group Influences
Teaser: This new review explores the effect of peer pressure on an adolescent's decision to take up smoking.

Headlines: AHRQ Studies Detail ED Use for Mental Health & Substance Abuse Disorders
Teaser: Nearly 12 million visits made to emergency departments in 2007 involved people with a mental disorder, substance abuse problem, or both.

Headlines: Mental Health Stability in Veterans With PTSD Receiving Varenicline
Teaser: This smoking cessation agent may have detrimental effects on mental health.

Headlines: Binge Drinking Among High School Students and Adults -- United States, 2009
Teaser: What is the prevalence of binge drinking among young men, and how can it be curtailed?

Headlines: Baclofen Can Ease Symptoms of Acute Alcohol Withdrawal
Teaser: A short course of baclofen can quickly neutralize alcohol withdrawal symptoms, with fewer risks than standard-of-care treatment.

Headlines: Gene Variants May Influence Differential Effects of Cannabis on Psychosis Expression
Teaser: Recent use of cannabis is associated with positive schizotypy in unaffected siblings of patients with psychosis.

Headlines: Gene Variant Linked to Depression in Alcohol-Dependent Individuals
Teaser: A new study investigating the co-occurrence of alcohol dependence and depressive symptoms demonstrates the value of looking at comorbidities in studies of genetic association.

Headlines: HIV Interventions for Female Prisoners
Teaser: Healthcare professionals are challenged to find HIV interventions for women that are gender specific and effective for this high-risk group.

Headlines: Can a Brief Intervention Reduce Adolescent Violence and Alcohol Misuse?
Teaser: An intervention provided right when it is needed could prove more effective than addressing the issue days or weeks later.

Headlines: At Last, a Screening Test for Lung Cancer
Teaser: Dr. Mark Kris reports on the National Cancer Institute landmark study that found that use of low-dose helical CT scans provides a 20% reduction in mortality in current and previous smokers.

Headlines: The Impact of Alcohol Marketing on Youth Drinking Behaviour
Teaser: Is alcohol marketing driving our youth to drink? This study examines the impact of traditional and non-traditional marketing channels, such as sponsorship and e-marketing, on adolescent alcohol use.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Children at Risk for Suicide Attempt and Attempt-related Injuries
Teaser: What factors increase risk for suicide attempts among boys and girls?

Headlines: State Medicaid Coverage for Tobacco-Dependence Treatments -- US, 2009
Teaser: How easy is it to access state sponsored tobacco cessation treatment programs? This new report takes a look.

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking Linked to Greater Risk for RA in African Americans
Teaser: African Americans with more than 10 pack-years of smoking have increased risk for autoantibody positive and negative rheumatoid arthritis, particularly among those positive for HLA-DRB1 shared epitope.

Headlines: 1% of All Deaths Worldwide Caused by Passive Smoking
Teaser: A new study suggests that among the 600,000 deaths that occur worldwide from passive smoking, more than 25% are among children and 47% among adult women.

Headlines: Effect of Smoking Status on Total Energy Expenditure
Teaser: Individuals who stop smoking often report weight gain, but the mechanism is unclear. Might nicotine's effect on metabolic rate increase energy expenditure?

Headlines: Smoking, Outcomes, and Early Clopidogrel use in ACS
Teaser: Does smoking affect clopidogrel's potency ­in the acute coronary syndrome setting, or is there a GRACE period?

Headlines: How Ethanol and Nicotine Feed Each Other's Habits
Teaser: Nicotine and ethanol induce expression of the same enzymes -- and genetic variants might be the difference between casual use and addiction.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Overused in Alcohol Withdrawal, With Significant Adverse Effects
Teaser: Prescribing rates of controlled medications to teens and young adults are increasing.

Headlines: Quitting Smoking May Improve Mood
Teaser: A retrospective study finds that elevated doses of benzodiazepines are associated with increases in delirium tremens and delirium.

Headlines: Study Highlights Prevalence of Drug Test Cheating and How to Combat It
Teaser: A new study challenges the notion that quitting smoking can make individuals feel depressed.

Headlines: Neurocognitive Impairment and HIV Risk Factors
Teaser: How can HIV be prevented in people with cognitive impairment, and what are the risk factors for this specific population?

Headlines: Medicaid Smoking Help
Teaser: New research finds that veterans who incorporate a smoking cessation program into their mental healthcare for PTSD have higher smoking abstinence rates than those referred to standalone programs.

Headlines: Despite FDA Warning, State Bans, Dangerous Practice of Mixing Energy Drinks With Alcohol Continues
Teaser: Massachusetts' policy of lowering barriers to smoking-cessation assistance for low-income individuals appears to be making a positive impact on heart disease, a new study shows.

Headlines: Buprenorphine for Addiction in Pregnancy Reduces Symptoms of Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: Researchers are calling for more research on the health consequences of combining caffeine and alcohol, saying bans on caffeinated alcoholic beverages will not solve the problem.

Headlines: 30 Million Americans Admit They Drive Drunk
Teaser: Infants of opioid-dependent women who take buprenorphine during pregnancy have fewer symptoms of neonatal abstinence syndrome.

Headlines: Moderate Alcohol Intake May Raise Risk for Amphetamine Abuse
Teaser: Ten million Americans admit to getting behind the wheel under the influence of illicit drugs, a new study finds.

Headlines: Daily Marijuana Use in Teens Highest Since the 1970s
Teaser: Mounting evidence suggests moderate drinkers may be more sensitive to the reinforcing effects of stimulants.

Headlines: Secondhand Smoke Exposure Linked to Mental Disorders in Children
Teaser: A significant increase in marijuana use among US youth, especially in preteens, including a jump in daily use, are among the key findings of an annual national survey.

Headlines: Methadone Exposure Tied to Poor Perinatal Outcome
Teaser: New study of more than 900 nonsmoking children suggests an association between higher salivary cotinine levels and poorer mental health, especially hyperactivity and conduct disorder.

Headlines: Smoking May Worsen Pain for Cancer Patients
Teaser: Women on methadone are at risk for a variety of perinatal problems, Irish researchers report. Moreover, neonatal abstinence syndrome was related to methadone intake in their study.

Headlines: SIDS Cases Typically Spike on New Year's Day
Teaser: Patients with cancer who continue to smoke despite their diagnosis experience greater pain severity than those who quit or who have never smoked.

Headlines: Drug Overdoses on the Rise in Most Age Groups
Teaser: The number of babies who die of SIDS typically surges by 33% on New Year's Day, probably because their caregivers celebrate with alcohol the night before.

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking and Smokeless Tobacco Use Among Adults -- US, 2009
Teaser: What is the latest data on smoking and smokeless tobacco use, and what are some of the preventive measures being taken to curb tobacco use of all kind?

Headlines: Integrating Smoking Cessation Into PTSD Treatment Improves Abstinence From Cigarettes
Teaser: A retrospective review of emergency department activity in New Orleans during Hurricane Gustav showed a high rate of consultations for substance-related disorders.

Headlines: Substance-Related Disorders Need Consideration in Hurricane Preparedness
Teaser: Cheating on drug screens is common, but a new study suggests ways that clinicians can spot attempts at dilution, adulteration, and substitution of samples.

Headlines: Smoking Reduces Response to Early RA Treatments
Teaser: Current (but not past) smokers have more aggressive rheumatoid arthritis and are less responsive to treatment.

Headlines: ADHD Among Longer-Term Prison Inmates
Teaser: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder is present in a surprisingly large number of long-term prison inmates, often coexisting with substance abuse and mood disorders.

Headlines: Racial Disparities in Smoking-Attributable Mortality
Teaser: This new report explores the trends in smoking among different racial groups in the US.

Headlines: Syringe Exchange Programs -- United States, 2008
Teaser: This new report outlines syringe exchange programs in the US, and how they can help prevent the transmission of various diseases.

Headlines: Reasons for Illicit Drug Use in People With Schizophrenia
Teaser: What specific factors cause many schizophrenic patients to use street drugs? A better understanding may help clinicians tailor management of substance abuse to an individual patient's beliefs.

Headlines: Smoking Restrictions in Large-Hub Airports -- US, 2002 and 2010
Teaser: What measures are being taken in US airports to curtail indoor smoking?

Headlines: Impact of Screening and Brief Intervention in ED Patients' Alcohol Use
Teaser: While substantial numbers of emergency department patients have alcohol problems, interventions are rarely done. Could an intervention in the ED provide long-lasting results?

Headlines: Bupropion, Varenicline May Decrease Brain Reactivity to Smoking Cues
Teaser: Two brain imaging studies show smoking cessation medications bupropion and varenicline may change the way the brain reacts to smoking cues, making it easier to curb cravings.

Headlines: The Case of the Thirsty Writer Who Lives No More
Teaser: Guess both the patient and his physician's diagnosis in another historical case from this popular series.

Headlines: Genes Predict Success of Ondansetron Treatment for Alcoholism
Teaser: Alcoholic people with a specific genotype had fewer drinks and more abstinent days during ondansetron treatment compared with those with other genotypes.

Headlines: Passive Smoking Raises BP of Preschool Children, New Research Shows
Teaser: Children as young as four or five have raised blood pressure if their parents smoke, a new study from Germany shows. The findings should provide further impetus for parents to stop smoking or at the very least to implement smoke-free homes, say the researchers.

Headlines: Are Opioids Safe?
Teaser: In light of the rise in unintentional poisoning deaths due to opioid analgesics, Dr. Charles Argoff discusses the appropriate selection and use of pain therapies.

Headlines: U.S. Smoking Rates Keep Life Expectancy Down
Teaser: A study shows high smoking rates in earlier decades affects life spans in U.S.

Headlines: Drug-Induced Deaths More Common Than Alcohol- or Firearm-Related Fatalities
Teaser: A new report from the CDC finds rates of drug-induced deaths are significantly higher for males than females, especially for non-Hispanic white and black males.

Headlines: Nicotine Replacement Therapy May Reduce Agitation in Schizophrenia
Teaser: In nicotine-dependent patients, nicotine patches were associated with about one-third the level of agitation compared with placebo.

Headlines: Vaccine Blocks Cocaine High, Animal Study Shows
Teaser: Scientists have developed a vaccine strategy that makes mice immune to the exhilarating effects of cocaine.

Headlines: FDA Challenges Tobacco Companies
Teaser: Makers of tobacco products that have been changed since Feb. 15, 2007, must show the "new" products are no worse for public health or see the products banned in the U.S., the FDA today ruled.

Headlines: Factors Predicting Relapse in Depressed and Bipolar Alcoholics
Teaser: This prospective study looks at factors effecting relapse following an inpatient program in a group of alcohol-dependent subjects with co-existing bipolar or unipolar affective disorder.

Headlines: Active Smoking Before First Birth Linked to Increased Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: A prospective cohort study shows that active smoking, especially smoking before the first birth, may be associated with a modest increase in the risk for breast cancer.

Headlines: Program Helps Medical Students Identify Patients At Risk for Addiction
Teaser: Current instruction on substance abuse and addiction varies widely from one medical school to the next.

Headlines: Childhood BMI, Weight May Mediate Associations of Prenatal Factors With SBP
Teaser: Childhood body mass index or weight trajectory may mediate the associations of heavy maternal smoking and prepregnancy body mass index with systolic blood pressure.

Headlines: Transient ST Elevation After Ketamine Intoxication
