Headlines: Early Menopause: Precursor to Coronary Heart Disease?
Teaser: Drs Scott Wright and Sharon Mulvagh discuss cardiovascular health in postmenopausal women: risk, hormones, and prevention.

Headlines: Medscape Intensivist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on intensivists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks intensivists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Infectious Disease Physician Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on infectious disease physicians' lifestyle and burnout but also asks ID physicians whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Neurologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on neurologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks neurologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Ob/Gyn Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on ob/gyns' lifestyle and burnout but also asks ob/gyns whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Nephrologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on nephrologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks nephrologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Pediatrician Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on pediatricians' lifestyle and burnout but also asks pediatricians whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Ophthalmologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on ophthalmologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks ophthalmologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Gastroenterologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on gastroenterologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks gastroenterologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Endocrinologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on endocrinologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks endocrinologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Oncologist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on oncologists' lifestyle and burnout but also asks oncologists whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Internist Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on physician lifestyle and burnout but also asks physicians whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Medscape Emergency Medicine Physician Lifestyle Report 2015
Teaser: This Medscape lifestyle survey not only updates a previous report on emergency medicine physicians' lifestyle and burnout but also asks EM physicians whether they have ever used marijuana, and if so, did they this year?

Headlines: Addiction Medicine Policy: First, Do No Harm
Teaser: Dr Lundberg recommends policies that just might diminish the unintended consequences of current tobacco, marijuana, and opioid policy.

Headlines: Saturated Fat and CAD: It's Complicated
Teaser: CAD guidelines call for a reduction in saturated fat consumption. With meta-analyses challenging the link between saturated fat and CAD risk, is it time to pardon this 'cardiovascular villain'?

Headlines: Life and Times of Leading Cardiologists: Janet Wright
Teaser: How did Dr Janet Wright get from a small town in Arkansas to her position as executive director of Million Hearts? Dr. Robert Califf finds out.

Headlines: Gauging Quality in Colonoscopy
Teaser: Dr David Johnson takes you through the highlights of the new performance targets for quality colonoscopy -- from getting consent to reviewing results with patients.

Headlines: European Physicians: 'Drug Testing OK' and 'Doc Knows Best'
Teaser: US and European physicians have some fascinating differences in medical and patient ethics, as revealed in Medscape's Ethics Survey Report.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: The State of the Science
Teaser: In this comprehensive review of the literature, Dr Michael Schatman discusses the available evidence and current controversies surrounding the use of cannabinoids in medicine.

Headlines: Do Physicians Use Marijuana?
Teaser: The Medscape Physician Lifestyle Report 2015 looks at marijuana use in physicians.

Headlines: US vs European Physicians: Their Ethical Differences
Teaser: US and European physicians have some fascinating differences in medical and patient ethics, as revealed in Medscape's Ethics Report.

Headlines: Statins in Primary Prevention: Welcome to the Gray Zone
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola discusses the risk/benefit challenge of primary-prevention statins in light of a recent MESA analysis.

Headlines: Oncologists Ethics Report 2014
Teaser: Oncologists deal regularly with issues of life and death. Medscape asked them how they feel about some of their toughest ethical dilemmas.

Headlines: Could Lifestyle Factors Prevent Heart Failure in Women?
Teaser: Dr JoAnn E. Manson summarizes a study reporting that women who followed healthy habits had a 77% lower risk for heart failure.

Headlines: How Impaired Physicians Can Be Helped
Teaser: More doctors need help than are getting it, even though programs with good track records in treating substance use disorders, behavioral problems, or burnout in physicians are increasingly available.

Headlines: Impairment Among Physicians Is Growing: Why?
Teaser: While some physicians struggle with drug and alcohol abuse, there are other impairments that also harm the lives of doctors today.

Headlines: Quiz: Is Your Knowledge of Physician Impairment Up-to-Date?
Teaser: How much do you know about physician problems with drug and alcohol abuse? What other issues create impairments? Which doctors are most at risk? Take this quiz and find out.

Headlines: Zero Calcium Score With Symptoms? Don't Get Too Comfortable
Teaser: An unusual case illustrates the importance of trusting your gut when the lab tests don’t quite fit the patient presentation.

Headlines: What's the Prognosis for Impaired Physicians?
Teaser: Physicians get just as addicted to alcohol and drugs as the general population, yet their treatment is more intensive and their outcomes are a good deal better. Here's why.

Headlines: Chemerin Is a Biomarker of ACS but not Angina Pectoris
Teaser: Are levels of this novel adipokine increased in patients with ACS or stable angina pectoris?

Headlines: Expression of Gut-homing B7 Receptor on T Cells
Teaser: This article analyzes microbial translocation and expression of the gut-homing B7 receptor on peripheral T cells in HIV-1-infected individuals.

Headlines: Novel Program Improves Outcomes in Young Psychosis Patients
Teaser: A personalized, comprehensive intervention for first-episode psychosis helps prevent hospitalization and improves outcomes in young patients.

Headlines: Danish Study: No Excess Pancreatitis Risk in Incretin Users
Teaser: Researchers found that users of all diabetes drug classes had elevated pancreatitis rates, which became nonsignificant after adjustment for confounders.

Headlines: Tobacco Exposure Among Youth Undergoing Cancer Treatment
Teaser: Are pediatric cancer patients more or less likely to be exposed to tobacco during treatment?

Headlines: General Practitioners Recognizing Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: Can assessment by a primary care physician identify patients with alcohol dependence as well as--or better than--a semistructured interview tool?

Headlines: Epigenetics in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: What role do epigenetic factors play in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis?

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Interventional Pulmonology for Asthma and Emphysema
Teaser: Sharpen your knowledge of bronchoscopic modalities for emphysema and asthma.

Headlines: Dentists' Self-Perceived Role in Offering Tobacco Cessation
Teaser: Dental settings remain an untapped venue for treatment of tobacco dependence. What's holding dentists back?

Headlines: Prediction of Mortality Using a Vascular Calcification Score
Teaser: Which calcified plaque scores best predict all-cause mortality in patients with type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Folate Intake, Serum Folate Levels, and Prostate Cancer Risk
Teaser: Can increased dietary intake of folate offer protection against prostate cancer? This study examined the association between dietary folate intake or serum folate levels and prostate morbidity.

Headlines: The Opioid-Free ED: Coming Soon to a Hospital Near You
Teaser: The emergency department (ED) can sometimes be the birthplace of opioid addiction, which is reason enough to find alternative effective nonopioid analgesics.

Headlines: Chronic Respiratory Diseases: Challenges in Diagnosis
Teaser: Get up-to-speed with the latest on accurately diagnosing COPD, bronchitis, and bronchiolitis.

Headlines: Neutrophil-Lymphocyte Ratio and Diabetic Nephropathy
Teaser: The neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio is an important predictor of coronary artery disease. Can it predict development of diabetic nephropathy?

Headlines: Non-vitamin K Antagonist Agents in Anticoagulant Naive AF
Teaser: What are the contemporary patterns of oral anticoagulation (OAC) use in patients with AF -- who weren't previously on OACs?

Headlines: Microvascular Complications and Foot Care
Teaser: Read the American Diabetes Association recommendations for screening and management of diabetic retinopathy, nephropathy, neuropathy, and foot care.

Headlines: Breast Arterial Calcification, Stroke, and CAD
Teaser: Is breast arterial calcification a strong predictor of the future development of CAD and stroke?

Headlines: Web-Based Diabetes Tool Helps Latino Patients Meet A1c Targets
Teaser: In low-income, urban Latino patients with type 2 diabetes and poorly controlled glycemia, HbA1c levels improved and patients were less distressed when     educators used a "diabetes dashboard."

Headlines: Hard-hitting Antismoking Campaign Shows Rotting Flesh
Teaser: Could a hard-hitting antismoking campaign launched in the United Kingdom to highlight the harms of smoking eliminate the habit all together?

Headlines: No Association Between Metformin Use and Lung Cancer
Teaser: Outcomes differed by smoking history and tumor type, however, although these findings were not significant. More research is needed before any firm     conclusions can be drawn, say the researchers.

Headlines: Smoking Knocks Breath out of TNFi for Axial Spondyloarthritis
Teaser: Smokers with axial spondyloarthritis had less improvement of symptoms than nonsmokers a year after starting on a tumor necrosis factor inhibitor, but the mechanism is unclear.

Headlines: Direct Link Between ADHD and Premature Death
Teaser: Individuals with ADHD are more than twice as likely to die prematurely.

Headlines: Celiac Disease Might Explain Fertility Problems
Teaser: Celiac disease may be at the root of some women's problems with infertility, Indian researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Okays Abuse-Deterrent Zohydro ER
Teaser: The controversial single-entity hydrocodone formulation will use BeadTek technology to provide abuse-deterrent properties without changing the release properties.

Headlines: Antipsychotic-Related Brain Loss: Does Class Matter?
Teaser: Depending on drug class, antipsychotic medications appear to be associated with gray matter loss in schizophrenia patients.

Headlines: Preconception Bariatric Surgery May Cut Risks for Mom, Fetus
Teaser: Obese women who undergo bariatric surgery before pregnancy have reduced risk for gestational diabetes and large-for-gestational-age infants, but risk for other adverse effects may be increased.

Headlines: The Joy of Dry Warmth: Saunas May Help Cut CVD Risk
Teaser: Dry air saunas may qualify as one of the most enjoyable lifestyle choices for heart health, and the more it's done, the better the outcomes--suggests a     large, long-term cohort study from Finland.

Headlines: More Sensitive CT Lung Cancer Screening May Be Needed: Study
Teaser: The number of patients with lung cancer meeting criteria for computed tomography (CT) screening has fallen, and more sensitive screening criteria may be needed, report researchers from the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: HIV Infection, Cardiovascular Risk, and Risk for Acute MI
Teaser: This study examines cardiovascular disease and MI risk factors in HIV infected individuals.

Headlines: Lapses in Diagnoses, Care Tied to 91% of New HIV Infections
Teaser: Focusing prevention efforts on diagnosing and keeping patients on antiretrovirals could greatly decrease spread in the United States, but would come with considerable difficulty and cost.

Headlines: Chronotherapy for Depression: Rapid, Large, Stable Effect
Teaser: Short-term wake therapy plus long-term bright-light therapy is an effective and feasible way to attain and maintain remission in major depression.

Headlines: Do Psychedelics Prevent Suicide?
Teaser: Psychedelic drugs, including LSD, may help prevent suicidality, adding support to the view that their restricted status should be changed to facilitate research into their therapeutic potential.

Headlines: Infant Gut Microbes Shape Future Health and Allergy Risk
Teaser: Experts suggest that the first 6 months of life is a therapeutic window of opportunity to reshape a dysfunctional microbiome.

Headlines: AAP: Be Prepared to Help Victims of Child Sex Trafficking
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics Committee on Child Abuse and Neglect emphasizes that sexual exploitation of children happens everywhere, and clinicians should be prepared to care for victims.

Headlines: Stroke Linked to Increased Cancer Risk
Teaser: Common risk factors, such as smoking, may help explain why stroke survivors face higher risk of developing cancer.

Headlines: Cure Possible for Some HPV-Positive Oropharyngeal Cancers
Teaser: Some patients with HPV-positive throat cancer can be cured, even after the disease has spread, Canadian researchers say.

Headlines: Source Patients in TB Outbreaks Have Shared Risk Factors
Teaser: Substance abuse, incarceration, and homelessness were prevalent TB risk factors. Knowing the risk factors can help find and diagnose infected people and prevent disease outbreaks, researchers say.

Headlines: ACOG Guideline Aids Transition From Pediatric to Adult Care
Teaser: Asking young women about sleep, sex, drugs, exercise, and eating habits can identify preventive care needs. The ACOG's recommendations also address schedules for breast and pelvic exams.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia and Nondipper Circadian BP Variability
Teaser: This study investigates nocturnal blood pressure variablility in patients with fibromyalgia.

Source: Journal of the International Association of Providers of AIDS Care
Headlines: Inadequate Monitoring and Attrition Among Patients on ART
Teaser: What are the patient risk factors for failure to follow-up in HIV care?

Headlines: Disparities in Nonsmokers' Exposure to Secondhand Smoke
Teaser: There's no safe level of exposure to second-hand smoke, and while exposure has declined in the last two decades, certain populations are at still at risk--including children.

Headlines: Blood Glucose Screening Rates Among Adults With Hypertension
Teaser: Are clinicians screening their hypertensive patients for diabetes? This survey of Minnesota adults revealed surprising inadequacies.

Headlines: Treatment of IBD: Where We Are and Where We Are Going
Teaser: This new article sheds light on some of the newer therapies on the horizon to treat IBD. How do they differ from older drug regimens?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Suicide in Epilepsy Patients
Teaser: Which patients with epilepsy are at risk for suicide? What are potential risk factors?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Aspirin Use for Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: How common is inappropriate aspirin therapy use in primary prevention?

Headlines: Urinary Melatonin Concentration and Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Recent epidemiologic studies suggest that women who work the night shift have an increased risk of breast cancer. Might melatonin play a protective role in breast cancer etiology?

Headlines: Airway Mucosal Immune-suppression in Neonates of Mothers Receiving A(H1N1)pnd09 Vaccination During Pregnancy
Teaser: Influenza vaccination is generally considered safe for the pregnant mother and the fetus but how does vaccination during pregnancy affect the neonatal immune status?

Headlines: Barriers in Asthma Care for Children in Primary Care
Teaser: How do barriers to care in controlled and uncontrolled asthma affect patient outcomes?

Headlines: Overview and Management of Anxiety Disorders
Teaser: Review the role of SSRIs, SNRIs, TCAs, and benzodiazepines for management of anxiety.

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Cardiovascular Impairments Limit VO2 Peak in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the relationship between these cardiovascular limitations and peak oxygen uptake in individuals with type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: The Promise of Pharmacogenomics for Inflammatory Diseases
Teaser: Many patients don't adequately respond to treatment with drugs used in inflammatory diseases. Could predictive biomarkers to drug response--both genetic and non-genetic--be identified?

Headlines: Association of Impaired Fasting Glucose & Diabetes With PAD
Teaser: Does severity of diabetes increase mortality risk in patients with PAD?

Headlines: Child Maltreatment and Hypertension in Young Adulthood
Teaser: This study suggests that sexual abuse or maltreatment in childhood may lead to hypertension in young adults--but only in specific populations.

Headlines: Physical Activity and Menopausal Symptoms in Perimenopause
Teaser: Does the latest research recommend physical activity for perimenopausal women as a way to deal with the various symptoms associated with menopause?

Headlines: Food Intolerance: Etiology, Diagnosis, Mechanisms, Evidence
Teaser: How does this new article advance our understanding of how certain foods or food components could be implicated in cases of food intolerance?

Headlines: Current Concepts in the Diagnosis and Management of NAION
Teaser: This article discusses the current and emerging concepts for diagnosing and managing this condition.

Headlines: Diverticular Disease: Presentation and Management
Teaser: Does this new study add anything to our understanding of the pathophysiology and treatment strategies for diverticular disease?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Risk in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: How does inflammation influence lipid profiles and cardiac risk in RA patients?

Headlines: Who Chooses Prepaid Dental Care?
Teaser: Sweden has implemented an optional prepayment system for dental care. Are there socioeconomic and lifestyle factors which might influence patients to choose this over a standard fee-for-service plan?

Headlines: Hypoxic Tumor Microenvironment: Driving NSCLC Tumorigenesis
Teaser: Find out about recent advances in our understanding of how a complex milieu of supporting cells impact the tumor response to hypoxia in NSCLC.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Depression and Functional Status in Older Adults With CHD
Teaser: To what extent does mental vs. physical health determine the long-term functional status of older adults with cardiovascular disease?

Headlines: It's Final: CMS to Cover Lung Cancer Screening
Teaser: Medicare has issued its final decision; it will pay for lung cancer screening for certain individuals.

Headlines: Bacterial and Atypical Etiology of Acute COPD Exacerbation
Teaser: Which infectious agents are most commonly implicated in exacerbations of COPD, and which diagnostic methods provide the most accurate results?

Headlines: Palonosetron for Emesis Control in High-dose Chemotherapy
Teaser: Find out how a second-generation 5-HT3RA impacts chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting associated with anti-cancer chemotherapy.

Headlines: Long-term Outcomes of Lumbar Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: Do lumbar spinal stenosis patients who underwent surgery fare better in the long-term than those who were treated nonoperatively? Data from the SPORT study are examined here.

Headlines: BMI, Diabetes, and Complications Among US Older Adults
Teaser: This study offers new information on the relation between excess weight and complications of diabetes mellitus.

Headlines: PaO2/FiO2 Ratio After Cardiac Surgery to Predict Outcome
Teaser: Can the PaO2/FiO2 ratio be used to predict mortality in patients immediately after cardiac surgery?

Headlines: Prescription Drug Insurance Coverage and Patient Outcomes
Teaser: Can expanding prescription drug insurance benefits reduce use of other health care services and positively impact patient outcomes?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Heartburn: Excess Weight, Smoking
Teaser: Excess pounds and smoking might each raise the likelihood of frequent heartburn or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), according to a large study from Norway.

Headlines: Management of Fracture Risk in Patients With Parkinson's
Teaser: Patients with Parkinson's disease have an increased risk of falls and fractures. How should fracture risk assessment and bone health be managed in Parkinson's patients?

Headlines: Association of Apolipoproteins and Race in IR & Adiposity
Teaser: Why do different races have different risks for cardiovascular disease? New research tries to uncover the metabolic basis.

Headlines: Antioxidant Vitamin Intake and Mortality
Teaser: Oxidative stress has been suggested to increase the incidence of chronic disease and mortality. Does intake of antioxidant vitamins--either via food or supplements--impact longevity?

Headlines: Pain Management in Internal Medicine
Teaser: This study examined the prevalence of pain and its treatment in hospitalized patients on internal medicine wards. Is pain management being adequately and appropriately used in this setting?

Headlines: Prognostic Role of Restenosis in Angiography After Stenting
Teaser: What's the impact of restenosis on 4-year mortality in patients undergoing routine control angiography after coronary stenting?

Headlines: Osteoporosis, Fractures and MetS in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: Does metabolic syndrome reduce fracture risk?

Headlines: Exploring Psychosis and Bipolar Disorder in Women
Teaser: How do the experiences of women with severe mental illness differ from that of men? This review explores the impact of women's attitudes, roles, use of mental health services, and more.

Headlines: Clinical Trials in Lung Cancer Surgery, Research Cooperation
Teaser: Get a wide-angle view of lung cancer research, from a country with an ever growing population of lung cancer patients.

Headlines: Quality Indicators for Colonoscopy
Teaser: Colonoscopy is widely used to diagnose and treat colon disorders. How successful is it, and in what particular situations is it most warranted?

Headlines: In NSCLC, Why Some Patients Respond to Immunotherapy
Teaser: A new study provides insights into what makes some tumors respond to the new PD-1 inhibitor immunotherapy drug, pembrolizumab.

Headlines: New Guidance on Screening, Intervention for Alcohol Misuse
Teaser: New guidance for primary care physicians focuses on ways to identify patients with risky drinking habits.

Headlines: Patients With HIV More Likely to Smoke, Less Likely to Quit
Teaser: More than 4 in 10 of US adults receiving medical care for HIV infection are current smokers.

Headlines: New US Data on Opioid Use
Teaser: A new report shows that although overall use of opioid analgesics in the US has remained stable over the past decade, use of stronger forms is increasing significantly.

Headlines: Cleaner Air Improves Lung Development in Children
Teaser: Reduced emissions have been linked to clinically significant improvements in pediatric lung function.

Headlines: 'Common Sense' Lifestyle Factors May Delay Dementia Onset
Teaser: A number of 'common sense' modifiable lifestyle factors may help curb the risk for conversion from MCI to dementia.

Headlines: Emergency Department Staff Not Immune to Traumatic Stress
Teaser: Just about every healthcare worker in the emergency department has experienced verbal abuse, and some even experience physical violence, putting them at risk for post-traumatic stress disorder.

Headlines: Antidepressants, Statins Have Separate Impact on CV Mortality
Teaser: Nondepressed outpatients benefited from statins, and depressed outpatients benefitted from antidepressants; the two therapies were not synergistic, in a     study of 3-year CV outcomes.

Headlines: Extreme Rate of Prenatal Alcohol Disorders in Poor
Teaser: Almost 40% of low-income adult and 57% of child psychiatric outpatients have a neurodevelopmental disorder associated with prenatal alcohol exposure, a single-center study shows.

Headlines: 'Too Much' Sitting May Worsen Coronary Artery Calcification
Teaser: Increased subclinical atherosclerosis may be one of the mechanisms through which sedentary behavior increases CV risk," say researchers. The effect seems independent from exercise levels.

Headlines: Lifestyle Intervention Slows Cognitive Decline
Teaser: In the first randomized trial of its kind, targeting multiple lifestyle factors, including physical activity, diet, and vascular risk factors, along with brain training, slowed cognitive decline in healthy elders.

Headlines: More Evidence Mediterranean Diet May Reduce Stroke Risk
Teaser: It's time that health professionals talked about diet with their patients because it's an easily modifiable stroke risk factor, researchers say.

Headlines: Largest Risk for Diabetes With Statins Yet Seen, in New Study
Teaser: Results from a population-based study indicate that the risk of diabetes is increased by almost half among individuals receiving statin therapy, a bigger     increase than has previously been identified.

Headlines: CDC Investigates Rise in Opioid-Addicted Newborns
Teaser: Surveillance data from three Florida hospitals identified 242 babies born with neonatal abstinence syndrome during a 2-year period.

Headlines: How Much Do You Know About CAM?
Teaser: How much do you know about the evidence -- or lack thereof -- for commonly used complementary and alternative therapies?

Headlines: COPD Affects Nearly 16 Million Americans, Researchers Report
Teaser: The respiratory condition has wide-ranging effects on Americans' ability to work and be physically active.

Headlines: 'Rx: The Quiet Revolution': Heart and Soul Meet Modern Medicine
Teaser: After so many doom-and-gloom healthcare documentaries, Seth Bilazarian is pleasantly surprised to find Rx: The Quiet Revolution, representative of his experience and insightful.

Headlines: Prescribing Abuse-Deterrent Opioids
Teaser: Dr Argoff discusses when it is appropriate to prescribe an abuse-deterrent opioid.

Headlines: The Biology of Borderline (and a Diagnostic Tip)
Teaser: Dr Derick Vergne on the challenges of diagnosing borderline personality disorder and some of the unique factors that contribute to its pathophysiology.

Headlines: Palliative Care for Patients With Mental Illness
Teaser: Can palliative care benefit this woman with schizophrenia who now has liver failure?

Headlines: Correlation or Causation? Our Search for Certainty
Teaser: Clinicians -- and patients -- want to know the root cause of medical symptoms and disease, but the answer isn't always clear.

Headlines: Nutrition Counseling: From Clueless to Competent, Part 2
Teaser: Seth Bilazarian provides tips on increasing your 'nutrition literacy' and counselling patients to eat healthy and lose weight.

Headlines: CRC Survival Goes Down in Smoke
Teaser: Prompted by a recent study on the effects of smoking on colorectal cancer survival, Dr David Kerr reports that he has increased his efforts to get his patients to stop smoking.

Headlines: An Epidemic of Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: The dramatic rise in drug use among pregnant women has brought with it an unparalleled wave of newborns suffering from NAS or persistent effects of intrauterine exposure to drugs.

Headlines: Mythbusters: Does This Cause Cancer?
Teaser: Five commonly cited environmental cancer risks are investigated to determine how robust the link to cancer actually is.

Headlines: One in Five Teens Have Tried E-Cigarettes, a British Study Finds
Teaser: One in five teenagers have experimented with e-cigarettes, a large study of British school students showed on Tuesday, fuelling debate about the widespread availability of the electronic devices.

Headlines: PBS Documentary Champions Patient-Centered Care
Teaser: Airing on April  2, 'Rx: The Quiet Revolution' turns aside from the usual discontents of medicine to show how reviving the physician-patient relationship can help Americans cope with chronic illness.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Can You Spot Doctor-Shoppers?
Teaser: More signals of opioid drug abuse have been identified to help clinicians spot abusers and pushers.

Headlines: Get Moving! Inactivity Should Rate as Top CV Risk Factor
Teaser: In keeping with the adage, "Sitting is the new smoking," physicians should keep a supply of inexpensive pedometers on hand to give out to patients, says one expert passionate about the subject.

Headlines: Blood Test for Lung Cancer as First-line Screen Before LDCT
Teaser: Low-dose CT (LDCT) screening is expensive and challenging. Could a blood test help identify high-risk patients?

Headlines: Guidance Issued for Endometrial Cancer, Hints for Diagnosis
Teaser: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and the Society of Gynecologic Oncology have issued a new practice bulletin on endometrial cancer to aid in early diagnosis, early management.

Headlines: Male Smokers Have Elevated Risk of Osteoporosis
Teaser: Male smokers have a greater risk for osteoporosis than other men and even than women smokers, a recent study finds, suggesting that U.S. screening guidelines focused on women might need to be expanded to include men.

Headlines: Early Pneumonia Telltale Predictor for Asthma Later in Life
Teaser: Children who had lower respiratory illnesses by age 3 years had diminished lung function impairment as adults; those who had pneumonia were at nearly twice the risk of having asthma as adults.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent OxyContin Won't Solve US Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Abuse-deterrent opioid formulations curtail abuse but alone won't mitigate the US opioid abuse problem and may contribute to more heroin use, new research shows.

Headlines: Fentanyl: DEA Sounds Nationwide Alarm on Drug's Dangers
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Agency has issued a nationwide alert about the dangers of the narcotic fentanyl its analogues/compounds, which are often laced with heroin.

Headlines: Adding Age, Sex Criteria Sharpen Statin Guidelines: Analysis
Teaser: That could improve the balance between patients treated vs events prevented, potentially boosting guidelines performance in targeting the patients who     could most benefit from statins, researchers say.

Headlines: Feds Move to Stop Opioid- and Heroin-Related Overdose, Death
Teaser: A targeted initiative aimed at reducing prescription opioid- and heroin-related overdose, dependence, and death has been announced by the US Health and Human Services Secretary.

Headlines: Fitness Levels Linked to Risk for Some Cancers and Death
Teaser: Fitter men had a lower risk for lung and colorectal cancer, but not prostate cancer, and a lower risk for death from cancer or cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: John Laragh, Hypertension-Therapy Pioneer, Dead at 90
Teaser: His seminal discoveries involving the renin-angiotensin system helped shape the modern understanding of hypertension and its pharmacologic treatments.

Headlines: Hip Osteoarthritis Linked to Increased Mortality
Teaser: Radiographic hip osteoarthritis was associated with increased mortality, perhaps as a result of decreased physical activity. Hip replacement provided some protection.

Headlines: Plain Packaging Makes Cigarettes Less Sexy
Teaser: In Australia, the move to put cigarettes in plain brown packaging to reduce their appeal appears to have been a success.

Headlines: Smoking Doubles Recurrence Risk for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Men with prostate cancer who have smoked in the previous 10 years have double the risk for disease recurrence after radical prostatectomy.

Headlines: No Suicide Risk With Varenicline?
Teaser: A comprehensive meta-analysis shows no evidence of neuropsychiatric effects of varenicline, but the study has its detractors.

Headlines: Powdered Alcohol: What's the Harm?
Teaser: Substance abuse experts are concerned about the imminent availability of powdered alcohol because of health risks and potential for abuse.

Headlines: 'Cigarettes Kill' Message to Thwart Tobacco Industry Efforts
Teaser: Tobacco manufacturers are pulling out all the stops to market their products to naïve, low-income populations, but public health education programs can thwart their efforts.

Headlines: New Market for Liver Disease Spawns Race for Better Testing
Teaser: As drugmakers develop new medicines to battle a liver disease epidemic, they have created an urgent need for better diagnostics to select patients for treatment and assess their drugs' effectiveness.

Headlines: New NCCN Guideline for Smoking Cessation
Teaser: Evidence indicates that cancer patients have a better prognosis if they quit. Clinicians can help.

Headlines: Gene Variant Not a Predictor of Naltrexone Response
Teaser: A variant of the mu-opioid receptor gene was not associated with response to the opioid antagonist naltrexone in alcohol-dependent patients in a prospective study.

Headlines: China in Dire Need of Anti-Tobacco Regulations
Teaser: Tobacco production in China is controlled by the state-owned Chinese National Tobacco Company, which makes effective anti-tobacco policies difficult to enact.

Headlines: Smoking Worsens Outcomes for Patients Following PCI/CABG
Teaser: Smokers have worse clinical outcomes than nonsmokers following coronary revascularization, and they need to be reminded to quit at each and every visit.

Headlines: Vitamin D Ineffective for Lowering Blood Pressure
Teaser: Vitamin D is ineffective for lowering blood pressure and should not be used for blood pressure control, according to a meta-analysis.

Headlines: Drug Monitoring Programs: Time Consuming, Hard to Access
Teaser: Most physicians are aware of state-level prescription drug monitoring programs, but many don't use them because they are time consuming and hard to access.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Coffee Drinking and Cutaneous Melanoma Risk
Teaser: Coffee contains numerous bioactive compounds, but does drinking it prevent melanoma?

Headlines: Beta-blockers, PPIs, and Bacterial Infections in Cirrhosis
Teaser: Are patients taking beta-blockers and PPIs more prone to bacterial infections in the presence of cirrhosis and, if so, why?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Jogging Dose and Long-term Mortality: Copenhagen Heart Study
Teaser: Strenuous joggers and sedentary individuals may share the same mortality risk. Find out why.

Headlines: Characterisation of Undiagnosed COPD at 1st Hospitalisation
Teaser: Explore early detection strategies aimed at reducing COPD burden through proven health-care interventions.

Headlines: The Association Between Breastfeeding and Childhood Obesity
Teaser: Does breastfeeding offer protection against childhood obesity? This meta-analysis aims to settle the on-going debate.

Teaser: The detection of de novo intracranial aneurysms with routine screening following an initial aneurysm is only about 1%, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Addiction Programs Need Help to Maximize ACA Benefits
Teaser: Many addiction treatment programs lack the tools needed to take on more clients and comply with new ACA regulations.

Headlines: PTSD Linked to Premature Aging, Specific Diseases
Teaser: A literature review shows multiple lines of evidence pointing a link between accelerated biological aging and PTSD.

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Common, Affects Cognition in MS
Teaser: Cannabis smoking is common among patients with MS, who use it to control pain and spasticity, but the downside is that it may have lasting effects on memory and other cognitive functions.

Headlines: Aspirin a Day Keeps Emphysema Away, Early Study Alludes
Teaser: Investigators have identified an association between regular aspirin use and a slowing in emphysema progression.

Headlines: Genetic Variants Linked to Intellectual Disability
Teaser: UPDATED // The researchers also observed differences in the changes between men and women, with women more susceptible than men to the cardiotoxic effects of alcohol.

Headlines: In 1980, 2 Britons Nailed US Cancer Risks for Next 35 Years
Teaser: British researchers published estimates of cancer risk, and much of their research continues to be applicable today.

Headlines: Prepare for Questions on Cannabis as an Analgesic
Teaser: A survey of American and Indian psychiatrists shows they weigh different symptoms more heavily in the diagnosis of common disorders such as depression and mania.

Headlines: Cultural Differences May Affect Psychiatric Diagnosis
Teaser: Evidence is sparse, but a meta-analysis shows that e-cigarettes are associated with a 50% reduction of cigarette use at 6 months and are of no benefit in complete cessation.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes of Questionable Value for Quitting Smoking
Teaser: Ambulatory blood-pressure measurements may reveal "the hidden risk" of diminished cognitive function in older patients, say researchers. In addition, this risk may be increased twofold, they report.

Headlines: Time to Legally Reclassify Psychedelic Drugs, Experts Say
Teaser: Psychedelic drugs should be legally reclassified so that researchers can more easily test their therapeutic potential in clinical psychiatry and other areas of medicine, experts say.

Headlines: Masked Hypertension Linked to Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Low doses of an antibiotic typically used to treat tuberculosis cuts alcohol cravings and may enhance psychotherapy efficacy in the treatment of alcohol use disorders.

Headlines: Teen Drinking: New Insights on Causes and Consequences
Teaser: Some 5% of the adults in the world are addicted to alcohol, and more than 20% smoke tobacco, according to the first study to compile statistics on global addictions.

Headlines: First Worldwide Addiction Stats Released
Teaser: "A higher level of fitness is important to delay the age-associated increase in cholesterol," researchers report.

Headlines: Fit Middle-Aged Men May Maintain Youthful Lipid Levels Longer
Teaser: A smartphone-based intervention reduced drink consumption in alcoholic patients in a small pilot study.

Headlines: Mobile App Helps Curb Problem Drinking
Teaser: A new study shows that a system for identifying which patients are most likely to abuse opioids could affect how physicians prescribe these drugs.

Headlines: Screening for Cardiovascular Risk in Serious Mental Illness
Teaser: Adults with serious mental illness have a high risk of cardiovascular disease. Are they being adequately screened?

Headlines: E-Cigarette Access and Smoking and Drinking in Teenagers
Teaser: This study aimed to determine the extent of e-cigarette use by young people, and the attitudes of those that access them. Do teenagers view e-cigarettes as a recreational substance?

Headlines: Vivek Murthy, Hospitalist and America's Top Doctor
Teaser: The Hospitalist discusses public health, communication, and major health challenges with the new U.S. Surgeon General.

Headlines: Antibiotic Cuts Alcohol Cravings, May Enhance Psychotherapy
Teaser: Heavy drinking in adolescence damages key regions of the brain and links a gene involved in impulsiveness to early alcohol problems.

Headlines: Kidney Health Measures Beat Other Tests for Heart Risk
Teaser: Estimated glomerular filtration rate and albuminuria both independently predicted cardiovascular mortality and heart failure.

Headlines: More Booze Means Changes in Cardiac Structure, Function
Teaser: Cannabis is becoming increasingly important in pain control, and clinicians must prepare to answer patients' questions about it, according to a leading researcher.

Headlines: Managing Severe Asthma in Adults: ERS/ATS Guidelines
Teaser: Get an updated definition of severe asthma along with the evaluation steps necessary to reach a diagnosis of severe asthma.

Headlines: Opioids Gateway Drug for Many High-Risk Patients
Teaser: Safer opioid prescribing requires screening patients for drug or alcohol abuse risk, informed consent, and compliance monitoring of those receiving ongoing therapy.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Linked to HbA1c Rise in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Analysis of a large primary-care database finds a 3-year rise in HbA1c following smoking cessation, which is unrelated to weight gain.

Headlines: Obstetricians/Gynecologists Ethics Report 2014
Teaser: Obstetricians/gynecologists told us how they feel about some of the key ethical issues they face in the course of their career.

Headlines: Drug and Alcohol Abuse: Why Doctors Become Hooked
Teaser: Physicians might injure themselves--or worse, a patient--if they're addicted to drugs or alcohol. Are pressures of the profession what's causing the problem?

Headlines: 5 Quick MS Questions Answered
Teaser: Dr Fred Lublin answers five questions about the latest in multiple sclerosis genetic research.

Headlines: ED Smoking Cessation Intervention Pays Off
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial shows an intervention initiated in the emergency department ups quit rates at 3 months, as well as a trend for benefit at 1 year.

Headlines: Jury Out on e-Cigs for Smoking Cessation
Teaser: There is insufficient evidence to weigh the balance of benefits and harms of electronic cigarettes for tobacco smoking cessation, public health officials say.

Headlines: Substance Abuse Fuels Rise in HCV in Four Eastern States
Teaser: Acute HCV infections increased from 2006 to 2012 among young people in Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia and were strongly correlated with opioid abuse and injection drug use.

Headlines: Hispanic Subgroups Have Different Health Risks, CDC Says
Teaser: Health risks in Hispanics vary by whether they were born in the United States or not, and by their country of origin.

Headlines: E-Cig, Marijuana Risks Unclear to Teenagers
Teaser: Teenagers know the dangers of cigarettes, and use has leveled or declined in recent years. They are much less clear about the risks of e-cigarettes and marijuana, however, according to a recent study.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Don't Encourage Teen Use
Teaser: A multiyear nationwide survey suggests that introducing state medical marijuana laws does not lead to an increase in marijuana use in adolescents, although those states have higher overall usage.

Headlines: Too Many Patients With Migraine Receiving Opioids, Barbiturates
Teaser: A new survey reveals that half of patients with migraine are receiving medications that are not recommended as first-line and that may lead to overdose, addiction, and more frequent headaches.

Headlines: High-Potency 'Blowtorch' Marijuana Gaining Ground
Teaser: A novel method of consuming high-potency marijuana created via butane extraction is gaining ground and placing producers and users at risk for fires and burns.

Headlines: Stimulant Medication Misuse 'Starts Earlier Than Thought'
Teaser: Surveys of more than 250,000 adolescents show the peak age of initiating misuse of stimulant medications is earlier than expected, with higher rates in females.

Headlines: Dietary Supplement May Help Treat Cocaine Dependence
Teaser: The dietary supplement citicoline may help treat cocaine dependence in patients with bipolar disorder, but its effects appear to diminish over time.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation: Intensive Interventions by PCPs Help
Teaser: Smokers are more likely to quit when physicians recommend medications and counseling and arrange follow-up. Less-intensive interventions have no significant effect but are a good start.

Headlines: Smoking Accelerates Ankylosing Spondylitis Damage
Teaser: Smoking interacts with the epigenetic factors related to ankylosing spondylitis, contributing to radiographic progression, new research shows.

Headlines: Hawaii Becomes First U.S. State to Raise Smoking Age to 21
Teaser: Hawaii's governor on Friday signed a bill raising the legal smoking age statewide to 21, the first U.S. state to do so.

Headlines: How Many Patients With MS Are Using Marijuana?
Teaser: A survey of more than 5000 patients with MS shows 16% are current marijuana users. Having progressive forms of the disease, more disability, and spasticity increases the likelihood of using the drug.

Headlines: High-Dose Baclofen Supports Abstinence in Alcoholism
Teaser: High-dose baclofen supports abstinence among alcohol-dependent patients compared with placebo and is reasonably well tolerated.

Headlines: Questionnaire Predicts Risk for Death Within 5 Years
Teaser: Self-reported health status and walking pace were two of the strongest predictors for both sexes in a UK study. However, comment authors say the results may have limited value.

Headlines: Doctors' Legal Risks With Medical Marijuana
Teaser: More than 20 states allow the use of medical marijuana, but there are things you need to know to avoid getting into trouble.

Headlines: 6 Psychiatry Updates to Know
Teaser: Drs Correll, Kane, and Ghaemi discuss the research and ideas that caused a stir at this year's APA annual meeting.

Headlines: Health Is Not Complicated--Just Ask the Patient
Teaser: In the age of digital medicine and big data, can a simple questionnaire predict your patient's risk of dying better than a series of lab tests? A study     from the UK intrigues Dr John Mandrola.

Headlines: Keeping 'Tract': GI Updates From DDW 2015
Teaser: Dr David Johnson provides a comprehensive review of the most interesting and intriguing topics that were presented at this year's Digestive Disease Week (DDW) meeting.

Headlines: One Drink Won't Hurt, but Women Beware
Teaser: Renowned epidemiologist Peter Boyle talks to David Kerr about alcohol consumption, cancer risk, and the importance of extending life expectancy not just in years, but in healthy years.

Headlines: Can Eliminating Poverty Boost Health?
Teaser: Do you have a better idea than George Lundberg's proposal for an experiment to test the link between poverty and health in the United States?

Headlines: Medicare Favors Generic Opioids Over Abuse-Deterrent Formulations
Teaser: The abuse of prescription painkillers is a growing problem for seniors, as it is for other age groups.

Headlines: Addiction-Boosting Compounds Added to 'Light' Cigarettes
Teaser: Pyrazine compounds added to tobacco products make these products harder to resist and more addictive, new research shows.

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking and Smokeless Tobacco Use Among Adults: US
Teaser: How widely do different US states vary in prevalence of cigarette smoking and smokeless tobacco use? Are some states doing better at quitting than others?

Headlines: ACOG Expands Substance Abuse Guidelines
Teaser: Recommendations for universal screening now also apply to prescription drug abuse.

Headlines: FDA Seeks Data on E-Cigarettes After Surge in Poisoning Cases
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said it is seeking additional data and comments on liquid nicotine as it considers warning the public about the dangers of its exposure amid a rise in electronic cigarette use.

Headlines: Psychoeducation in Bipolar Patients With a Smart-Phone App
Teaser: The authors propose a smartphone application to monitor symptoms and signs and empower the self-management of bipolar disorder.

Headlines: Body Mass Index and the Risk of Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: What is the relationship between obesity and risk for rheumatoid arthritis?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Smartphone Self-Monitoring Among People Living With HIV
Teaser: How can smart phones be used to engage HIV patients in active self-management?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Risk Management in Ankylosing Spondylitis
Teaser: Ankylosing spondylitis patients may be at an increased risk for cardiovascular disease. What can clinicians do to minimize the risk?

Headlines: Mortality, Revascularisation and MI With Rheumatic Disease
Teaser: Patients with autoimmune rheumatic diseases have increased mortality rates and decreased rates of revascularization treatment after MI. What more can be done for these high risk patients?

Headlines: Severe Delirium Linked to Exposure to Synthetic Cannabinoid
Teaser: This report highlights the adverse effects associated with synthetic cannabinoids. What do clinicians need to know about these dangerous products?

Headlines: Is CO Assessment in Helpful for Early Diagnosis Of COPD?
Teaser: COPD is largely under-diagnosed and once diagnosed usually at a late stage. Can we change that?

Headlines: Alcohol Consumption and Risk of Developing CKD
Teaser: What does this new study tell us about the connection between alcohol consumption and the risk for developing CKD, and how should clinicians counsel their patients about the risks?

Headlines: Distinguishing Schizophrenia From PTSD With Psychosis
Teaser: Is PTSD with psychotic symptoms a distinct subtype of PTSD, a misdiagnosis of prodromal schizophrenia, or a comorbidity? This review examines the latest evidence.

Headlines: Cardiometabolic Risk Factors in Young Adults Born Preterm
Teaser: Does being born premature increase the risk of cardiometabolic disease later in life?

Headlines: MRE vs. CPRs for Noninvasive Diagnosis of Fibrosis in NAFLD
Teaser: Compared to clinical prediction rules, does magnetic resonance elastography provide a significantly higher accuracy for the diagnosis of advanced fibrosis in NAFLD patients?

Headlines: Erectile Dysfunction in the Older Adult Male
Teaser: Get a clear clinical picture of ED, including relevant pathophysiology, clinical presentation, along with evaluation and treatment options.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Events and All-cause Mortality in T2D
Teaser: Can risk of death be reduced in patients with T2D? What does the research say?

Headlines: Role of Expectation in Alcohol and Drug Addiction Treatments
Teaser: Can the expectations and beliefs held by physicians and other practitioners affect the efficacy of treatments for alcohol and drug use disorders?

Headlines: Alcohol and Gut Microbiota
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the pathogenesis of alcoholic liver disease, and how gut microbiota modulation could possibly be a target for the treatment of alcoholic liver disease?

Headlines: How to Address Smoking Cessation in HIV Patients
Teaser: What are the most effective strategies available to help HIV positive patients quit smoking?

Headlines: Lifestyle, Family History, and Risk of Parkinson Disease
Teaser: Do lifestyle factors such as cigarette smoking, caffeine intake, and alcohol consumption contribute to the risk of developing Parkinson's disease?

Headlines: Maternal Lifestyle Characteristics During Pregnancy
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the connection between gestational weight gain and certain lifestyle characteristics during pregnancy and the risk for obesity in offspring?

Headlines: States Taking Action to Regulate E-Cigarettes
Teaser: More and more states are passing legislation to regulate e-cigarettes, as the FDA seeks to extend its regulatory authority over currently unregulated tobacco products.

Headlines: Maternal Smoking and the Risk of Still Birth
Teaser: The findings of this review suggest that women who smoke during pregnancy have an alarmingly increased risk of still birth--and that the more one smokes, the greater the risk.

Headlines: Cigar Smoking and All Cause and Smoking Related Mortality
Teaser: Does cigar smoking carry the same health risks as cigarette smoking?

Headlines: Risk of HCC in Chronic HBV Patients With New Onset Diabetes
Teaser: Are patients with chronic hepatitis B with new onset diabetes at an increased risk for developing hepatocellular carcinoma? This new study investigates.

Headlines: Targeted Therapy for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
Teaser: Examine the major subtypes of oncogenic drivers behind NSCLC as well as the development of targeted agents available to treat them.

Headlines: Financial Incentives in Smoking Cessation Treatment
Teaser: Could offering small financial incentives encourage economically disadvantaged smokers to quit?

Headlines: Quiz: Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Test your knowledge of this common complication of diabetes.

Headlines: Too Much TV, Loneliness Linked to Worse Cognition
Teaser: One new study finds an association between patterns over time of low physical activity and high television viewing with worse cognitive function, while another suggests loneliness is a risk factor.

Headlines: Bupropion Abuse on the Rise, Study Suggests
Teaser: A study has shown an increasing number of questionable bupropion prescriptions in Ontario, Canada, suggesting abuse may be on the rise.

Headlines: Siblings of 'Young' MI Patients: 20% Have Major Coronary Stenosis
Teaser: Yet less than 1% of the cohort had a positive stress echo. Normally we'd tell the rest, 'go home and don't worry about a thing,' say researchers; but coronary CT     often says they may be at increased risk.

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Injection Drug Use and HCV and Risk for Mortality in HIV
Teaser: How do injection drug use and hepatitis C affect mortality in HIV infected individuals?

Headlines: Latent TB Infection in Patients With Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: Treatment of psoriasis with TNF-alpha inhibitors is significantly associated with risk of developing active TB in patients with latent infection. How prevalent is latent TB in psoriasis patients?

Headlines: Salt, Smoking, and the Risk for RA
Teaser: Dr Björn Sundström discusses the relationship among salt, smoking, and the risk for rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Summer 2015 Update: ACIP Adult Vaccine Recommendations
Teaser: Highlights of the June 2015 ACIP meeting and recommendations for meningococcal B, flu, and pneumococcal vaccines. Also: Informational updates for Tdap and herpes zoster vaccine.

Headlines: Assessing the Impact of ART on Preeclampsia
Teaser: Dr Peter Kovacs summarizes the take-home points from a study that looked at the association between preeclampsia and assisted-reproductive technology.

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: An Association Between Carpal Tunnel Syndrome and Migraines
Teaser: What is the link between migraines and carpal tunnel syndrome? Find out about the possible connection.

Headlines: Black-White Differences in Alcohol Drinking and Mortality
Teaser: How do the risks and benefits of alcohol consumption vary by race, gender, and drinking patterns?

Headlines: Liver-Related Death Among HIV/Hep C Co-Infected Individuals
Teaser: New directly acting antivirals for the treatment of HCV infection offer favorable outcomes and less toxicity, but the cost of treatment is high.

Headlines: The Increasing Burden and Complexity of Multimorbidity
Teaser: Just how prevalent is multimorbidity? This study estimated the population-based prevalence and trends of multimorbidity across all age groups in a Canadian province.

Headlines: Acute-on-Chronic Liver Failure
Teaser: Is acute-on-chronic liver failure its own clinical entity, and how is it different from other forms of liver failure?

Headlines: CCTA Predicts 5-Year Mortality in Patients With Suspected CAD
Teaser: While patients with chest pain but without traditional CV risk factors are 'difficult to categorize,' investigators say CAD on CT helps identify those         at higher risk of MACE and death in the long term.

Headlines: Pregnancy Outcome Following Prenatal Exposure to Triptans
Teaser: Are triptans safe to use in pregnant women with migraine?

Headlines: Physical Activity and Survival After Breast Cancer
Teaser: Recent studies suggest that physical activity is beneficial for overall survival following breast cancer. But does race or ethnicity have a bearing?

Headlines: Study Reignites Calls for Worldwide Controls on Sugary Drinks
Teaser: Asking patients about what they eat and drink is as important as questioning them about smoking habits, say the authors of a newly published study that     highlights the need for urgent global action.

Headlines: Current Diagnostic Criteria for COPD Inadequate, Experts Say
Teaser: The inclusion of population-specific, statistically defined, lower-limits-of-normal airflow obstruction are necessary to improve diagnosis of COPD.

Headlines: Most People With HIV Know Status; More Testing Still Needed
Teaser: Five states have achieved the goal of informing 90% of HIV-positive people of their status. Testing occurred in healthcare settings and elsewhere, including bars and HIV counseling centers.

Headlines: Anal Cancer Guidelines: CTs Now Needed to Support Opinions
Teaser: European guidelines for the diagnosis and management of anal cancer may set out the basis of good clinical practice, but randomized clinical trials are needed.

Headlines: TMS May Aid Smoking Cessation
Teaser: Transcranial magnetic stimulation combined with standard CBT improves abstinence rates in smokers, early results suggest.

Headlines: Smoking Tied to Impaired Response to Graves' Ophthalmopathy Treatment
Teaser: Current and former smokers with Graves' ophthalmopathy (GO) have a worse response to intravenous steroid therapy than do patients who never smoked, according to new findings.

Headlines: New Scanning Study Points to Osteoporosis/Heart Disease Link
Teaser: A UK study found that people with ischemic heart disease have lower bone-mineral density in the wrist; findings point to a common etiology.

Headlines: Think You're Drinking Too Much? New Alcohol App Will Tell You
Teaser: Novel smartphone app tracks absolute number of alcoholic beverages consumed and alerts drinker when limits are exceeded.

Headlines: Managing Acute and Chronic Viral Hepatitis During Pregnancy
Teaser: Do pregnant women with liver diseases, and those who have undergone liver transplantation, face any particular challenges, and how can clinicians best manage them throughout their pregnancies?

Headlines: Severity of Diabetes Complications Linked to Dementia
Teaser: A nationwide study from Taiwan has linked the severity of diabetes complications to increased risk for developing dementia. But it's too soon to add     dementia to the list of diabetes complications.

Headlines: Women's Brains Hit Hardest by Long-term Stimulant Abuse
Teaser: Gray matter volumes were found to be significantly reduced in women who have been dependent on stimulant drugs, say US researchers, who found no brain volume changes in men who were dependent.

Headlines: Ulcerative Colitis: Lower Mortality for Surgery vs Medication
Teaser: Patients older than 50 years had lower mortality risk with surgery than medication, but no difference was seen in younger patients.

Headlines: Smoking a Cause of Psychosis?
Teaser: A meta-analysis shows high rates of smoking at first onset of psychosis and earlier onset among smokers, prompting authors to suggest a role of smoking that extends beyond the self-medication hypothesis.

Headlines: Low Birth Weight, Lifestyle, Sugar Again Implicated in T2D Risk
Teaser: Low birth weight plus an unhealthy lifestyle nearly triples the risk of T2D, and sugar-sweetened drinks could be responsible for 2 million         US and UK cases over 10 years, suggest reports.

Headlines: 'Successful Aging' Linked to Risky Drinking
Teaser: Harmful drinking appears to be a 'middle-class phenomenon' associated with higher income and education, and even better health.

Headlines: Quitting Smoking May Ease Hot Flashes
Teaser: Ex-smokers may have fewer and less severe hot flashes during menopause than women who continue to smoke, a small study suggests.

Headlines: Physical Activity Eases Impact of Bullying in Teens
Teaser: A large analysis of bullied teens who exercised 4 to 5 days a week reported less sadness and fewer suicide attempts or ideation than in their sedentary counterparts.

Headlines: Medicare Costs Down in Last 6 Months of Life
Teaser: Hospitalizations for end-of-life care and all-cause mortality and hospitalization rates fell among fee-for-service Medicare beneficiaries from 1999 to 2013.

Headlines: Menopause Symptoms Have Large Effect on Quality of Life
Teaser: Menopausal moderate to severe hot flushes and night sweats affected women's quality of life almost as much as housing insecurity, an analysis found.

Headlines: HPV Persistence Predicts Poor Prognosis in Head/Neck Cancer
Teaser: Persistence of HPV16 in patients with HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer is associated with a poorer prognosis and disease recurrence.

Headlines: RITA-3: Routine Invasive NSTEMI Care Survival Gain Gone at 10 Years
Teaser: The influential trial's 10-year results take some shine off the routine invasive strategy; symptom-driven invasive care can be "perfectly reasonable" for low- and intermediate-risk patients, say researchers.

Headlines: High Risk for Gastric Cancer in Patients With Gastric Lesions
Teaser: Patients who have gastric lesions identified on biopsy have a higher risk for gastric cancer, and the more severe the lesion, the higher the risk.

Headlines: Migraine Ups Stroke Risk, but Only in Smokers
Teaser: Cohort study findings contradict previous studies demonstrating an overall association between migraine with aura and vascular outcomes.

Headlines: APA, AMA Join Forces to Combat Opioid Abuse Crisis
Teaser: The American Psychiatric Association has joined forces with the American Medical Association and more than two dozen other medical organizations to address the growing epidemic of opioid abuse.

Headlines: Illicit Amphetamines: Variable Impact on Male Sexual Function
Teaser: Illicit amphetamine use can have a negative effect on sexual function among men, but there is huge variability in the nature of their impact.

Headlines: MI From Coronary Embolism Rarer but Higher Risk: Cohort Study
Teaser: In this first large study of patients with MI related to coronary artery embolism, the most common cause was AF, and patients had worse 5-year outcomes than     patients with other types of MI.

Headlines: Drinking Alcohol During Pregnancy Common
Teaser: Up to 80% of moms-to-be in the United Kingdom, Ireland, and Australia drink alcohol during pregnancy.

Headlines: 'Alarming' New Stats on US Heroin Epidemic
Teaser: Heroin use has increased 63% across the US, with the biggest jump in groups with historically lower rates of use, prompting calls for a widespread societal response.

Headlines: CVS Health Quits U.S. Chamber of Commerce Over Tobacco Stance
Teaser: CVS Health Corp said it was withdrawing its membership from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce after media reports that the trade group was lobbying globally against anti-smoking laws.

Headlines: Early Adult Lung Function Linked to Development of COPD
Teaser: Longitudinal cohort analysis suggests low FEV1 before age 40 years contributes to COPD later.

Headlines: Migraine, Heart Disease Link: No Genetic Explanation
Teaser: The link between migraine and heart disease cannot be explained by known shared gene variations, a new study shows.

Headlines: Small Brain Lesions Equal Big Stroke, Big Mortality Risk
Teaser: Very small brain lesions, which are often dismissed as benign, confer a significantly increased risk for stroke and stroke-related death in middle-aged and older adults.

Headlines: HF Primary Prevention: Lifestyle Improvements Seem to Help
Teaser: The risk reduction in the study was steep. "Imagine the impact of discovering a new drug that lowered the risk of heart failure by 50%!" says an editorial,     acknowledging there was no evidence of cause and effect.

Headlines: Moving Mental Health Policy Out of ‘the Dark Ages’
Teaser: Former Rep. Patrick Kennedy's his first-hand experience with mental illness drives his long-standing interest in shaping public policies to confront the challenges faced by people with mental health problems.

Headlines: Older Nulliparous Women Have Higher Risk for Stillbirth
Teaser: However, a Swedish study has found that the age-related risk is reduced in parous women, possibly because of physiological changes during earlier pregnancies.

Headlines: Secondhand Smoke Raises Stroke Risk
Teaser: Exposure to secondhand smoke ups stroke risk by 30%, independent of demographics, socioeconomic factors, smoking history, and other established stroke risk factors.

Headlines: Formaldehyde Exposure Linked to ALS
Teaser: Individuals with the highest probability of formaldehyde exposure, such as funeral directors who use the chemical for embalming, are at heightened risk for ALS.

Headlines: PCI Without Surgery On Site: Let Them Eat Cake
Teaser: Dr Melissa Walton-Shirley offers a sad reminiscence about a patient with MI who failed lytic therapy and, because of bad weather and state restrictions at that time, had no other options.

Headlines: Higher BMP-2 Linked to Atherosclerosis, Calcification in T2D
Teaser: Find out more about the role plasma BMP-2 plays in type 2 diabetes -- and its possible association with atherosclerosis and plaque calcification in these patients.

Headlines: Strategies to Improve Patient Adherence to Treatment
Teaser: How can you improve treatment adherence among your patients? This review offers some practical advice utilizing the health belief model.

Headlines: Additional Drug Resistance of Multidrug-Resistant TB
Teaser: Better TB drugs and shorter regimens are urgently needed to enable more effective treatment for multidrug-resistant TB.

Headlines: Global Patterns of Methamphetamine Use
Teaser: Methamphetamine use has reached epidemic proportions worldwide. This review examines the global distribution of methamphetamine in its various forms as well as its clinical and psychosocial effects.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Cardiopulmonary Benefits of Reducing Indoor Particles
Teaser: What are the cardiopulmonary benefits of indoor air purification?

Headlines: Obesity, Metabolic Health, and the Risk of ESRD
Teaser: Is metabolic syndrome associated with the development and progression of CKD?

Headlines: Abbreviated Alcohol Screening in General Practice
Teaser: Do patients fully understand the potential risks of drinking? This study aimed to determine patients' knowledge and beliefs surrounding alcohol's health risks.

Headlines: Web Interventions to Decrease Alcohol Use in Adolescents
Teaser: Can web-based interventions be used effectively to reduce binge drinking in 16- to 18-year-olds?

Headlines: Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy: Healing a Broken Heart
Teaser: Not all medical problems are easy to diagnose, and it can be especially tricky when similar symptoms occur in different diseases.

Source: International Journal for Quality in Health Care
Headlines: Cultural Competency in Health Care for Indigenous Peoples
Teaser: What's being done to improve the accessibility and outcomes of health care for people from ethnic and racial minority groups? Are current interventions effective?

Headlines: 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Cognitive Impairment, Dementia Risk
Teaser: Is vitamin D deficiency associated with an increased risk of developing mild cognitive impairment and dementia? This study investigates the possible connection.

Headlines: Delays to Surgery for Cervical Spinal Cord Injuries
Teaser: A new study finds that many patients with cervical spinal cord injury do not undergo surgery within 24 hours of injury. What accounts for these delays?

Headlines: Parental Practices and Attitudes Related to Smoke-Free Rules
Teaser: Are parents in smoking households doing enough to protect their children from second-hand smoke?

Headlines: Antimalarial Drugs Alone May Still Have a Role in RA
Teaser: Which rheumatoid arthritis patients might succeed on antimalarial treatment alone?

Headlines: Effect of Fertility on Perinatal Outcomes
Teaser: Dr Peter Kovacs reviews a study comparing perinatal outcomes for fertile women, subfertile women, and women who conceived via assisted reproductive technology.

Headlines: GI Practice Updates for Primary Care Providers
Teaser: Dr David Johnson makes a plea for primary care providers to team up with gastroenterologists in the prevention and management of common GI disorders.

Headlines: Is Medicine Driving Doctors to Drink?
Teaser: Why is it that the rate of substance abuse among physicians is no worse--but also no better--than it is among the general population? Your colleagues offer their theories.

Headlines: Vasomotor and Sexual Symptoms in Women Aged 60 to 65 Years
Teaser: How common are severe vasomotor and sexual symptoms in women aged 60 to 65, and how can clinicians best manage these patients with these issues?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: GI Antispasmodics and Anticholinergics: Risk in Older Adults
Teaser: GI antispasmodic and anticholinergic drugs continue to be prescribed for older adults, despite concerns about their safety in this population. Do they contribute to actual injury in the elderly?

Headlines: Airway-Centered Interstitial Fibrosis
Teaser: Find out how and why prognosis differs between airway-centered interstitial fibrosis and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: COPD Secondary to Household Air Pollution
Teaser: Find out how COPD from household air pollution differs from COPD from tobacco smoke.

Headlines: Glomerular Filtration Rate and Coronary Artery Calcification
Teaser: What is the connection between glomerular filtration rate and the risk for coronary artery calcificaition in middle-aged men without CKD?

Headlines: Rural Definition of Health: A Systematic Literature Review
Teaser: As providers increasingly focus on patient-centered care, it becomes crucial to understand how rural populations attitudes towards health and healthcare differ from their urban counterparts.

Headlines: Inflammatory Mechanisms of Age-Related Macular Degeneration
Teaser: This article provides some insight into the mechanisms of inflammation in AMD and discusses the potential therapeutic role immunotherapy may play in this disease.

Headlines: Prevention of Psychosis in the Symptomatic Prodromal Phase
Teaser: Many patients experience a long period with prodromal, non-psychotic symptoms before their first psychotic episode. Can these high-risk patients be identified, and psychosis prevented?

Headlines: Expanded Access: Recourse for Patients Out of Options
Teaser: Patients who do not qualify for a clinical trial may still be able to receive an investigational drug. Learn about the easier-than-you-thought steps in the FDA's Expanded Access Program.

Headlines: Bringing Nephrology Care to Where It Is Needed
Teaser: Two nephrologists from Pakistan went to Idaho to start a practice. The rest is... remarkable.

Headlines: Heroin: The Epidemic That Knows No Boundaries
Teaser: CDC director Tom Frieden reports that heroin is cheap, potent, and available, all of the prerequisites for a widespread epidemic of abuse.

Headlines: Preterm Infants Readmitted With Viral Respiratory Infections
Teaser: This study examines the characteristics of preterm children who have been readmitted to the hospital due to a respiratory infection.

Headlines: Lifestyle and Youthful Looks
Teaser: Lifestyle factors such as sleep, alcohol use, skincare, sun exposure, and smoking may have a greater impact on youthful looks than cosmetic surgery.

Teaser: A new study examines the rates of subclinical atherosclerosis in both normal-weight obese subjects and lean individuals. How do they compare?

Headlines: E-Cigs 95% Less Harmful Than Smoking and Help With Cessation

Headlines: Physician Health Programs: More Harm Than Good?

Teaser: Since Indiana opened its first state-run needle exchange last spring, Tara Burton, 25, has made weekly visits to turn over needles she used to shoot Opana, a prescription painkiller, up her track-marked arm.

Headlines: The Pill Has Prevented 400,000 Cases of Endometrial Cancer

Headlines: Mediterranean Diet May Preserve Brain Structural Connectivity

Teaser: An unintended side effect of a crackdown on prescription drug abuse affects chronic pain patients’ access to medication.

Headlines: Blood Pressure Drug May Help Prevent Opioid Relapse

Teaser: An expert panel has developed a model score sheet to help determine whether repair or conservative management is in order for unruptured intracranial aneurysms

Headlines: HIV+ Neurocognitive Disorders and Immune Activation
Teaser: The underlying pathophysiological mechanisms could be different in symptomatic vs asymptomatic HIV-associated neurocognitive disorders.

Teaser: Is the reported incidence of spontaneous coronary artery dissection higher now that advanced invasive imaging in use for acute coronary syndromes?

Teaser: How important is infliximab dosing for patients with IBD, and how does it ultimately affect treatment outcomes?

Teaser: This case of THC overdose illustrates a potential danger associated with recreational edible marijuana use.

Headlines: Surgical Wound Closure in Orthopaedic Surgery
Teaser: This article discusses various wound closure strategies to optimize wound healing after orthopaedic surgical procedures.

Teaser: Can the impact of intensive statin therapy be quantified with non-contrast imaging?

Teaser: Learn more about the factors that influence adolescent anger.

Teaser: What are the barriers and facilitators to patient retention in HIV care?

Teaser: Patients with alcohol use disorders who are in the hospital for medical reasons might seem to present an ideal opportunity for intervention, but what type of intervention would be most effective?

Teaser: Why do providers delay ART initiation in clinically eligible patients?

Teaser: Is there an association between age-related macular degeneration and coronary artery disease or its risk factors?

Teaser: What's the best stress test for patients unable to perform treadmill exercise?

Teaser: How likely are patients with chronic hepatitis C to present with cirrhosis?

Headlines: The Science and Treatment of Alcoholism

Headlines: Alcohol and the Brain: Healthy or Harmful?
Teaser: New findings shed light on the health benefits and drawbacks of alcohol consumption.

Teaser: Are clinical practice guidelines addressing the specific, more complex needs of older adults when it comes to primary CVD prevention?

Headlines: Young Lung Cancer Patients: Prime for Targeted Therapies
Teaser: Individuals younger than 40 years who develop lung cancer tend to have high rates of actionable mutations, making them candidates for new targeted therapies.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Linked to Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
Teaser: Neurologists are concerned about this possible new adverse effect of chemical-rich synthetic cannabis products.

Headlines: US Opioid Epidemic Fueled by Prescribing Practices

Headlines: New Tamper-Proof Pain Products in the Pipeline
