Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: CVD and Death, Dementia, and CHD in Patients 80+ Years
Teaser: Does a delay or prevention of peripheral atherosclerosis result in the reduction or slowing of progression of brain neuropathology and possible incidence of dementia in older persons?

Headlines: Obesity in Lumbar Spine Surgery
Teaser: Obesity may contribute to the development of degenerative lumbar spine disease and may also impact outcomes after lumbar spine surgery.

Headlines: Alcohol Consumption and Perception of Attractiveness
Teaser: Does consumption of alcohol influence the perception of attractiveness? This study aimed to validate the so-called "beer-goggles" effect of social drinking.

Headlines: Simeprevir and Sofosbuvir to Treat Chronic HCV Genotype 1
Teaser: Is the combination of simeprevir and sofosbuvir well-tolerated and effective in patients with hepatitis C genotype 1, and does its "real world" results mirror those in the clinical trials?

Headlines: Aspirin for Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: The use of aspirin for primary prevention in patients with no history of cardiovascular disease remains controversial. Do the benefits outweigh the risks?

Source: JAIDS: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
Headlines: Abacavir and CV Risk Among HIV-Infected Individuals
Teaser: Does abacavir use among HIV-infected individuals increase the risk for cardiovascular disease?

Headlines: Association Between a Healthy CV Risk Profile and CAC Score
Teaser: Do individuals with an ideal cardiovascular risk profile have lower coronary artery calcium scores compared to those with worse cardiovascular metrics?

Headlines: Alcohol and Processed Meat Link to Stomach Cancer
Teaser: An analysis from the World Cancer Research Fund has found "strong evidence" that alcohol and processed meats can cause stomach cancer.

Headlines: 'Bad Luck' or Environment? Depends on the Cancer
Teaser: Another study looks again at the data that were analyzed for contributions from instrinsic cellular factors, such as mutations and environmental factors.

Headlines: A Dose of Reality in Low-Dose CT Lung Cancer Screening
Teaser: Some controversy remains regarding the adoption of wide-scale LDCT screening for lung cancer.

Headlines: Predictors of Nonadherence in Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: From the AAN Annual Meeting, Medscape speaks with doctoral candidate Kyla McKay about predicting treatment nonadherence in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Deciding on the Best Treatment in Patients With Hepatitis B
Teaser: Recent recommendations and their impact on the management of patients with hepatitis B, including immune-tolerant hepatitis B, immune-active hepatitis B, and inactive chronic hepatitis, are reviewed.

Headlines: Special Report: Opioids -- Are Physicians Adopting Guidelines?
Teaser: The epidemic of opioid addiction has its roots in any number of issues--one of which may be overprescribing by physicians.

Headlines: Nagging Questions About Government Plans for Ophthalmology
Teaser: It isn't the GOP or Democratic primary candidates' proposals for reining in the cost of healthcare that concern ophthalmologists -- it's Medicare's.

Headlines: Taking Brain Health to Heart
Teaser: Drs Black and Gorelick discuss the growing link between Alzheimer disease and cardiovascular risk factors, such as high blood pressure, and the importance of educating patients about prevention.

Headlines: CDC Opioid Prescribing Guidelines Misguided, Docs Say
Teaser: Physicians react to news of CDC guidelines for opioid prescribing that suggest that opioids have little or no role in pain management.

Headlines: Pharmacists Have Key Role in Combatting Opioid Abuse
Teaser: Prescription opioid addiction is fast becoming a national epidemic. With their unique position at the frontline of healthcare, pharmacists have a pivotal role to play in alleviating this crisis.

Headlines: Total Elbow Arthroplasty: The State of Clinical Practice
Teaser: Advances in surgical techniques and implant designs after four decades of evolution in total elbow arthroplasty enable a growing variety of indications to be treated, particularly in older patients.

Headlines: Famous Patients, Famous Diseases, Famous Surgeries
Teaser: Test your knowledge of surgical history with this quiz about our surgical heritage.

Headlines: Addiction, Empathy, and Opioid Alternatives
Teaser: As hospital visits for opioid use soar, medical professionals need to be equipped with communication toolkits that will truly benefit patients.

Headlines: Metformin: New Perspectives
Teaser: An experienced diabetologist reflects on what we know and still don't know about this common drug used to manage type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Modifiable Risk Factors for AMD
Teaser: If cardiovascular disease and age-related macular degeneration (AMD) share some pathophysiologic mechanisms, would interventions that reduce cardiovascular disease help reduce the progression of AMD?

Headlines: The Opioid Crisis: Anatomy of a Doctor-Driven Epidemic
Teaser: A crisis in which a specialty society, a federal agency, a healthcare watchdog organization, drug makers, demanding patients, and well-meaning doctors in many specialties all played prominent roles.

Headlines: Marijuana Use in College Linked to Poor Health Years Later
Teaser: A new study suggests that marijuana use is not without health risks for young people.

Headlines: Dean Ornish on Love and Connection (the Touchy-Feely Stuff)
Teaser: Dr Dean Ornish discusses what he considers the most important and least understood part of lifestyle medicine--the power of love and connection.

Headlines: While Rome Burns: Addressing Rising Suicide Rates
Teaser: In the wake of rising suicide rates, Dr Lieberman urges us not to follow Nero's lead but to act to change the trajectory of these shocking statistics.

Headlines: Dean Ornish in Defense of the Dietary Fat - Heart Disease Link
Teaser: Dr Dean Ornish, lifestyle medicine proponent, defends the data supporting low-fat diets for the reversal of coronary atherosclerosis.

Headlines: Osmosis Question of the Week May 6, 2016
Teaser: Identify the placental finding in a woman with bleeding, back pain, and uterine contractions.

Headlines: Long-term Fitness Reduces Risk of Diabetes, Prediabetes
Teaser: Maintaining or increasing physical fitness between young adulthood to middle age significantly reduces the risk of prediabetes and diabetes, US researchers     have shown for the first time.

Headlines: Patrick Kennedy Pushes for True Mental Health Parity
Teaser: Former politician and mental health advocate Patrick Kennedy says more advocacy is needed to ensure that the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act fulfills its promise of mental health parity.

Headlines: Deep TMS Promising for OCD, ADHD, Other Mental Illnesses
Teaser: Deep transcranial magnetic stimulation, already approved for treatment-resistant depression, is proving beneficial for OCD, adult ADHD, and other psychiatric conditions.

Headlines: Nonpharmacologic Treatments for COPD
Teaser: A range of nonpharmacologic treatments for COPD can provide alternatives to medication and relief for patients.

Headlines: How the Primary Candidates Would Reform Healthcare
Teaser: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, and Donald Trump have very different visions for how to fix healthcare in America. Are they realistic, and what would they mean for you and your patients?

Headlines: Weight Loss in Obese Young Adults With Psychosocial Problems
Teaser: What factors might influence successful weight loss among young over-weight and obese adults who have multiple psychosocial problems?

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking and Prostate Cancer Mortality
Teaser: Has declining smoking prevalence produced detectable reductions in prostate cancer mortality?

Headlines: Oral Hygiene Habits and Survival of HNSCC Patients
Teaser: Can preventive dental care and good oral hygiene improve survival of patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma?

Headlines: Pharmacotherapies in Cardiac Critical Care
Teaser: What do we know about the currently available sedative and analgesic agents for pediatric cardiac ICU patients?

Headlines: Bupropion Only Antidepressant Linked to Weight Loss
Teaser: Bupropion was the only antidepressant associated with modest long-term weight loss over 2 years, but only among nonsmokers, a new study indicates.

Headlines: Marriage May Guard Against Alcoholism
Teaser: Marriage is associated with a very large reduction in the risk for AUD in both men and women. Surprisingly, this protective effect is greatest in those with a strong family history of alcoholism.

Headlines: HIV Infection Among Persons Who Inject Drugs
Teaser: Through combined prevention interventions, new HIV infections among persons who inject drugs had been significantly reduced in several locations. Why the new outbreaks?

Headlines: Schistosoma haematobium Infection That Mimics Bladder Cancer
Teaser: This patient's history of gross hematuria led to a suspicion of bladder cancer, but cystoscopic testing revealed a more unusual cause.

Headlines: Counterfeit Norco Poisoning Outbreak: San Francisco Bay Area
Teaser: Recent instances of street-purchased counterfeits of a commonly prescribed opioid tablet represent a major public health threat given their potentially lethal nature.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Mental Health, Substance Use Impact HIV Patient ED Outcomes
Teaser: A new study examines ED visit outcomes among patients with HIV and mental disorders or substance abuse issues. How are they associated?

Headlines: Diabetes Mellitus Review
Teaser: What are the complications and most recent treatment guidelines for type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Quality of Life Changes Over Time in Patients With COPD
Teaser: What are the impacts of this disease on health-related quality of life in these patients?

Headlines: Outcomes in Young Adults After Alcohol-Related Hospitalization
Teaser: What factors may predict future substance use, alcohol use disorders, and other psychosocial problems in adolescents under inpatient care for alcohol intoxication?

Headlines: Communicating Statin Evidence to Support Shared Decisions
Teaser: This essay highlights the principles of evidence-informed shared decision-making in the context of statin guidelines, but is widely applicable to other clinical decisions.

Headlines: Health Services, GP Detection of Suicidality Prior to Suicide
Teaser: Most people who die by suicide have been in contact with primary care within 12 months prior to death. Are primary care providers failing to recognize signs of suicidality in their patients?

Headlines: Effect of Obesity on Disability and Pain After Lumbar Fusion
Teaser: In what ways does being overweight or obese impact the outcomes of lumbar spinal fusion?

Headlines: Tapering and Discontinuation of TNF-a Blockers in RA
Teaser: Can clinical and ultrasound-based remission be used to select patients with rheumatoid arthritis eligible to taper and discontinue TNF-a blockers?

Headlines: Light Alcohol Consumption: Predictor of Fatty Liver in MetS
Teaser: New research studies whether minimal alcohol intake is protective against fatty liver in women with metabolic syndrome.

Headlines: Variation in the Serotonin Transporter Gene and Alcoholism
Teaser: This study investigates the importance of genetic and epigenetic factors in alcohol dependence, focusing on the serotonin transporter gene and its role as a moderator of treatment response.

Headlines: Bone Changes After Bisphosphonate Therapy 'Drug Holiday'
Teaser: Understanding the bone changes that occur after discontinuing bisphosphonate therapy for osteoporosis may help clinicians decide the optimal time to resume treatment.

Headlines: Tobacco Use Among Middle and High School Students: US
Teaser: While the data shows that the use of some forms of tobacco has decreased in recent years among middle and high school students, a troubling trend upwards is seen in others--especially e-cigarettes.

Headlines: Oxidative Stress, Inflammation, Endothelial Function in T2D
Teaser: These interrelated factors have been associated with the development of cardiovascular disease. Are they also linked to the incidence of type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: A New Diagnostic Tool for Transient Ischaemic Attack
Teaser: A new web and mobile app shows promise as a diagnostic tool for transient ischemic attack

Headlines: Genome Association of Anti-TNF Response in Patients With RA
Teaser: Can genetic biomarkers predict anti-TNF response in RA patients?

Headlines: Colonoscopy Reduces Colorectal Cancer Incidence and Mortality
Teaser: What does the latest research tell us about the role of colonoscopy in reducing both colorectal cancer incidence and mortality in patients with non-malignant findings?

Headlines: Occupation and Risk of Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma and Its Subtypes
Teaser: Do specific occupations confer a higher risk of developing non-Hodgkin lymphoma?

Headlines: Diet, Lifestyle in Chronic Prostatitis/Pelvic Pain Severity
Teaser: Certain dietary and lifestyle factors may contribute to pain severity in chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome. What are they?

Headlines: Pharmacological Interventions for Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis
Teaser: Severe alcoholic hepatitis is a serious disease. Are corticosteroids in combination with other drugs the best possible treatment?

Headlines: Patients' Risk Attitude and Their Adherence to Statins
Teaser: Does a patient's attitude and perceptions towards risk influence their adherence to statin therapy?

Headlines: Public Health Clinic-based HCV Testing and Linkage to Care
Teaser: Do public health clinics have the capacity to provide HCV services, how do they deal with the racial and socioeconomic diversity of patients, and do these patients ultimately get the appropriate care that they need?

Headlines: Chronic HCV Infection: A New Cardiovascular Risk Factor?
Teaser: Are patients with chronic hepatitis C at an increased risk for developing cardiovascular disease? This new study explores the connection.

Source: Annals of Clinical Microbiology and Antimicrobials
Headlines: Mortality Predictors of Staphylococcus aureus Bacteremia
Teaser: What factors might influence mortality and outcome in patients with S. aureus bacteremia?

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: The Impact of Antiretroviral Therapy on Lung Immunology
Teaser: A new study examines the pulmonary implications of antiretroviral therapy for HIV -- specifically on lung immunology.

Headlines: Nurse Practitioners in the World of Pain Management
Teaser: Read a scenario that includes a nurse practitioner being investigated by the Drug Enforcement Agency for writing unauthorized prescriptions for controlled substances.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Infarct Size and Outcomes Following Primary PCI
Teaser: This study looked at the prognostic value of infarct size in patients with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.

Headlines: What Influences 11-Year-Olds to Drink?
Teaser: In the UK, nearly 14% of 11-year-olds have had an alcoholic drink. What factors might be encouraging them to do so?

Headlines: 'Moderate' Drinking Linked to LV Dysfunction in HTN Patients
Teaser: One to two alcoholic drinks a day was enough to worsen the risk of left ventricular diastolic dysfunction in people with hypertension but no history of alcohol addiction, in a study conducted in Italy.

Headlines: The Highs and Lows of Loperamide Abuse
Teaser: How an over-the-counter medication for diarrhea has become a worrying and potentially lethal drug of abuse.

Headlines: Mental Health Disorders Common Even Before Cancer Diagnosis
Teaser: Common mental disorders start to increase months before patients receive a cancer diagnosis, and although mood disturbances decrease over time, rates remain elevated out to 10 years.

Headlines: Non-COPD Lung Disease Still Spells Trouble for Smokers
Teaser: Even when lung function does not meet criteria for COPD, smokers can still have functional impairment and exacerbations.

Headlines: Most Americans Rate Their Health as Very Good or Excellent
Teaser: Despite an uptick in Americans reporting serious psychological distress, two thirds consider themselves in very good or excellent health, the CDC reports.

Headlines: Buprenorphine: Long-term Efficacy for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: First extension trial showed that many patients were no longer opioid dependent, but some had turned to heroin.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Are Often Inappropriately Prescribed
Teaser: Although the drugs have known adverse effects for people with depression, 52% of prescriptions, which often come from primary care physicians, were concurrent with prescriptions for antidepressants.

Headlines: Framingham: Low HDL, in Isolation, Not a CV Risk Predictor
Teaser: "We're not taking away the importance of HDL. We're just putting it into perspective," says a researcher. "We have yet to prove that either raising HDL     levels or improving its function reduces CV risk."

Headlines: Long-term Smoking and the Brain: No Neurodegenerative Effects
Teaser: Contrary to previous reports, cigarette smoking does not have any neurodegenerative effects on the brain, either alone or in association with alcohol abuse, new research shows.

Headlines: Abuse of OTC Antidiarrheal Meds Linked to Cardiac Deaths
Teaser: Abuse of over-the-counter, opioid-based antidiarrheal drugs is a growing problem that has been linked to cardiac dysrhythmia and death, new research shows.

Headlines: China's Cigarette Sales Fall Slightly After Tobacco Tax - WHO
Teaser: Cigarette sales in China fell slightly over the past year after a hike in tobacco taxes, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday, as the country works to suppress a habit with major healthcare costs.

Headlines: Lean for Life Linked to Lowest Mortality, With Some Nuances
Teaser: Researchers looked at optimal BMI number for lowest risk and how that has changed over past decades, as well as effect of weight trends over a lifetime and     the impact of smoking, other comorbidities.

Headlines: Adopting a Dog a Useful Therapeutic Adjunct for PTSD
Teaser: Adopting a pet dog may be a useful therapeutic adjunct in veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder, preliminary research suggests.

Headlines: Persistent Childhood Asthma Linked to Early COPD
Teaser: Persistent childhood asthma was linked to signs of COPD before age 30 years; children with a pattern of decreased lung growth or decreased lung function at baseline and males may be at increased risk.

Headlines: FDA OKs Buprenorphine Implant (Probuphine) for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The new buprenorphine subdermal implant could be 'game changer' in the battle to combat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: Off-Label Antidepressant Prescribing Increasingly Common
Teaser: Off-label prescribing of antidepressants is increasing, particularly for insomnia and pain, even though their efficacy has not been established for these conditions, new research shows.

Headlines: Risk Profiles, PCI Outcomes Worse in Younger Women Than Men
Teaser: "The study gives an insight into the risk profile in young women compared with men, and an insight into how we as clinicians are making decisions," especially about antiplatelet therapy, researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes for IR Opioid but Without Abuse Labeling
Teaser: Despite the drug company's presentations, FDA advisory committee members didn't find enough evidence to recommend abuse-deterrent labeling for the new immediate-release product.

Headlines: Motivational Interviewing Promotes Patient Behavior Change
Teaser: A collaborative approach to doctor-patient interactions can promote positive change by strengthening the patient's motivation and commitment, one expert reported.

Headlines: FDA Campaign Aims to Curb Smoking Among LGBT Young Adults
Teaser: A $35.7 million campaign, initiated by the FDA, aims to help young adult lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgendered persons stop smoking.

Headlines: Psoriasis, Obesity, and Diabetes May Share Genetic Link
Teaser: A Danish twins study has found a strong association between psoriasis, type 2 diabetes, and obesity, with some indication there may be a modest genetic     link between the three.

Headlines: FDA Panel: Physician Opioid Training Should Be Mandatory
Teaser: A 2-day FDA advisory panel meeting this week focused on ways to modify the opioid analgesic Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies.

Headlines: Impulse Control Problems Linked to Antipsychotic, FDA Warns
Teaser: The FDA is warning of impulse control problems associated with the atypical antipsychotic aripiprazole.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2016 Annual Meeting
Teaser: The largest psychiatric conference in the world, the 2016 American Psychiatric Association 2016 Annual Meeting will feature 450 scientific sessions and new, innovative learning formats for clinicians.

Headlines: Arsenic-Contaminated Well Water Boosts Bladder Cancer Risk
Teaser: Arsenic contamination in well water could be responsible for the unusually high rates of bladder cancer in northern New England.

Headlines: Exercise Cuts the Risk for 13 Cancers
Teaser: The risk of developing 13 types of cancer is reduced significantly by higher levels of physical activity, strengthening exercise recommendations, suggest the results of a pooled analysis.

Headlines: Rates of Readmission After Delivery on the Rise
Teaser: Increasing rates of obesity and comorbidities in pregnancy may be important factors in readmission, researchers suggest.

Headlines: FDA Okays Oral Formulation of Perampanel (Fycompa)
Teaser: Perampanel (Fycompa) will now be available in oral suspension formulation for partial-onset seizures with or without secondary generalized seizures, as well as primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures for patients aged 12 years and older.

Headlines: Office Workers Sit Less With Intervention, Up Muscle Mass
Teaser: A multicomponent intervention reduced sitting in offices by 71 minutes per working day and body fat by 0.61% at 3 months. Participants stood and moved     around more without disrupting daily tasks.

Headlines: Gun Laws May Allow Docs to Counsel Patients, Report Ownership
Teaser: Physicians can legally counsel their patients on gun ownership and report any concerns to authorities, researchers say.

Headlines: Plain Packaging for Cigarettes in the UK, Ireland, and France
Teaser: Following a historic court ruling in the United Kingdom, cigarettes will now have to be sold in plain packaging with prominent graphic health warnings.

Headlines: Nurses Cut Rate of Hospital-Acquired Pressure Ulcers in Half
Teaser: A nurse-led initiative reduced the incidence of hospital-acquired pressure ulcers by half, saving one hospital hundreds of thousands of dollars.

Headlines: FDA Makes E-Cigs Off-Limits to Minors
Teaser: Starting on August 8, it will be illegal for retailers to sell any tobacco product, not just traditional cigarettes, to minors.

Headlines: Buprenorphine 'Underused' in Primary Care as Opioid Abuse Soars
Teaser: Only a small percentage of clinicians in primary care use one of the most important weapons against opioid abuse in the setting of chronic pain, experts say.

Headlines: AAP Calls for a Full-time Nurse in Every School
Teaser: Nurses should team up with a physician in every district, the policy paper adds. Medical, legal, and societal needs call for highlighting the school nurse role to improve health and school attendance.

Headlines: Are Patient Satisfaction Surveys Driving the Opioid Epidemic?
Teaser: The authors of this commentary argue that physicians' fears of receiving low patient satisfaction scores are a contributing factor in the overprescription of opioids.

Headlines: National Pain Strategy: Implications for Pharmacy Practice
Teaser: How will the National Pain Strategy, currently under development, impact the pharmacist's role in the optimal management of patients experiencing pain?

Headlines: Personality Predictors of Outcomes in Depressed Alcoholics
Teaser: Are there specific personality characteristics that can help predict outcomes for depressed, alcohol-dependent patients?

Headlines: Vitamin D and Lung Function Decline in Adults With Asthma
Teaser: Are low serum vitamin D levels associated with greater lung function decline in adults with asthma?

Headlines: Blurring the Line Between NRT and Smokeless Tobacco Products
Teaser: Tobacco companies are starting to market nicotine replacement therapies, along with tobacco products that resemble NRT aids. What are the implications for regulation and tobacco cessation?

Headlines: Psychosis Induced by Amphetamines
Teaser: Recent studies on amphetamine-induced psychosis provide updated knowledge about precipitating factors, the complex relationship between amphetamine-induced and primary psychosis, and treatment.

Headlines: Blood Lipid Concentrations and Colorectal Adenomas
Teaser: Is there an association between dyslipidemia and colorectal cancer?

Headlines: Electronic Cigarette Use Among Working Adults
Teaser: The latest data on the extent of current e-cigarette use shows an increase among U.S. working adults. In which fields is their use most prevalent?

Headlines: Health Policy, Adolescent Marijuana Use, and Mental Health
Teaser: How might policy changes surrounding marijuana decriminalization and legalization impact the relationship between adolescent marijuana use and mental health?

Headlines: Worse Health for Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual Adults
Teaser: Lesbian, gay, and bisexual adults in the US are at higher risk for poor physical and psychological health compared with their heterosexual counterparts.

Headlines: Novel Addiction Program May Boost Recovery Odds
Teaser: Access to health information resources improves communication with physicians and may help prevent relapse among patients with addictions.

Headlines: Novel Biomarkers of Early Schizophrenia Identified
Teaser: MRI techniques reveal changes in the brains of rats that may denote early signs of schizophrenia, a discovery that could pave the way for early diagnosis and treatment of the disease in humans.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Hypovitaminosis D in Elderly Women and Mortality
Teaser: Is the relationship between vitamin D deficiency and mortality in elderly women direct or mediated by poor health?

Headlines: Mobile Technology and the Digitization of Healthcare
Teaser: Which digital devices are helping to solve clinical problems? How will patients use and engage with these devices? These and other questions on the future of mHealth are addressed in this article.

Headlines: 'Strongest Evidence to Date' Ties Maternal Smoking to Psychosis
Teaser: A Finnish population-based study links prenatal nicotine exposure to increased risk for schizophrenia in young adult offspring.

Headlines: Outlaw Powdered Alcohol for Kids' Sake, AMA Says
Teaser: The AMA views just-add-water powdered alcohol as a stealth drink that American youth will abuse. The creator of a powdered-alcohol product contends that it's safer than the liquid version.

Headlines: Prescription Monitoring Programs Curb Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Prescription drug monitoring programs are associated with a sizable reduction in prescribing of Schedule II opioids by healthcare providers, according to a new study.

Headlines: Abuse, Misuse of Antidiarrheal Linked to Serious Heart Problems
Teaser: Abuse and misuse of the commonly available antidiarrheal medication loperamide has been linked to life-threatening cardiac events, according to a warning issued by the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: Midlife Health Effects of Cannabis Use Limited to Gum Disease?
Teaser: Long-term use of cannabis is associated with a significant increase in the risk of developing gum disease but does not appear to be linked to other adverse health outcomes, new data suggest.

Headlines: Alcohol Worsens 'Inflamm-Aging' in the Elderly
Teaser: Researchers are raising red flags about alcohol consumption in older individuals because of concerns about a phenomenon known as 'inflamm-aging,' which impairs the body's ability to fight infection.

Headlines: Drunkorexia: New Trend Sweeping College Campuses
Teaser: A new and troubling trend in which youth deliberately don't eat and then go on to drink alcohol to excess appears to be sweeping college campuses across the US.

Headlines: Glutamatergic Metabolites Elevated Across Brain Regions in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Patients with schizophrenia show elevations in glutamatergic metabolites in several brain regions, supporting the hypothesis that schizophrenia is associated with excess glutamatergic neurotransmission.

Headlines: Parkinson's Disease on the Rise?
Teaser: A new study has found a significant increase in the incidence of Parkinson's over the course of 3 decades, more than doubling in men since 1976.

Headlines: America, We Have a Problem: Solving the Opioid Overdose Epidemic
Teaser: The opioid overdose epidemic is not just a medical issue but is also a social problem. Dr Cahana discusses how clinicians can best address it from an interpersonal perspective.

Headlines: Acidosis: What Drug Is at Fault?
Teaser: New-onset acidosis is found in a previously well patient with diabetes. What drug is at fault?

Headlines: Legionnaires Disease on Rise in US--2016 Update
Teaser: Despite recent outbreaks of Legionnaires disease, experts believe that the infection is underdiagnosed.

Headlines: New Mid-Range HF Classification Debuts in ESC Guidelines
Teaser: UPDATED // "It's time to start dealing with the middle child of heart failure," said an expert. LCZ696 also makes its debut in the guidelines, and CRT concerns for     patients with narrow QRS are addressed.

Headlines: Preconception Counseling in Men
Teaser: Dr Ranit Mishori discusses the importance of preconception counseling and care for men, focusing on the recent position paper from the American Academy of Family Physicians.

Headlines: Prenatal Cannabis Exposure May Affect Kids' Brain Development
Teaser: Prenatal exposure to cannabis is significantly associated with differences in cortical thickness, particularly in the frontal brain, in preadolescent children, a new imaging study shows.

Headlines: Smoking, Weight Gain Barriers to Remission in Early RA
Teaser: Smoking and obesity have again been singled out as reasons that early measures to control rheumatoid arthritis (RA) might fail.

Headlines: AMA Members Are 'Leaders Among Leaders' Says New President
Teaser: Andrew Gurman, MD, the AMA's incoming president, said his group helps members and nonmembers alike, with members putting 'their shoulder to the grindstone' to improve the profession.

Headlines: A Primer on Smoking Cessation in Primary Care
Teaser: What are the most effective techniques to help today's smokers to quit?

Headlines: Evidence Backing Approval of Drug for Alcohol Misuse 'Weak'
Teaser: An in-depth look at studies on the alcohol-dependence drug nalmefene raises questions about efficacy and the approval process, researchers say.

Headlines: High Schoolers' Cigarette Use Hits Lowest Level Since 1991
Teaser: A national survey of youth behaviors showed traditional smoking is down to 11%, but now 24% of teenagers use e-cigarettes. Almost half said they texted or emailed while driving; 30% report having sex.

Headlines: FDA Committee Supports Approval of Vantrela ER
Teaser: An FDA committee supports approval of Vantrela ER, an extended-release hydrocodone product for pain management. It also recommends that the labeling for the drug reflect its abuse-deterrence properties.

Headlines: Opioids Common After Hospital Discharge; Storage Knowledge Poor
Teaser: About 15% of Medicare patients filled opioid prescriptions within a week of hospital discharge, and more than a third of them did so again after 90 days.

Headlines: Highlights From the American Psychiatric Association Meeting
Teaser: As this year's scientific program chair, Dr Steve Koh discusses some changes made to the format of the American Psychiatric Association's annual meeting and some of the meeting's hot topics.

Headlines: Quick Screen May Flag Opioid Abuse Risk
Teaser: Two new reports outline measures that may help quickly identify pain patients at risk for longer-term opioid use or for opioid abuse.

Headlines: Atrial Fibrillation Is a Risk Marker for Cancer: Women's Health Study
Teaser: The observed increase in cancer risk may not warrant a change in cancer screening but calls for much closer scrutiny and risk-factor reduction in AF patients.

Headlines: Marijuana Tops Alcohol, Cigarette Use in Young Adults
Teaser: The National Institute of Drug Abuse has published its national survey on drug use among young adults, along with a list of addiction studies programs throughout the US.

Headlines: Propofol and Fentanyl Dosing During Colonoscopy in the Elderly
Teaser: This study examines the pharmacodynamic interaction between fentanyl and propofol when used in combination for colonoscopy in elderly patients. What is the optimal dosing regimen?

Headlines: Seniors With Access to Medical Marijuana Use Fewer Prescription Drugs
Teaser: Physicians wrote significantly fewer prescriptions for painkillers and other medications for elderly and disabled patients who had legal access to medical marijuana, a new study finds.

Headlines: SAMHSA Expands Access to Buprenorphine for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: As part of a strategy to combat the US opioid epidemic, the SAMHSA finalized a rule this week to increase access to buprenorphine for individuals being treated for opioid addiction.

Headlines: Long-term Safety of Nucleotide Analogues in HBV Infection
Teaser: What's the current data on long-term safety of entecavir and tenofovir disoproxil fumarate in the treatment of chronic HBV infection?

Headlines: Paternal Betel-Quid, Cigarette Use Ups Offspring's Metabolic Risk
Teaser: Paternal chewing of the addictive stimulant betel quid or smoking cigarettes may start   children on the path to metabolic syndrome..

Headlines: Psychedelic Safe, Possibly Effective for Refractory Depression
Teaser: A small study shows that psilocybin, the active agent in 'magic mushrooms,' is safe and potentially effective in the treatment of refractory depression.

Headlines: Men at Twice the Risk for Sudden Cardiac Death as Women
Teaser: Results from Framingham Heart Study show men have twice the risk of sudden cardiac death as women, and the risk is increased in those with multiple risk     factors and those with elevated blood pressure alone.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Decreasing the Variability in ED Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: What accounts for the variability in opioid prescribing practices in the ED? Could a QI initiative help address the issue?

Headlines: No Confusion: Alcohol Causes Seven Cancers
Teaser: A new literature review reaffirms alcohol as a cause of cancer and discusses why there is 'confusion' about this relationship.

Headlines: All Smokers, but Especially Women, Face Increased SAH Risk
Teaser: Authors of a new study say they were 'a bit surprised that vulnerability to smoking may explain, at least in part, the previously reported increase in SAH risk in women.'

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: What We Know About the Pathogenesis of IPF
Teaser: Find out more about the current thinking regarding the pathogenesis of this progressive lung disease.

Headlines: Marijuana Blunts Reward Response in Young Adult Brains
Teaser: Long-term use of marijuana may blunt neural circuits involved in reward processing in the brain and heighten the risk for marijuana dependence and abuse of other substances over time.

Headlines: E-cigarettes Drive Increase in Adolescent Tobacco Use
Teaser: The proliferation of e-cigarettes has reversed the declining trend of tobacco use among adolescents, according to data from the Southern California Children's Health Study (CHS).

Headlines: Obesity Second Only to Smoking as Cause of Premature Death
Teaser: Overweight and obesity increase the risk of premature death, particularly among men, suggests an individual-participant data meta-analysis of almost four     million individuals from four continents.

Headlines: Will Physicians Get Relief on Medicare's Pain Questions?
Teaser: Medicare said it wouldn't calculate hospital payments using pain-management survey questions, widely seen as pressuring physicians to prescribe opioids. Some physicians want more relief.

Headlines: Uptick in Synthetic Marijuana Poisonings
Teaser: The increase in acute synthetic cannabinoid poisonings underscores the need for increased education and targeted prevention efforts, the CDC says.

Headlines: E-cigarettes Could Cut Smoking-related Deaths by 21% - Study
Teaser: E-cigarettes could lead to a 21 percent drop in deaths from smoking-related diseases in those born after 1997, according to a study published July 13 in Nicotine & Tobacco Research.

Headlines: Women May Not Admit to Smoking During Pregnancy
Teaser: Although only about 8 percent of pregnant women in a new U.S. study reported smoking cigarettes, twice as many tested positive for high levels of cotinine that indicates nicotine exposure.

Headlines: FDA Clears Remote Breathalyzer for Clinical Use
Teaser: The FDA has approved a handheld device, which has been used in law enforcement for years, that healthcare providers can use to remotely monitor patients' alcohol intake.

Headlines: Opioid Addiction Drug Underutilized in Medicare Patients
Teaser: Medicare physicians, particularly nonspecialists, are prescribing opioid agonist therapy to only a fraction of patients affected by opioid use disorder, results of a claims data analysis reveal.

Headlines: 1 in 12 Chance of Second Cancer in Many Survivors
Teaser: Cancer survivors are always at risk for a second primary cancer. A new study provides details, including that bladder cancer survivors are at most risk.

Headlines: e-Cigs' 'Cool Factor' a Major Draw for Teens
Teaser: Although e-cigarettes are promoted as a smoking cessation tool, new research shows that their main appeal for teens is that they are perceived as 'cool.'

Headlines: Far-Reaching Opioid Bill Goes to Obama for Signature
Teaser: The bipartisan bill aims to combat the epidemic of opioid addiction and overdose deaths, but Congressional action is still needed to fund it.

Headlines: 1 in 9 US Teens Experience Major Depression
Teaser: Rates of major depressive episodes among adolescents are reported in every state and in Washington, DC, a new report from SAMHSA shows.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Health Status in Baby Boomers With T2DM
Teaser: Are baby boomers with T2DM faring worse in terms of obesity and cardiovascular health than their counterparts in the previous generation?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Drug Utilization, Inappropriate Prescribing in Centenarians
Teaser: Are centenarians being inappropriately medicated? This study utilized EHR data to explore the epidemiology of drug prescribing in persons over 100 years of age.

Headlines: Risk Factors for DUI of Alcohol or Drugs Among Older Adults
Teaser: Older adults have increased susceptibility to the effects of alcohol and drugs and higher fatal injury risks from motor vehicle crashes. What might influence their driving under the influence?

Headlines: Fatty Acid Status During Pregnancy and Child Autistic Traits
Teaser: Polyunsaturated fatty acids play a role in brain development and function. Could low PUFA intake during pregnancy be a risk factor for autism?

Headlines: Long-term Survival and QoL in Critically Ill Cancer Patients
Teaser: A new study examines the long-term outcomes among cancer patients admitted to the ICU. What do we know about the prognosis of these patients?

Headlines: VTE Risk With Use of Hormone Therapy in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: This study is the first to include both local and systemic use, route of administration, and progestogen component in assessing the risk of VTE in peri- and postmenopausal women using hormone therapy.

Headlines: Metabolic Effects of Hormone Therapy in Transgender Patients
Teaser: What do we know about the safety and effects of transgender hormone therapy?

Headlines: Low Level of HDL Cholesterol and Risks of CHD, CVD, and Death
Teaser: Is a low HDL cholesterol level on its own a risk factor for coronary heart disease, cardiovascular disease and death?

Headlines: Lower Sodium Intake and Risk of Headaches in the Elderly
Teaser: Headaches have been associated with elevated blood pressure--as have high sodium diets. Can lowering sodium intake lead to a reduction in headaches in older persons with hypertension?

Headlines: Relationship Between Poor Lung Function and Diabetes Risk
Teaser: Is there an association between impaired lung function and the later development of diabetes? Find out about the possible connection.

Headlines: Statins and Risk of Bleeding: Evaluating Possible Bias
Teaser: Statins have been associated with protection against bleeding risk during treatment with vitamin K antagonists, but might those results--and other study outcomes showing incidental benefit--be biased?

Headlines: Vitamin D and Risk of Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis in NAFLD
Teaser: Is vitamin D deficiency associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease? This study explores the molecular pathways that contribute to the relationship of vitamin D and NAFLD.

Headlines: U.K. Guidelines for the Management of SJS/TEN in Adults 2016
Teaser: These new guidelines provide up-to-date, evidence-based recommendations for the diagnosis and management of the full spectrum of Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis in adults.

Headlines: Volatile Organic Compounds in Breath as Markers for IBS
Teaser: The diagnosis of IBS remains challenging, with no reliable biomarkers identified as of yet. Might detection of specific volatile organic compounds in exhaled breath be feasible as a diagnostic tool?

Headlines: Nelfinavir and Cancer Incidence in HIV-Positive Individuals
Teaser: This study examined the rates of cancer among HIV positive patients exposed to nelfinavir.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Pharmacist Interventions and Cardiovascular Risk
Teaser: Can expanding the role of community pharmacists to screen patients for CVD risk factors and provide treatment recommendations significantly reduce their risk for cardiovascular events?

Headlines: Efficacy of a Second TNFi After Discontinuation in Axial SpA
Teaser: This study investigated whether the response to a second TNF inhibitor is impacted after the first TNF inhibitor was stopped -- and if the reasoning behind drug discontinuation played a role.

Headlines: CV Care for the Patient With HIV: What You Need to Know
Teaser: Cardiovascular disease is becoming the leading cause of morbidity and mortality for patients infected with HIV. Learn what you need to know to care for patients.

Headlines: Treating Early Psychosis in the 'Real World'
Teaser: Four experts discuss how a new community-based treatment program can successfully help manage patients with first-episode psychosis.

Headlines: Trends in the Incidence of Parkinson Disease
Teaser: A large, long-term population-based cohort study reveals good news concerning the incidence of parkinsonism and Parkinson disease over the last 20 years.

Headlines: Opioid Agonist Treatment for the Opioid-Dependent Person: Where's the Data?
Teaser: Dr Peter Yellowlees discusses opioid agonist treatment for pharmaceutical opioid-dependent people.

Headlines: Upper Normal Values of BP Response to Exercise in Athletes
Teaser: What are the normal values and upper limits of blood pressure in response to exercise in healthy, elite athletes?

Headlines: HCV Drug Effective in Patients With Drug Addiction
Teaser: Successful treatment of HCV with elbasvir-grazoprevir in patients undergoing opioid agonist therapy suggests access to curative therapies should not be restricted in these patients.

Headlines: Coronary Event Risk in FH Remains High After ACS, Despite Statins
Teaser: An ACS hospitalization is "a very good opportunity to screen and identify patients with familial hypercholesterolemia," because it's far from rare, says the lead author.

Headlines: FDA Panels Back Abuse-Deterrent Arymo ER for Severe Pain
Teaser: Two advisory committees voted 18-1 that the new drug should be approved. They also voted overwhelmingly for labeling it as an abuse deterrent by oral, nasal, and intravenous routes.

Headlines: Teaching Future Doctors About Addiction
Teaser: Americans are overdosing at epidemic rates on opioids, and the nation's doctors are inadequately prepared to help, according to some public health experts. They say the shortfall begins in medical school.

Headlines: Vegetarian Diet: A Prescription for High Blood Pressure?
Teaser: A new review examines the blood pressure-lowering benefits of vegetarian or vegan diets.

Headlines: Lung Cancer in COPD, It Is Not Just the Cigarette Smoke
Teaser: The development of lung cancer in patients with COPD has been linked with tobacco exposure, but other factors may also play a role.

Headlines: Sports-related Concussions: Current Management Strategies
Teaser: This article reviews the diagnosis of sports-related concussions both on and off the field, and presents therapeutic strategies for neurosurgeons as well as a multidisciplinary health care team.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Strain of Firefighting and Cardiac Event Risk
Teaser: The physical demands of firefighting may contribute to a higher risk of sudden cardiovascular events among these workers.

Headlines: Incident Hypertension and Metabolic Health, Obesity Status
Teaser: How are obesity status and metabolic health related to the development of incident hypertension? A new study examines the possible connection.

Headlines: Vaginal Estrogen for Mesh Complication After Prolapse Repair
Teaser: Could the preoperative application of vaginal estrogen help prevent postoperative mesh exposure?

Headlines: Stalled Progress in Smoke-Free Laws and Cigarette Excise Tax
Teaser: Has the enactment of comprehensive statewide anti-smoking policies such as raising cigarette taxes and implementing smoke-free laws plateaued?

Headlines: Risk and Costs of Incisional Hernia After Abdominal Surgery
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of the incisional hernia risk after abdominal surgery and the costs involved in the surgical treatment of this complication.

Headlines: Predicting Work Productivity in Patients Infected With HCV
Teaser: Can specific pre-treatment clinical and patient-reported factors predict work productivity impairment in HCV-infected patients?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Multimorbidity in Heart Failure: Effect on Outcomes
Teaser: How might comorbid conditions--both cardiovascular and otherwise--impact outcome in patients with heart failure?

Headlines: Effects of Interactive Patient Smartphone Support App in MI
Teaser: Can a smartphone-based interactive patient support tool improve treatment adherence and cardiovascular lifestyle in MI patients?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Case Series of Synthetic Cannabinoid Intoxication
Teaser: These cases highlight the potentially life-threatening toxicity associated with synthetic cannabinoid exposure.

Headlines: Pill Mill Doctor to Serve Jail Time
Teaser: The doctor's practice partner -- her husband -- was not accused of anything illegal but was censured by two medical boards.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Screening
Teaser: This review discusses current screening recommendations for the early detection of lung cancer and explores the potential benefits and risks.

Headlines: A Pathway Towards Hepatitis C Eradication
Teaser: What is the best strategy for eradication of HCV, and is this even an achievable goal? This review examines the feasibility and cost-effectiveness of "treatment as prevention" in injection drug users.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Gender Differences in ED Visits, Detox Referrals for Opioids
Teaser: What role does gender play in opioid-related ED visits and subsequent referrals to detox programs?

Headlines: Tobacco Product Use Among Adults -- United States, 2013-2014
Teaser: Despite progress in reducing cigarette smoking, this report indicates that cigarettes remain the most commonly used tobacco product, and use of novel tobacco products is on the rise.

Headlines: Diep vs Pedicled Tram Flap Outcomes After Breast Surgery
Teaser: How do these two techniques for reconstructive breast surgery compare in terms of complications and outcomes?

Headlines: The Science and Questions Surrounding CTE
Teaser: Does the presence of cerebral tau protein equal a diagnosis of CTE? Is CTE a progressive disorder? These and other common questions regarding CTE are addressed in this article.

Headlines: Estimating RSV Hospitalization Among Premature Infants
Teaser: A new scoring too may help identify which infants are most at risk for RSV-associated hospitalization.

Headlines: Prevention of Alcohol and Other Drug Use in the Digital Age
Teaser: This systematic review summarizes recent substance abuse prevention programs delivered by computers and the Internet. What's effective, and what's not?

Headlines: Nutritional Status Impacts Radical Cystectomy Recovery
Teaser: Could poor nutrition during the preoperative period negatively impact recovery after radical cystectomy?

Headlines: Atopic Dermatitis Is Not Associated With Actinic Keratosis
Teaser: Are individuals with atopic dermatitis at higher risk for actinic keratosis than those without?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Health Status by Occupational Group
Teaser: Does prevalence of cardiovascular disease vary by occupation? This study looked at the association of specific cardiovascular health metrics with various occupational groups.

Headlines: Disparities in Adult Cigarette Smoking -- US
Teaser: This report detailing the prevalence of cigarette smoking in the United States by both gender and racial/ethnic group indicates that strong disparities still exist among certain populations.

Headlines: Get Moving: High Physical-Activity Level Reduces Risk of 5 Diseases
Teaser: The greatest risk reduction for diabetes, cancers, heart disease, and stroke is seen at higher activity levels than those recommended by the World Health     Organization.

Headlines: Associations Between Sleep and Health-Risk Behaviors
Teaser: Is insufficient sleep associated with certain health-risk behaviors? This study examines the connection among rural adolescents.

Headlines: Diagnostic Guidelines for Fetal Alcohol Syndrome Updated
Teaser: Proposed updates to diagnostic guidelines for fetal alcohol spectrum disorders reflect advancements in understanding of the cognitive, behavioral, and physical distinctions of these disorders.

Headlines: A 44-Year-Old Man With Blurred Vision
Teaser: A 44-year-old man notes the gradual onset of blurred vision and the inability to move his eyes. What is the most likely cause?

Headlines: Is Psychoanalyzing Our Politicians Fair Game?
Teaser: Dr Nassir Ghaemi discusses the ethics of 'diagnosing' our political candidates from afar and how the Goldwater rule could use an update.

Headlines: Anabolic Steroid Use in Nonathletes: Why?
Teaser: Most clinicians are unaware of the scope of anabolic steroid abuse, and rarely ask patients about it.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Screening Guidelines: More Harm Than Good?
Teaser: Dr Kenny Lin discusses the cautious advice many family physicians are giving to their patients.

Headlines: What’s the Best Way to Manage Nontubal Ectopic Pregnancies?
Teaser: Dr Peter Kovacs reviews a case series of nontubal ectopic pregnancies that were treated at a large tertiary hospital.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent Opioids: What You Need to Know
Teaser: Abuse-deterrent drugs are the latest weapon against prescription opioid abuse and misuse in the United States.

Headlines: Dentistry and the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Dentists are frequent prescribers of prescription drugs for pain following dental procedures. What is their role in fighting the opioid epidemic?

Headlines: What Can Be Learned From a Cough?
Teaser: Does a person's cough hold clues to underlying disease? And could identifying different cough 'neurophenotypes' be the key to more effective diagnosis and treatment of airway diseases?

Headlines: A Review of Pediatric Bacterial Meningitis
Teaser: Pediatric bacterial meningitis is a medical emergency, and its appropriate treatment depends on the causative organism. Learn about its diagnosis and treatment options in this review.

Headlines: Psychiatric Illness in Parents, Suicide/Violence in Kids
Teaser: Parental psychiatric illness increases the risk that offspring will attempt suicide and engage in violent, offending behaviors from the age of 15 onwards.

Headlines: Neuroimaging Improves Prediction Model for Alcohol Use
Teaser: A prediction model incorporating neuroimaging data with conventional demographic information shows accuracy in predicting risk of adolescents transitioning to alcohol use.

Headlines: Illegally Manufactured Fentanyl Linked to Rise in Overdoses
Teaser: Research showed a sharp increase in production and distribution of illegally manufactured fentanyl that tracks with increases in overdose deaths; fentanyl prescriptions remained stable.

Headlines: FDA Okays Abuse-Deterrent Troxyca ER for Severe Pain
Teaser: The abuse-deterrent capsule, formerly known as ALO-02, consists of an outer 'pellet' of extended-release oxycodone around a naltrexone core and is for severe pain when other options are ineffective.

Headlines: Sleep Apnea May Worsen Liver Disease for Obese Teens

Headlines: Contraceptive Use and Risk of Crohn's Disease Complications
Teaser: Which types of contraceptives increase risk of surgery in women with Crohn disease?

Headlines: Squamous Dysplasia in the Esophagus Tied to Risk of Additional Lesions

Headlines: Marriage May Protect From Drinking Too Much
Teaser: A novel study of twins provides more evidence that relationship status influences alcohol drinking patterns.

Headlines: College Kids Drink More, Smoke Less Than Other Young Adults
Teaser: A new SAMHSA survey on trends in substance use also showed that full-time students have different perceptions of risks regarding some drugs than those not in school.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Abuse Tied to Increased Risk of Teen Suicide
Teaser: Suicide is a leading cause of death for teens worldwide, and the odds of suicide attempts may be higher when adolescents abuse prescription drugs, a Chinese study suggests.

Headlines: Marijuana Tied to Ongoing, Subclinical Psychosis in Teens

Headlines: FDA Contest Seeks App to Fight Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA is sponsoring a contest to come up with an app that will quickly bring naloxone to individuals who are overdosing on prescription or illicit opioids.

Headlines: Effect of Renal Impairment on Atherosclerosis
Teaser: Total homocysteine levels may contribute to the effect of renal impairment on atherosclerosis. What other factors may be involved?

Headlines: Effects of Stretching on Menopausal and Depressive Symptoms
Teaser: Might a simple program of home-based light-intensity exercise such as stretching improve menopausal and depressive symptoms in middle-aged women?

Headlines: Tobacco Advertising in Sports and Sporting Events

Headlines: How Effective Is Physical Therapy for Common Low Back Pain?
Teaser: Is physical therapy an effective non-surgical treatment option for low back pain? A new study examines the question.

Headlines: Should Clinicians Recommend E-cigarettes to Smokers? No.
Teaser: In this counterpoint commentary, the authors cite poor effectiveness, little regulation, and potential for harm as reasons against routinely recommending e-cigarettes to their patients who smoke.

Headlines: Should Clinicians Recommend E-cigarettes to Smokers? Yes.
Teaser: In this commentary, the author presents arguments in favor of the use of e-cigarettes as a viable method for encouraging smoking cessation.

Headlines: Burnout Syndrome in Critical Care Health Care Professionals
Teaser: Burnout is an issue faced by many health care workers, particularly those in the critical care field. The Critical Care Societies Collaborative aims to raise awareness of this important issue.

Headlines: Adherence and Response in HCV Infected Persons on Sofosbuvir
Teaser: Might a shorter duration sofosbuvir-based regimen for HCV infection be as effective as the currently approved duration?

Headlines: Weight Gain After ART and Risk of CVD and Diabetes
Teaser: Is weight gain after ART initiation associated with an increased risk of developing cardiovascular disease and diabetes?

Teaser: Is serum troponin I concentration useful as a predictive marker for cardiovascular risk in otherwise healthy individuals?

Headlines: Gender Gap in MI Not Merely Due to CV Risk Factors, Menopause

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Add-on Treatments in Older Adults With Persistent Asthma
Teaser: This study compared the risks and benefits of long-acting beta-agonists with those of leukotriene receptor antagonists in older adults with asthma already taking inhaled corticosteroids.

Headlines: Public Health Strategies to Prevent Preterm Birth
Teaser: This brief report outlines strategies to reduce and prevent preterm birth and its complications, highlighting several public health initiatives currently underway in the US.

Headlines: Rosuvastatin Slows Progression of Atherosclerosis in HIV
Teaser: Find out what there is to know about the effect of rosuvastatin on subclinical atherosclerosis among HIV-infected individuals receiving antiretroviral therapy.

Headlines: Features of Respiratory Viral Infections Among Inpatients
Teaser: What are the clinical signs and symptoms of respiratory viral infections among hospital inpatients, and how might they differ from those of bacterial infections?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Outcomes of Patients With Atrial Fibrillation Undergoing PCI
Teaser: Is a history of atrial fibrillation an independent risk factor for poor clinical outcomes after PCI?

Headlines: Stress and Mortality Among People With Multimorbidity
Teaser: How do high levels of stress affect the survival of people with multiple chronic conditions?

Headlines: FDA Advisory Committee Reviews Opioids in Kids
Teaser: Children may be undertreated, say experts, as clinicians tackle epidemic of misuse and abuse of opioid drugs across the country.

Headlines: Nutritional Status Predicts Readmission After Spine Surgery
Teaser: Malnourished patients may be at a higher risk for unplanned hospital readmission after undergoing elective spinal procedures.

Headlines: Hot Flashes: Emerging Cardiovascular Risk Factors
Teaser: This study examined the association of hot flashes with endothelial dysfunction, hypertension, and other markers of cardiovascular disease. Could severe hot flashes be an indicator of CVD risk?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Large Financial Incentives for Long-term Smoking Cessation
Teaser: Would large financial incentives encourage low-income smokers to quit--and would they continue to abstain over the long-term?

Headlines: Risk of Preterm Birth After Influenza Vaccine During Pregnancy
Teaser: Are observational studies evaluating the effect of maternal influenza immunization on fetal health prone to bias?

Headlines: Osteonecrosis of the Jaw and Bone-Targeted Therapies
Teaser: Bone-targeted therapies are commonly used in urological cancer patients with bone metastases -- but these drugs may increase the risk of developing osteonecrosis of the jaw.

Teaser: Patients with hepatitis C infection are getting older in the United States, yet are underrepresented in clinical trials. How does age impact outcomes with and without antiviral treatment?

Headlines: HCV Treatment Failure and Risk of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
Teaser: Are patients with hepatitis C who receive antiviral treatment but fail to achieve sustained virological response more likely to develop hepatocellular carcinoma than untreated patients?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Underutilization of CAD Testing in New-Onset Heart Failure
Teaser: Are patients hospitalized with new-onset heart failure receiving appropriate and timely diagnostic testing for ischemic coronary artery disease, as guidelines recommend?

Headlines: Cardiovascular Risk Prediction in HIV-Infected Patients
Teaser: How do these risk prediction models compare in terms of estimating CVD risk among HIV-infected patients?

Headlines: Relief for the Symptoms of Rhinosinusitis: Case Challenges
Teaser: In a case series, Gordon Sun reviews the many formulations and delivery methods for use of intranasal saline to relieve symptoms of acute and chronic rhinosinusitis.

Headlines: Tips for Talking to Patients About Fertility
Teaser: Not enough patients are being told about their reproductive options during well-woman care visits, fertility experts say.

Headlines: Assess Those Small Airways With FEV3
Teaser: The COPDGene study produces valuable data on use of a novel spirometric method to identify a subset of current or former smokers with small airway disease.

Headlines: Are Oral Bisphosphonates Associated With Wet AMD?
Teaser: With the rising prevalence of oral bisphosphonate use and wet age-related macular degeneration, we must ask ourselves if the two are related.

Headlines: Testify Against a Colleague? Kiss Your Friendship Goodbye
Teaser: Although no one wants to testify against a friend or colleague, there are times when it can't or shouldn't be avoided. Here's some advice to help you through the process.

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: Oncoplastic Approach for Malignant Chest Wall Tumors
Teaser: A multidisciplinary thoracic oncoplastic approach may help minimize wound complications and improve outcomes among patients treated with chest wall resection and reconstruction.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Bioabsorbable Intracoronary Matrix for LV Remodeling After MI
Teaser: This study investigated whether intracoronary injection of a novel alginate, bioabsorbable cardiac matrix, might attenuate adverse LV remodeling after large myocardial infarctions.

Headlines: Differentiating the Symptom of Dysphonia
Teaser: Find out which conditions should be considered as an underlying cause of dysphonia.

Headlines: Effects of Dark Chocolate on Oxidative Stress in NASH
Teaser: Can chocolate be any more awesome? New research finds that cocoa polyphenols may reduce oxidative stress in NASH.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Predicting Risk of Developing Pneumonia in Older Adults
Teaser: The authors developed risk scores to predict 2-year risk of developing community-acquired pneumonia in dementia-free older adults, using data commonly present in the electronic health record.

Headlines: Mixed Messages Common in Physician Advice on e-Cigarettes
Teaser: Physician responses in an online health forum show general negativity toward the increasingly popular e-cigarettes, and the lack of evidence on cessation efficacy is not well communicated.

Headlines: More US Adults Using Marijuana as Attitudes Change
Teaser: As social and legal acceptance of marijuana grows, many more American adults are using the drug, and fewer think it is risky, new data show.

Headlines: Smoking May Cut Life Expectancy in ALS

Headlines: Smoking 'Leaves Footprint on Our DNA'
Teaser: Smoking cigarettes can alter genes and may have a long-lasting effect on our DNA, according to new research.

Headlines: DEA Sounds Alarm on Elephant Tranquilizer Carfentanil
Teaser: The DEA is warning the public and police nationwide about the risks of carfentanil, an analogue of the synthetic opioid analgesic fentanyl, which is 100 times more potent than fentanyl.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Prescribers Treat Far Below Legal Patient Limits
Teaser: Physicians with waivers to prescribe buprenorphine for opioid addiction have the capacity to treat more patients, and efforts are needed to get more patients treated, research shows.

Headlines: Outcomes of Patients With Hypothyroidism Undergoing PCI
Teaser: Are patients with a history of hypothyroidism at increased risk of major adverse cardiovascular and cerebral events following PCI?

Headlines: Prevention of Autoantibody-Positive Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: A new review looks at the potential risk factors that may contribute to the development of rheumatoid arthritis and discusses preventive strategies.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: ED Hydrocodone/Acetaminophen Prescriptions in the VA
Teaser: How have prescribing patterns for hydrocodone/acetaminophen among veterans changed in recent years?

Headlines: Androgen Deprivation and Incidence of IBS in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Might sex hormones play a role in the etiology of IBS? This study examines the potential link between androgen deprivation therapy and IBS incidence in patients with prostate cancer.

Headlines: Integrated Treatment for Anxiety, Depression and Alcoholism
Teaser: This study assessed the effectiveness of an integrated CBT intervention for patients with alcohol dependence and comorbid depression and/or anxiety disorder.

Headlines: Narcissism and Frontostriatal Connectivity
Teaser: The authors posit that narcissism arises, at least in part, from a neural disconnect between the self and reward. Can a correlating structural deficit be located via diffusion tensor imaging?

Headlines: Optimizing Stroke Prevention in Patients With AF
Teaser: Can a computerized antithrombotic risk assessment tool improve clinical decision making regarding antithrombotic therapies for patients with atrial fibrillation?

Headlines: Preventing Suicide Through a Public Health Approach
Teaser: This brief report outlines suicide prevention strategies and interventions that can be accomplished with comprehensive, coordinated programs from the public health sector.

Headlines: Time-Dependent Risk of Cancer After a Diabetes Diagnosis
Teaser: This very large cohort study investigated the risk association between diabetes and both common and uncommon cancers, focusing on determination of how risk changes over time.

Headlines: Exposure to Tobacco Smoke During Pregnancy and Perinatal Death

Headlines: Parental Tobacco Smoking and Acute Myeloid Leukemia
Teaser: The association between tobacco smoke and acute myeloid leukemia is well established in adults. Does parental smoking before, during, or after pregnancy promote a similar relationship in children?

Headlines: Serum Vitamin D and the Incidence of Atrial Fibrillation
Teaser: Might serum vitamin D levels influence the risk of atrial fibrillation?

Headlines: New Primary Care Tool Detects Problem Substance Use
Teaser: The 2- to 5-minute questionnaire also pinpointed specific substances and risk levels but needs refinement before being used to identify full substance use disorders, researchers found.

Headlines: Endocarditis Hospitalizations of IV Drug Abusers Jump
Teaser: The trend in hospitalizations of injection-drug users for infective endocarditis mirrors the trends of the opioid, heroin, HCV, and overdose epidemics.

Headlines: Timing of Cocaine Relapse Pinpointed

Headlines: Top Medical Leaders Debate Nation's Public Health Progress
Teaser: The speakers shared views on Zika, disease prevention, funding for emergency outbreaks, social determinants of health, and FDA priorities.

Headlines: 'One-Stop Shop' for Diabetic Neuropathy Along With Eye Screening
Teaser: While diabetic patients are waiting for their eye drops to take effect at retinopathy screening, they could quickly be assessed for early diabetic     neuropathy with new devices, at a one-stop shop.

Headlines: Extended Cardiac Rehab, Tailored Counseling May Help Some Patients

Headlines: Nix Box Warning on Smoking Cessation Drug, FDA Panel Says
Teaser: A joint FDA advisory committee has voted to remove the box warning on smoking cessation drug varenicline following the release of a large postmarketing study.

Headlines: Researchers Still Responding to Far-reaching Effects of 9/11
Teaser: Researchers from the World Trade Center Health Program presented their findings about the effects of 9/11 on responders and survivors involved in the New York City attack.

Headlines: Mental Health Emergencies a Focus of ACEP 2016
Teaser: The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) 2016 Scientific Assembly will cover the gamut of emergency medicine, with a spotlight on mental health emergencies and opioid abuse.

Headlines: Media, Concussion Research Featured at Pediatrics Meeting
Teaser: Electronic media, concussions, obesity, and infectious diseases will figure prominently at the American Academy of Pediatrics National Conference.

Headlines: Clinicians Urged to Manage HIV-Infected Elders Differently From Younger People
Teaser: Differences in immune response to antiretroviral therapy, multimorbidity and antiretroviral toxicities are among the factors that differentiate older adults with HIV from their younger counterparts, and should influence care plans, researchers suggest.

Headlines: Alcohol and Smoking Linked to Premature Death in Many Cancers

Headlines: Legalized Marijuana Boosts High School Dropout Rates
Teaser: States where marijuana is legal are experiencing an increase in high school dropout rates and lower educational attainment among high school grads who failed to go to college or get a college degree.

Headlines: Southern Discomfort: Top for Smoking-Related Cancer Deaths
