Headlines: Prioritize Injection Drug Users for Hepatitis C Treatment
Teaser: Treating drug users at high risk of spreading hepatitis C will help eliminate the virus, new research suggests.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Can 'Help Smokers to Stop'
Teaser: New evidence shows that a rise in e-cigarette use may be associated with an increase in people giving up smokingtobacco products, suggesting there should be a more liberal approach to e-cigarette regulations.

Headlines: One Third of Dementia May Be Preventable With Lifestyle Change
Teaser: A new report on dementia prevention, intervention, and care has recommended a comprehensive package of evidence-based actions, including management of nine key lifestyle factors.

Headlines: FDA Plans to Curb Nicotine Levels in Tobacco
Teaser: The FDA has announced it will pursue lowering the nicotine content in cigarettes to nonaddictive levels as part of an overall plan to protect youth and reduce tobacco-related disease and death.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for First-in-Class Opioid
Teaser: Nektar's NKTR-181 is the first full mu-opioid agonist molecule designed to provide potent pain relief without the high levels of euphoria that can lead to abuse.

Headlines: Heavy Cannabis Use Associated With Depression, Suicidality
Teaser: Previous research has pointed to an association between heavy cannabis use and depression and suicidality. A study comparing monozygotic twins confirms the association.

Headlines: Three Key Factors Significantly Reduce Opioid-Related Deaths
Teaser: A large study of more than 32,000 veterans shows that three key clinical measures can reduce opioid-related deaths by almost one third.

Headlines: Love Affair With Alcohol Is Driving GI Cancers
Teaser: Daily drinking rates in Europe are the highest in the world, with an average of two drinks per day, and this is driving an increase in colorectal and other GI cancers.

Headlines: Another Urban, Rural Divide in US: Cancer Death Rates
Teaser: Although the incidence of cancer is lower in rural areas than in urban centers, death rates are higher in rural areas.

Headlines: Endo Pharma Agrees to Pull Abuse-Deterrent Opioid
Teaser: Following a June request by the FDA, the company will pull its abuse-deterrent extended-release formulation of oxymorphone (Opana ER) from the market.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing Remains High, Varies Widely by County
Teaser: Despite a decline in opioid prescriptions, the amount of opioids prescribed in 2015 remains three times what it was in 1999, the CDC says.

Headlines: Smoking-Cessation Drug Prescriptions Rarely Filled Post-MI
Teaser: A new study shows physicians almost always advise patients to stop smoking during hospitalization for an MI, but the advice doesn't appear to translate into prescriptions filled for smoking-cessation drugs.

Headlines: Is Parental Smoking Child Abuse?
Teaser: When a patient smokes, or takes medications, their children's health may be harmed. What can physicians do to change parents' behavior to eliminate these risks?

Headlines: What Influences Ventral and Inguinal Hernia Repair Outcomes?
Teaser: Dr Lowenfels comments on a study that investigated the reasons for recurrence of ventral and inguinal hernias.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Straining Critical Care Resources
Teaser: More patients are ending up in the intensive care unit after overdosing on opioids, straining critical care resources, a new study finds.

Headlines: Essential Cancer Updates for Primary Care Physicians
Teaser: ASCO 2017, the most important cancer meeting of the year, featured important new data on cancer screening and prevention, as well as interventions to reduce cancer fatigue and fear.

Headlines: Kathiresan and Topol on Genomics of Heart Disease
Teaser: Eric Topol speaks with Sekar Kathiresan about cardiovascular genomics, why 'DNA isn't destiny,' and why we still have heart attacks in spite of statins.

Headlines: Lifetime Cancer Risk and Combined Contraceptives
Teaser: Dr Kovacs reviews a large, prospective cohort study of women who have or have never taken birth control pills and their risk for cancer.

Headlines: Prognostic Factors in Hospitalized CAP
Teaser: Which factors may predict the prognosis of patients hospitalized with community-acquired pneumonia?

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Racial and Ethnic Differences in the Genomics of Lung Cancer
Teaser: Racial and ethnic differences may impact rates of incidence, mortality, and survival of lung cancer.

Headlines: Trump Fails to Declare Opioid Crisis a National Emergency
Teaser: A few weeks after firmly stating his intention to declare the opioid crisis a national emergency, President Donald J. Trump has still not taken the necessary steps to do so.

Headlines: Zero Coronary Calcium a 'Gatekeeper' Screen in Acute Chest Pain?
Teaser: The US Senate has approved Jerome Adams, MD, to be the next surgeon general.

Headlines: Physician's Murder Highlights Risk of Saying 'No' to Opioids
Teaser: Among patients presenting to the ER with acute chest pain and a low- to intermediate-risk of acute coronary syndrome, a coronary artery calcium score of 0 had a high negative predictive value for CAD.

Headlines: DEA Proposes Significant Cuts to Opioid Production in 2018
Teaser: Todd Graham, MD, was shot to death by the husband of a patient after he refused to prescribe her opioid painkillers. It's a risky specialty, say pain-management physicians.

Headlines: Accidental Cannabis Intoxication in French Toddlers Surges
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) is proposing that the amount of opioids produced in 2018 be reduced by 20%, citing declining sales.

Headlines: As Trumpcare Bill Languishes, Former Opioid Users Cling to Lifeline
Teaser: Physicians should routinely consider this diagnosis whenever admitting an afebrile, comatose child, the researchers warn.

Headlines: Energy Drinks May Trigger Future Substance Use
Teaser: Dusti Hill scooped her two-year-old daughter, Porter, into her arms one day this June in a room filled with toys and cartoon murals, relishing their reunion after 10 months apart.

Headlines: 93-Year-Old 'Pill Mill' Physician Gets 10 Years in Prison
Teaser: New research suggests caffeine-loaded energy drinks may be a novel catalyst for alcohol, cocaine, and stimulant use.

Headlines: Marijuana Use May Raise Risk of Dying From Hypertension
Teaser: Federal prosecutors had sought a 20-year sentence, in keeping with Attorney General Jeff Session's push to crack down on crime, especially drug trafficking.

Headlines: DOJ Launches Pilot Program to Crack Down on Pill Mill Docs
Teaser: NHANES data suggest marijuana users have a threefold risk of dying from hypertension, and the risk increases with each additional year of use.

Headlines: Alcohol's CV and Cancer Risk-Balancing Act: More Evidence
Teaser: A federal pilot program will focus on opioid-related healthcare fraud and identifying and prosecuting individuals who are contributing to the prescription opioid epidemic.

Headlines: ED-initiated Buprenorphine Cost-effective for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The benefit was in both men and women, but the rise in all-cause mortality wasn't significant for women. "The J-shaped relationship between alcohol consumption and mortality risk cannot be dismissed."

Headlines: US Sees Dramatic Rise in Alcohol Use, High-Risk Drinking
Teaser: New research points to dramatic increases in alcohol use, high-risk drinking, and alcohol disorders, especially among women, older adults, and individuals in lower socioeconomic groups.

Headlines: Express Scripts Limits on Opioids Rankles Physicians
Teaser: The giant pharmacy-benefits manager will restrict patients new to opioid therapy to an initial 7-day supply in a new program modeled after CDC guidelines.

Headlines: Senate Confirms Surgeon General, Other HHS Picks
Teaser: After surgery, most patients have leftover opioids and don't store or dispose of them properly, a study has found.

Headlines: Add Legionella to Your Differential Diagnosis for Pneumonia
Teaser: Don't forget to consider Legionella as a cause of hospital-acquired pneumonia. It's more common and deadlier than some may realize.

Headlines: Persistent Neuropsychiatric Impairment in HCV Patients
Teaser: Many patients with HCV infection report disabling chronic fatigue--even after viral clearance. Might HCV be implicated in a virus infection-associated chronic fatigue syndrome?

Headlines: Oral Contraceptives May Cut Rheumatoid Arthritis Risk
Teaser: Current oral contraceptive users had a 15% reduction in the risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis (RA); breast-feeding had no significant effect on RA risk, a Swedish study found.

Headlines: Ischemic Stroke Complicating Thrombolytic Therapy for STEMI
Teaser: These two cases highlight the rare complication of ischemic stroke following fibrinolytic therapy for STEMI. What mechanism might explain this paradoxical occurrence?

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Using VAP Rates as a Health Care Quality Indicator
Teaser: Are reported rates of ventilator-associated pneumonia an accurate indicator of the quality of ICU care?

Headlines: HF and CKD: Learning With Nephrologists
Teaser: Patients with kidney disease are often excluded from heart failure trials. Dr Ileana Piña was among the HF experts invited to a meeting with nephrologists to learn how to manage such patients.

Headlines: Enhanced RN Role in Behavioral Health Care
Teaser: Utilizing RNs in behavioral health care may help reduce healthcare costs and improve patient care.

Headlines: Age and Differences in Antihypertensive Adherence in Hispanics
Teaser: Hispanics have a higher prevalence of uncontrolled hypertension than do people of other racial/ethnic groups. Does poor adherence play a significant role, and does it differ by age group?

Headlines: Apical Periodontitis Associates With Cardiovascular Diseases
Teaser: Does apical periodontitis pose a threat to systemic health?

Headlines: Examination of CTC Profiles in NSCLC Molecular Subgroups
Teaser: What number of circulating tumor cells is associated with a poor prognosis in advanced NSCLC?

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Risk of CV Mortality vs Benefit of Hormonal Therapy in PCa
Teaser: Do men with cardiac risk factors benefit when given hormonal therapy for prostate cancer?

Headlines: Cigarette Smoking and Risk of Incident Rosacea in Women
Teaser: How does past and current smoking status relate to the risk of developing rosacea?

Headlines: The Electronic Cigarette, Do We Need to Worry?
Teaser: Do e-cigarettes pose a risk to the cardiovascular system? This commentary highlights how little we know concerning the possible adverse health effects of e-cigarettes.

Headlines: 'Triple' Screening for AAA, PAD, High BP Reduces Mortality
Teaser: Results of the VIVA trial show that a program of three screening tests--for abdominal aortic aneurysm, peripheral arterial disease, and hypertension--resulted in a significant reduction in all-cause mortality at 5 years.

Headlines: Prognosis for Live Birth With Fertility Treatments
Teaser: This study analyzed the probability of live birth across all fertility treatment types and fertility treatment history, enabling an age-stratified long-term prognosis at start of treatment.

Headlines: The WE-CARE Screening Tool for Risk Factors in Child Neglect
Teaser: The WE-CARE tool as part of routine screening may help identify and address the psychosocial needs of children at risk for neglect.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: PPI Usage and Risk of Pneumonia in Dementia Patients
Teaser: Does PPI usage increase the risk of pneumonia in dementia patients?

Headlines: Clinical Decision-making in Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis
Teaser: Management of patients with alcoholic hepatitis remains controversial. How have recent studies informed our clinical decision-making for these patients?

Headlines: Long-term Adherence to Topical Psoriasis Treatment
Teaser: While psoriasis is a chronic disease requiring long-term treatment adherence, this study finds that many patients are falling short.

Headlines: Cooking Smoke and Respiratory Symptoms of Restaurant Workers
Teaser: A new study examines the potential harmful respiratory effects of fumes and cooking smoke on restaurant workers.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: AAEP Task Force on Medical Clearance of Psychiatric Patients
Teaser: The AAEP provides consensus recommendations for the emergency medical evaluation of adult psychiatric patients.

Headlines: CAC, CIMT, and ABI for Predicting 10-Year Incident CV Events
Teaser: Which of the three commonly used cardiovascular markers is best at predicting increased cardiovascular risk?

Headlines: Skin Pigmentation and Risk of Hearing Loss in Women
Teaser: Why do black individuals have a significantly lower risk of hearing loss than whites? Is skin pigmentation a factor?

Headlines: Risk of ESRD in HIV-Positive Potential Live Kidney Donors
Teaser: For HIV-positive individuals considering HIV-positive live kidney donor transplantation, the risk of ESRD is a concern.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Surgeon General Wins Committee Vote
Teaser: Jerome Adams, MD, says that if confirmed by the full Senate, he will make the nation's opioid abuse epidemic one of his top priorities.

Source: Plastic Reconstructive Surgery-Global Open (PRS Global Open)
Headlines: Long-term Health-Related QoL After Breast Reconstruction
Teaser: How do these four different methods of breast reconstruction impact health-related quality of life among breast cancer patients?

Headlines: Methamphetamine Use Tied to Heightened Hemorrhagic Stroke Risk
Teaser: Methamphetamine use has been tied to an increased risk for stroke in young adults, especially often-fatal hemorrhagic stroke, a new review shows.

Headlines: Halting HF in Patients With Diabetes: Insights From EMPA-REG
Teaser: A substudy of EMPA-REG finds that SGLT2 inhibitors may slow the onset of heart failure. Dr Piña discusses the research with study investigator Dr Javed Butler at ESC 2017.

Headlines: Early Alcohol Use May Be Harder on Men's Brain Function
Teaser: Male adolescents who are heavy, long-term alcohol users experience greater changes in electrical activity in the brain than female users, potentially pointing to later harms.

Headlines: Let's Beat Big Tobacco
Teaser: We need to offer practical alternatives to smoking cigarettes, says Dr Lundberg, and now we can.

Headlines: A Supplement That May Block The Toxic Effects of Alcohol
Teaser: Dr Lundberg shares a possible aid for metabolizing alcohol.

Headlines: Does Vitamin D Influence MS Risk?
Teaser: Dr Arefa Cassoobhoy highlights one of the week's important news stories for primary care.

Headlines: Denial: The Greatest Barrier to the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: A family physician in a rural town learns that professional and community self-denial may be as dangerous as the opioid epidemic itself.

Headlines: Implementing MTM for COPD
Teaser: Medication therapy management plays an important role in helping patients learn how to manage COPD and decrease complications. Learn about MTM interventions for COPD in this primer.

Headlines: Dose-Response Effects of T Gel in Medically Castrated Men
Teaser: A new study examines the treatment effects of variable doses of transdermal testosterone gel among medically castrated men.

Headlines: Underuse of Chest X-Ray vs. CT for Lung Cancer Screening
Teaser: Why are clinicians continuing to use chest x-ray screening for lung cancer when guidelines strongly recommend CT scan as the preferred option?

Headlines: Adolescent and Midlife Diet and Pancreatic Cancer Risk
Teaser: Might dietary factors present during adolescence and midlife play a significant role in increasing the risk of pancreatic cancer?

Headlines: Sonographic Enthesitis and Radiographic Damage in PsA
Teaser: Is the severity of sonographic enthesitis a predictor of joint damage in psoriatic arthritis patients?

Headlines: Updated Advice on Managing Liver Disease During Pregnancy
Teaser: Dr Rowen Zetterman reviews the new American College of Gastroenterology guidelines on caring for pregnant patients with diseases ranging from liver masses to viral infections.

Headlines: The Opioid Crisis and Need for Compassion in Pain Management
Teaser: In this commentary, the author expresses concern that the response to the public health crisis of opioid addiction is creating a growing crisis of inadequate pain management.

Headlines: Effect of PAVMs on the Mechanical Properties of the Lungs
Teaser: Gain a better understanding of how pulmonary arteriovenous malformations might impact lung mechanical properties.

Headlines: Guidelines for CKD: Defining, Staging, and Managing
Teaser: Get up-to-date on the most recent guidelines for identifying and managing patients with chronic kidney disease.

Headlines: Zidovudine Use in Pregnancy and Congenital Malformations
Teaser: Is zidovudine associated with an increased risk of fetal malformations? This new review examines the possible connection.

Headlines: Use of Outpatient Cardiac Rehab Among Heart Attack Survivors
Teaser: Is cardiac rehabilitation being adequately utilized in the US? The latest figures indicate that the percentage of heart attack survivors receiving cardiac rehabilitation is less than it should be.

Headlines: Hemoglobin Himeji and Inconsistent Hemoglobin A1c Values
Teaser: This case highlights the need to be cognizant of hemoglobin variants which may falsely skew hemoglobin A1c test results.

Headlines: Glycemic Control and Infection Risk in Patients With T2DM
Teaser: Is poor glucose control in persons with type 2 diabetes associated with an increased risk of infection?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Common Drug Side Effects and Interactions in Elderly Adults
Teaser: This article offers a summary of the most commonly prescribed drugs encountered in primary care in the elderly population, their side effects, and important drug-drug interactions.

Headlines: Monitoring Electric Activity of the Diaphragm During NPPV
Teaser: In this case report, the value of electrical activity of the diaphragm monitoring during noninvasive positive pressure ventilation is explored.

Headlines: High-Dose Vitamin D Supplementation in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: Might high-dose vitamin D supplementation provide more improvement in muscle strength and quality of life compared with standard dose?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Mushroom Consumption and Incident Dementia
Teaser: Studies have shown that mushrooms possess anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. Might eating mushrooms offer prevention against dementia?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Utility of the History and Physical Exam in Detecting ACS
Teaser: The history and physical exam are commonly used in the ED to assess chest pain patients for suspected ACS, but how useful are they?

Headlines: Mental Health, Alcohol Abuse Top Causes of Avoidable ED Visits
Teaser: Mental health problems, alcohol abuse, and dental problems are the main causes of avoidable emergency department visits in the US.

Headlines: Stalled Progress on Stroke a 'Wake Up' Call
Teaser: After decades of decline, stroke death rates in the US have declined more slowly, stalled, or reversed in some groups in recent years, a new CDC report shows.

Headlines: Heart Benefit of Alcohol Not Seen in NAFLD
Teaser: Light to moderate drinkers may have a lower risk of heart disease than teetotalers, but a new study suggests this doesn't hold true in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

Headlines: Opioid Misuse Still Largely a Prescription-Related Problem
Teaser: Prescription and illicit opioid use continues unabated in the United States, while treatment rates for opioid abuse and substance use disorders remain staggeringly low.

Headlines: 10% of Opioid Users Receive the Vast Majority of Prescriptions
Teaser: On the basis of findings that prescription opioid use in the US is concentrated among a relatively small group of individuals, a new report argues for focused vs population-wide policies.

Headlines: Do Cold Meds Carry a Psychosis Risk?
Teaser: Can common cold medication really make someone commit a violent and deadly crime?

Headlines: Suicide Attempts Rising in America
Teaser: Younger adults who have less formal education and those with antisocial personality disorder and other mental disorders are most at risk for attempted suicide.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Mobile App for Substance Use Disorders
Teaser: The prescription-only reSET application is intended for use along with outpatient therapy to treat substance use disorders involving alcohol, cocaine, marijuana, and stimulants.

Headlines: Psychiatric Disorders in Pregnancy Pose No Risk to Children
Teaser: Although psychiatric disorders are not associated with neonatal or pregnancy complications, treatment for these conditions may convey some risk, new research suggests.

Headlines: Brain Imaging Reveals Why Cocaine Habits Are So Hard to Break
Teaser: A brain imaging study sheds light on why persons addicted to cocaine find it so difficult to quit and why extinction therapy may not work.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Two Drugs for Opioid Abuse
Teaser: The EMA committee recommends naloxone nasal spray (Nyxoid) for treatment of opioid overdose and buprenorphine plus naloxone sublingual tablets (Zubsolv) for treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Physicians Get Too Much Blame for Opioid Crisis, Some Say
Teaser: A resolution at the AAFP delegates meeting proposes a nationwide public relations campaign, as well as more education for all factions. Some delegates were put off by the estimated price and intent.

Headlines: J-DOIT3: 'Aim for Near-Normal Metabolic Parameters' in Diabetes
Teaser: UPDATED // The large Japanese DOIT3 trial tells clinicians that optimal lipid, blood pressure, and, glycemic control are important to reduce microvascular and macrovascular complications in type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: On Opioids, Physicians Have Opportunities for Good, Says NAM
Teaser: Physicians, nurses, and first responders can, and should, be more proactive, substance use disorder experts said.

Headlines: ACOG Updates Recommendations on Marijuana During Pregnancy
Teaser: In updated recommendations on marijuana use during pregnancy and lactation, ACOG says clinicians should discourage pregnant and breast-feeding women from using marijuana.

Headlines: Psoriasis Patients Face Increased Risk of Heart Attacks and Death
Teaser: People with psoriasis, a chronic inflammatory disease, may be more likely than others to experience heart attacks and strokes at least in part because inflammation damages their vascular system, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Avoid Dopamine, Prefer Bolus Diuretic in Preserved-EF Acute HF
Teaser: That's the message from a small trial that hones the scant evidence base on managing acute preserved-EF heart failure. Dopamine had little effect; continuous-IV furosemide may have hurt the kidneys.

Headlines: Postop Sore Throat: Glidescope vs. Macintosh Laryngoscope
Teaser: This study compared the incidence and severity of postoperative sore throat resulting from two commonly used endotracheal intubation methods.

Headlines: Low Prenatal Red Meat Intake Tied to Kids' Substance Misuse
Teaser: Adolescent offspring of moms who ate lower amounts of meat while pregnant were at greater risk for problematic substance use than those of moms who consumed higher amounts of meat.

Headlines: Skepticism at Launch of the Foundation for a Smoke-Free World
Teaser: Some tobacco control experts are skeptical because the foundation is funded by a large tobacco manufacturer, which is now marketing smokeless nicotine-delivery products.

Headlines: Healthy Weight Key to Keeping BP in Check Over Lifetime
Teaser: Maintaining normal body weight may be the most important factor for maintaining normal blood pressure throughout life, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Associations Between LBP and Muscle-Strengthening Activity
Teaser: Could engaging in muscle-strengthening activity help reduce the risk of lower back pain?

Headlines: Aspirin for Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: This study examined aspirin use for the prevention of primary and secondary cardiovascular disease in a cohort of Mississippi adults. Are there sociodemographic disparities?

Headlines: Patients With Access and Functional Needs in a Disaster
Teaser: This review examines the unique challenges in dealing with patients with special healthcare needs in a disaster situation. How can these at-risk populations be addressed in disaster planning?

Headlines: Complications After Bariatric Surgery Lead World Congress
Teaser: An award-winning study of the difficulties patients encounter after bariatric surgery will be presented at the upcoming World Congress of Gastroenterology, along with other advances in the field.

Headlines: Detroit-Area Physician Pleads Guilty to Medicare Fraud
Teaser: Like some other recent federal cases, this one involves inappropriate prescribing of controlled substances.

Headlines: Vigorous Exercise May Be Best for Longevity in Stable CHD
Teaser: Observational data suggest any amount of exercise is associated with reduced mortality vs being sedentary in patients with stable CHD, but the lowest mortality was seen among the most active patients.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Patient-Entered Wellness Data Increases Preventive Care
Teaser: A new tool collects patient-entered data and provides personalized preventive care recommendations in several wellness areas.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Biomarker-Based Risk Models to Risk Stratify Stable CHD
Teaser: In this commentary, the author examines the utility of a new risk model for coronary heart disease based on circulating biomarkers as well as other clinical variables: the ABC-CHD risk model.

Headlines: Barriers Rural Physicians Face Prescribing Buprenorphine
Teaser: What are the barriers rural physicians with DEA waivers face in providing buprenorphine maintenance treatment?

Headlines: Bacillus Calmette-Guerin Vaccination and Childhood Asthma
Teaser: While some have speculated that BCG vaccination in infancy might protect against childhood asthma, the results of this study proved disappointing.

Headlines: Respiratory Health Status in HIV-Positive Adults
Teaser: HIV-positive individuals on effective ART had worse respiratory health status compared with HIV-negative people.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Health Coaching by Medical Assistants in Primary Care
Teaser: Medical assistants could play an important role in helping primary care patients achieve healthy lifestyles.

Headlines: Sexual Health and Well Being in Older Adulthood
Teaser: This review provides insight into the complex relationship of mental health, marital characteristics, and a variety psychosocial and cultural factors to sexual health in older adults.

Headlines: Validity of Two Hot Flash-related Daily Interference Scales
Teaser: This study assessed the validity of a condensed version of a 10-item psychometric self-report questionnaire for assessing the impact of hot flashes on a woman's quality of life.

Headlines: Opioids Top List of Malpractice Claims Linked to Medications
Teaser: One problem is that some physicians cave into the requests of persuasive, pill-seeking patients against their better judgement, the medical liability insurer Coverys says in a new study.

Source: Seminars in Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
Headlines: Current Medical Therapy for Sarcoidosis
Teaser: What do we currently know about the indications for treatment and the efficacy of therapeutic options for sarcoidosis?

Headlines: Advances in Treatment of Thyroid Eye Disease
Teaser: This review provides an update to the most current therapeutic options for the management of thyroid eye disease.

Headlines: Physical Activity and Cognition in Men With and Without HIV
Teaser: What role might HIV status have in the relationship between physical activity and neurocognitive function?

Headlines: 'Alarming' Increase in Stroke Risk Factors
Teaser: Despite many prevention initiatives, the prevalence of hypertension, diabetes, dyslipidemia, drug abuse, and smoking actually appears to be increasing among new ischemic stroke patients in the United States, a new study shows.

Headlines: 'Massive' Suffering: Pain Relief in Less Affluent Countries
Teaser: In much of the world, patients suffering from serious illness and injury have little to no access to palliative care and adequate pain relief.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Community: 'This Is Our Fight'
Teaser: At the premier gathering of the lung cancer community, the first plenary session speaker insisted: 'We cannot deal with lung cancer and not fight against tobacco.'

Headlines: Drug Use in Parents: Why We're Gonna Need a Bigger Boat
Teaser: A pediatrician is galvanized by a poignant interview with the children of drug-addicted parents.

Headlines: Use of Psych Meds in Medical Students and Residents
Teaser: About 75% of med students and residents use psychoactive drugs. When does use become abuse, and what can we do about it?

Headlines: A Delicate Balance: Pain Management and Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: An understanding of opioid use disorder is essential for effective and appropriate pain management.

Headlines: Risk Factors Associated With Fibroids
Teaser: Dr Kovacs summarizes a new systematic review that looked at the epidemiology of uterine fibroids and their associated risk factors.

Headlines: An Adult With Unilateral Mydriasis
Teaser: A 34-year-old man was noted to have mydriasis of the right eye. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Headlines: Should You Recommend Coffee Drinking to Your Patients?
Teaser: Recent studies suggest that coffee drinking may be good for you, but more data replicating these studies are needed. Should you recommend coffee consumption to patients?

Headlines: One in 10 Opioid Users Treated With Naloxone Die
Teaser: These people are at extremely high risk, but a lack of accessible detox and rehabilitation facilities hampers efforts to help them.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Drug Czar Pulls Out After Investigation
Teaser: The decision follows a report by the Washington Post and 60 Minutes that showed Rep. Tom Marino spearheaded legislation that made it harder for the government to police the pharmaceutical industry.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Chronic Pain: Unprecedented Advances
Teaser: The opioid epidemic and the growing elderly population underscore the need for effective alternative therapies to treat chronic pain

Headlines: Trump Opioid Declaration Unsatisfactory, Say US Governors
Teaser: President Trump's declaration of the opioid crisis as a public health emergency is an important first step, but the states need funding for it to have an impact, the National Governors Association says.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Cause Unique Injury to Lung Immunity, Study Shows
Teaser: e-Cigarettes cause unique harm to lung tissue, challenging the concept that they are a healthier alternative to traditional cigarettes, researchers reported.

Headlines: Saline for Resuscitation, Cancer Screening at CHEST 2017
Teaser: Debates on the use of saline to resuscitate critically ill patients, updates in lung cancer screening, and a chance to play Pulmonary Adventures II: Temple of Gloom await attendees at CHEST 2017.

Headlines: Millions of Life Years Saved if Smokers Switch to Vaping
Teaser: Use of e-cigarettes as a smoking cessation method could save lives for smokers who have tried to quit and failed, says a new report. But experts say there is no solid evidence.

Headlines: Heroin Use in the US Soars
Teaser: New US data show hospital discharges related to prescription opioids are down slightly, while discharges related to heroin have soared.

Headlines: 'Magic Mushrooms' Effective for Severe Depression
Teaser: Psilocybin, the active compound in 'magic mushrooms,' has been shown to improve a variety of psychiatric conditions, including depression. A study focuses on the neurobiology underlying its effect.

Headlines: Risk for Alcohol Abuse Intensifies After Bariatric Surgery
Teaser: The rise in significant alcohol use after bariatric surgery identified in a meta-analysis of 28 studies suggests that these patients require lifelong monitoring.

Headlines: FDA Urges Clinicians to Help Limit Opioid Prescriptions
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration is asking clinicians to help the agency's efforts to limit both the number of opioid prescriptions and their duration.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Prescription Opioid Use in Mental Health Disorders
Teaser: At what rate do adults with mental health conditions receive prescription opioids?

Headlines: Trump Stops Short of Calling Opioid Crisis a National Emergency
Teaser: President Trump has stopped short of declaring America's opioid crisis a national emergency as his own special commission urged in July.

Headlines: Younger vs. Older US Adults With Multiple Chronic Conditions
Teaser: This study examined several characteristics of adults with multiple chronic conditions, such as disability, quality of life, risk factors, and health care access. How do they differ between age groups?

Headlines: Risk Factors for Complications After Posterior Lumbar Fusion
Teaser: Certain risk factors for the development of major complications after posterior lumbar fusion have been identified. Find out what they are.

Headlines: Feds Get Tougher on Illicit Opioids
Teaser: The US Department of Justice and the DEA are taking steps to keep prescription and illicit opioids off the streets and more effectively prosecute those who distribute these agents illegally.

Headlines: Care-Coordination Program to Reduce Opioid-Related ED Visits
Teaser: How does this new care-coordination intervention impact the number of prescription-opioid-related ED visits and the associated costs?

Headlines: Complications: Acknowledging, Managing, Coping With Error
Teaser: To err is human -- but many health care providers struggle with acknowledging medical mistakes and coping with the emotional effects.

Headlines: A 'Wake- up Call' for Burnout; More From WCOG at ACG 2017
Teaser: Dr David Johnson provides his takeaways from this meeting. Part 1 reveals a 'wake-up call' for gastroenterologist burnout and updates in bariatric surgery, Barrett esophagus, G-POEM, NAFLD, and more.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Non-Smoking Related Lung Cancer
Teaser: A risk-based prediction model may help predict the risk for developing lung cancer among non-smokers.

Headlines: Experiences of Discrimination and Incident T2DM
Teaser: Might the associated stress of discrimination in major life situations be a risk factor for development of type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: HCC in Chronic HBV vs Chronic HCV After Virologic Response
Teaser: Does the achievement of virologic response modify the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma differently in patients with chronic hepatitis B as compared to those with chronic hepatitis C?

Headlines: PCSK9 Inhibitors: Comparing Guidance Across the Atlantic
Teaser: How do guidelines from the American College of Cardiology differ from those of their European counterparts in determining which patients should receive PCSK9 inhibitors?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: FP Perceptions of E-Cigarettes in Tobacco Use Counselings
Teaser: How likely are family physicians to recommend e-cigarettes to patients who are trying to quit smoking?

Headlines: Metformin and Growth Rate of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms
Teaser: Dr Lowenfels comments on a study that investigated whether metformin could significantly slow the growth rate of this very common disease.

Headlines: Multimodal Analgesia May Be Key in Reducing Opioid Abuse
Teaser: Drs Beckman and Soffin from Hospital for Special Surgery explain safe and synergistic methods of controlling pain.

Headlines: Four Bloody Noses: Current Concepts in Epistaxis
Teaser: Is it just a bloody nose? These scenarios demonstrate the latest thinking about the prevention, diagnosis, and management of epistaxis.

Headlines: Don't Dismiss These Two Cancer Risk Factors
Teaser: Dr Arefa Cassoobhoy highlights one of the week's important news stories for primary care.

Headlines: Vasospastic Angina: Standardization of Diagnostic Criteria
Teaser: The Coronary Vasomotion Disorders International Study Group has proposed new diagnostic criteria to improve the clinical diagnosis of vasospastic angina.

Headlines: Anticoagulation in Patients With AF and Prior Hemorrhage
Teaser: Determining the optimal treatment approach for patients with atrial fibrillation who have had a brain hemorrhage remains extremely challenging. How can we balance risk vs. benefit?

Headlines: Shortening Duration of Therapy With DAAs for HCV Genotype 1
Teaser: Can direct-acting antiviral therapy for hepatitis C genotype 1 be reduced to less than the current standard of 12 weeks without compromising outcomes?

Headlines: HIV/HCV Coinfection and the Risk of Cardiovascular Disease
Teaser: Do individuals with HIV/HCV coinfection have an increased cardiovascular risk compared to those with HIV infection alone?

Headlines: 'Striking' Impact of Adolescent Drinking on the Brain
Teaser: It is not uncommon for teenagers to experiment with drinking alcohol. But what impact does alcohol have on the development of their brain? This study points to a trajectory in gray matter decline.

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Antiplatelet Agents for Coronary Atherothrombosis
Teaser: This article reviews the evidence for the efficacy and safety of antiplatelet drugs in the primary prevention of atherothrombosis, presenting practical advice for appropriate antiplatelet therapy.

Source: Medicine and Science in Sports and Exercise
Headlines: Television Viewing Time and Inflammatory-Related Mortality
Teaser: Is TV time associated with increased risk of inflammatory-related mortality?

Headlines: Tobacco Companies Forced to Admit That Smoking Is Deadly
Teaser: After lengthy trial proceedings, tobacco companies now have to run  advertisements that admit the harms of smoking and how they withheld those facts.

Headlines: Graphic Labels About Alcohol Cancer Risk in Canada
Teaser: A harm-reduction strategy just launched in the Yukon, Canada, could have implications for alcohol policy makers worldwide.

Headlines: Different Alcohol Types Trigger Specific Emotions
Teaser: Vodka, gin, whiskey, and other spirits are more likely to increase aggression compared with other alcoholic beverages. In addition, other alcohol types elicit other specific emotions.

Headlines: Opioid Crisis Inflaming Hep C, HIV in Hard-Hit Communities
Teaser: The opioid epidemic is having an effect on hepatitis C and HIV transmissions, new state-by-state data show, but funding shortcomings are translating into treatment gaps that have some experts worried.

Headlines: CBT for Chronic Pain May Help Fight the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Cognitive-behavioral therapy appears to be an effective alternative to opioids for chronic nonmalignant pain, either as a stand-alone treatment or in combination with nonopioid medications.

Headlines: Physician Office Visits for Opioids Drop After Steady Rise
Teaser: Until last year, there was a steady increase in the number of visits to physicians' offices that involve a prescription for opioids, national trend data show.

Headlines: Liquid Gold: Screening Urine for Drugs
Teaser: The cups of urine travel by express mail to the Comprehensive Pain Specialists lab in an industrial park in Brentwood, Tenn., not far from Nashville. Most days bring more than 700 of the little sealed cups from clinics across 10 states.

Headlines: Statins, Decompensation, and Death in Alcoholic Cirrhosis
Teaser: Does regular use of statins improve outcomes and reduce mortality in patients with alcoholic cirrhosis?

Headlines: Online Therapy Eases Depression, Anxiety in Primary Care
Teaser: Online cognitive-behavioral therapy, both alone and in combination with an Internet support group, is more effective than usual primary care for depression and anxiety, new research shows.

Headlines: Kratom Association Hits Back at 'Unsubstantiated' FDA Advisory
Teaser: The American Kratom Association has petitioned the US Food and Drug Administration to 'review and correct' the agency's November 14 public health advisory on the dangers of kratom.

Headlines: Long- and Short-Acting Opioid Addiction Meds Equally Effective
Teaser: Extended-release naltrexone and buprenorphine/naloxone are similarly efficacious in preventing relapse for patients with opioid use disorder, although naltrexone was more difficult to initiate.

Headlines: In US, 4 out of 10 Cancers Could Be Prevented
Teaser: Potentially modifiable risk factors account for a large proportion of all cancer cases and cancer-related deaths in men and women living in the US.

Headlines: Librarians See New Patron Need: Naloxone
Teaser: Quiet places where community members congregate are the latest casualties in the opioid epidemic that is gripping neighborhoods and inspiring some unconventional interventions.

Headlines: Smokers Turn to e-Cigarettes in Attempt to Quit
Teaser: Smokers are far likelier than nonsmokers to be e-cigarette users, relying on the alternative nicotine product as part of their effort to stop smoking, new Tennessee research indicates.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Alters Prescriber, Pharmacist Habits
Teaser: Many respondents to a Medscape poll also said that they had increasing concern about opioid-related liability.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs New Drug for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: RBP-6000 (Indivior Plc) is a once-monthly injectable formulation of buprenorphine that demonstrated significantly higher abstinence rates vs placebo in phase 3 testing.

Headlines: Eliminating Opioids for Chronic Pain Unwise?
Teaser: Solid evidence supports the long-term use of opioids in some patients as long as the benefits outweigh the risks, one expert says.

Headlines: A Behind-the-Counter Look at the Opioid Crisis
Teaser: A pharmacist shares his thoughts on what it's like being a link between legal prescriptions and the national opioid epidemic.

Headlines: State, Local Chronic Disease Surveillance Using EHR Systems
Teaser: Can EHR-based public health surveillance generate state and local estimates of chronic disease prevalence as accurately as traditional methods?

Headlines: Treating HCV Infection With DAAs in Injecting Drug Users
Teaser: Treatment of HCV infection in injection drug users is challenging due to lack of adherence, management of side effects, and psychiatric adverse events. Does DAA therapy provide an effective option?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: EHR Strategies Related to Social Determinants of Health
Teaser: How might EHR-based tools help optimize the collection of data related to social determinants of heath?

Headlines: Oral HPV in Men: On the Rise
Teaser: Dr Arefa Cassoobhoy highlights one of the week's important news stories for primary care.

Headlines: Oral Pirfenidone for Progressive, Non-IPF Lung Fibrosis
Teaser: Pirfenidone is currently used in the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Could it also be a safe and effective treatment option for other progressive fibrotic lung diseases?

Headlines: Tobacco Use Cessation and Complete Home Smoking Bans
Teaser: This study examined factors that might predict tobacco use cessation among callers to quitlines who implemented a complete home smoking ban after enrolling in quitline services.

Headlines: Is Lung Cancer Incidence in Never-Smokers Increasing?
Teaser: Australian researchers report finding that lung cancer rates among never-smokers are stable, after US researchers raised the alarm over an apparent doubling in incidence.

Headlines: Coffee May Increase Life Expectancy in Liver Disease
Teaser: Steep benefits! The latest data link coffee consumption to decreased morbidity and mortality in liver disease.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Mechanical Thrombectomy in Older Adults With Ischemic Stoke
Teaser: Is endovascular treatment for large-vessel occlusion safe and effective in the elderly?

Headlines: 2017 Advances in Rheumatology
Teaser: Dr Kevin Deane reviews new trials, new treatments, and other major breakthroughs in rheumatology over the past year.

Headlines: Mandrola's Top 10 Cardiology Stories of 2017
Teaser: Controversy surrounding saturated fat and sham PCI make this year's list as well as a few medical reversals and the continuing opioid crisis. What topics would you add or omit?

Headlines: Challenges and New Opportunities for GxE Interaction Studies
Teaser: How does the interaction of genes and environment contribute to our understanding of disease in the human population? Read about the emerging field of gene-environment interaction (GxE) in this review.

Headlines: Staggered Sugammadex Dose and Risk of Severe Emergence Cough
Teaser: Cough on emergence has been reported as a common adverse reaction with sugammadex reversal. Can staggering the dose reduce the risk?

Headlines: Gender and Memory in Binge Drinking Adolescents
Teaser: This study examined the effects of acute exposure to alcohol on learning and memory in adolescent men and women. Are females more vulnerable to the neurotoxic impact on cognition then males?

Headlines: Oxytocin Promotes Altruistic Punishment
Teaser: The findings of this study suggest that the neural circuits underlying altruistic punishment are partly targeted by the oxytonergic system, which plays a crucial role in cooperative behavior.

Headlines: Mental Illness and a Mandatory Drug Test: One Doc's Trouble
Teaser: Medical students experience high rates of depression and suicide. So why are physician health programs and licensure boards seemingly punishing them for it?

Headlines: EGFR Mutational Status and Brain Metastases in NSCLC
Teaser: Does EGFR mutation status in patients with NSCLC and brain metastases at diagnosis affect outcomes?

Headlines: Digital Interventions and Risky Drinking in Young Adults
Teaser: This study evaluated two different personalized digital interventions for reducing risky drinking in young adults--but the results were disappointing.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: A Model for Improving Preventive Care in Rural Counties
Teaser: This study evaluated the feasibility of a sustainable, rural community-based patient outreach model for preventive care provided through primary care practices.

Headlines: Binge Drinking and the Risk of Liver Events
Teaser: Does binge drinking increase the risk for liver disease above and beyond the risk due to average alcohol consumption?

Headlines: Body Weight Changes and Mortality in Hemodialysis Patients
Teaser: A new study examines the association of post-dialysis weight changes with all-cause mortality in hemodialysis patients.

Headlines: Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors in Lung Cancer
Teaser: The PD-1, PD-L1, and CTLA-4 inhibitors show promise in lung cancer, but questions about biomarker use and place in therapy need to be resolved.

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: The Effect of Low Vitamin D on Cognition
Teaser: Might vitamin D protect against cognitive decline and dementia in aging?

Source: OJIN: The Online Journal of Issues in Nursing
Headlines: Opiate Crisis and Healthcare Reform in America
Teaser: Nurses are in a unique position to help address the opioid crisis and positively impact legislative changes.

Headlines: Fatigue in Psoriasis: A Controlled Study
Teaser: How prevalent is fatigue in patients with psoriasis? Is there a correlation of fatigue to measurements of disease activity and inflammation?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Glucose, Cholesterol, BP: How Low to Go for CVD Prevention
Teaser: Current guidelines for the primary prevention of CVD recommend modification of 3 risk factors: diabetes, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension--but controversy remains as to optimal targets.

Headlines: GI Motility Following Thoracic Surgery With Thoracic Epidural
Teaser: Can postoperative thoracic epidural analgesia with ropivacaine or ropivacaine and morphine better accelerate postop GI function following major thoracic surgery as compared to IV morphine alone?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Prevention of Alzheimer Disease: Lessons Learned and Applied
Teaser: Can Alzheimer disease be prevented? This article examines current research into pharmacological options, lifestyle modifications, and the role of personalized medicine in AD prevention.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Factors That Influence Treatment Completion for Latent TB
Teaser: Which patients are more likely to discontinue latent tuberculosis infection therapy?

Headlines: Facing the Dilemma of Patient-Centered Psoriasis Care
Teaser: This study explored the unmet needs and health perceptions of people with psoriasis. How can these insights serve to move clinical management in a more patient-centered direction?

Headlines: Non-invasive Tools for Diagnosis of Liver Fibrosis in NAFLD
Teaser: Can serial use of non-invasive methods such as evaluation of imaging studies, clinical scores, and biochemical markers accurately diagnose advanced liver fibrosis in patients with NAFLD?

Headlines: Rivaroxaban: Alternative in Cancer-Related Thrombosis?
Teaser: Is this direct Xa inhibitor a potential alternative to LMWH for thrombosis in cancer?

Headlines: The Community Pharmacist's Role in Managing Lower Back Pain
Teaser: The pharmacist may be the first healthcare professional consulted for back pain. Familiarize yourself with the most recent guidelines recommended by the ACP in this article.

Headlines: Alcohol Intake, Binge Drinking, and Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Alcohol is a known risk factor for breast cancer. Does binge drinking increase the risk?

Headlines: Association of GDM With Cardiometabolic Disease in Parents
Teaser: This study indicates that gestational diabetes and hypertension in pregnancy leads to high rates of subsequent cardiometabolic disease--and not just in mothers.

Headlines: Barriers to Hepatitis C Treatment in the Era of DAAs
Teaser: Direct-acting anti-virals are safe and highly effective treatments for hepatitis C virus. So why aren't they being prescribed more extensively?

Headlines: The Role of the Laboratory in Opioid Use Disorders
Teaser: This review focuses on considerations surrounding urine drug testing, examining the role of both presumptive and definitive testing methods.

Headlines: Predicting eGFR Decline and Albuminuria Progression in T2DM
Teaser: Could this newly identified factor help predict diabetic kidney disease progression in type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Acute Stress and Abnormal Left Atrial Electrophysiology
Teaser: What might be the mechanism by which acute mental stress triggers atrial fibrillation?

Headlines: Providing Office-Based Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: This brief report details how one center successfully integrated Office-Based Opioid Treatment with buprenorphine into their primary care practice.

Headlines: Repeated BP, Cholesterol Measurements for CVD Risk Prediction
Teaser: Does incorporating information from repeated blood pressure and cholesterol measurements improve CVD risk prediction compared with the usual approach of using data from a single time point?

Headlines: Integrating Immunotherapy Into Chemoradiation for NSCLC
Teaser: Clinicians should consider timing and toxicities when adding a checkpoint inhibitor to chemoradiotherapy for NSCLC.

Headlines: Genetics in the Clinical Setting
Teaser: Find out about the role of genetics and genomics in the clinical setting -- and what nurses need to know.

Headlines: Healthcare Apps to Recommend to Patients
Teaser: A study ranks the best clinical apps for health, wellness, and disease management.

Headlines: Predictors of Treatment Outcome in Sacroiliac Joint Pain
Teaser: Could certain factors predict treatment outcomes among patients treated for sacroiliac joint pain?

Headlines: American Academy of Addiction Psychiatry (AAAP) 28th Annual Meeting
Teaser: Read clinically focused news coverage of key developments from AAAP 2017

Headlines: Stopping Opioid Addiction at One Key Source: The Hospital
Teaser: Based on research conducted at the University of Michigan’s medical center, a group of surgeons developed a strategy to help post-surgical patients from misusing or abusing their prescription painkillers.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation Treatment in Mental Illness Effective
Teaser: Headway is being made in the treatment of tobacco dependence in psychiatric and substance abuse patients, owing to a better understanding of the safety and efficacy of therapeutic strategies.

Headlines: Alcohol Abuse: Craving Scores Predict Relapse Risk
Teaser: Scores on an alcohol craving assessment scale, combined with early-age drinking, are reliable predictors of long-term relapse risk after discharge from an alcohol addiction treatment program.

Headlines: More Teens Vaping, Fewer Misusing Opioids
Teaser: The latest federal data on adolescent drug use show that both vaping and marijuana are more popular than traditional cigarettes, and abuse of opioid pain relievers is down.

Headlines: The Year in Medicine 2017: News That Made a Difference
Teaser: Read the news that got the most attention this year in medicine, including multiple hurricanes, the effort to repeal the Affordable Care Act, the opioid crisis (again), and much more.

Headlines: No Magic Bullet to Prevent Late-Life Dementia
Teaser: There's no proven intervention to prevent late-life dementia, but a healthy lifestyle early on may be the best defense, researchers say.

Headlines: Physical Health Status Strongly Influences Working Memory
Teaser: Higher physical endurance, fluid intelligence, and better cognitive function are associated with higher levels of cohesiveness in brain networks involved in working memory, new research shows.

Headlines: Second Injectable Buprenorphine Product Shows Promise
Teaser: The subcutaneous injectable form of buprenorphine could offer weekly and monthly formulations for more flexible treatment of opioid use disorder.

Headlines: One Third of Cancer Deaths Could Be Prevented by Lifestyle
Teaser: In  2013, 38% of cancer-related mortality was caused by modifiable risk factors, including smoking, poor diet, obesity, and drinking alcohol.

Headlines: Early-Onset Type 2 Diabetes 'Not a Benign Condition'

Headlines: History of Suicide Attempt Linked to Shorter Life Expectancy

Headlines: Drug-Induced Psychosis Ups Schizophrenia, Bipolar Risk
Teaser: In almost 6800 patients with psychosis that was induced by any substance, 32% converted to either schizophrenia or bipolar disorder; 47% converted after cannabis-induced psychosis.

Headlines: Pharmacist's Role in Pain Management During Care Transitions
Teaser: As medication experts on the healthcare team, pharmacists play a crucial role in care coordination, medication reconciliation, and patient education during transitions of care.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Use, Methadone Dose Affect Neonatal Outcomes
Teaser: Infants of mothers treated for opioid use disorder with buprenorphine show lower rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome compared to infants whose mothers are treated with methadone, new research shows.

Headlines: More Diagnostic Errors in Patients With Pulmonary Symptoms
Teaser: These cases illustrate common diagnostic errors in patients presenting with pulmonary disease.

Headlines: Physicians of the Year 2017: Best and Worst
Teaser: This year's list features celebrated physicians who won awards, and changed lives and medicine for the better vs those who maimed a patient, prescribed drugs for kickbacks, Medicare fraud in the millions, and more.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Prescribing by NPs and PAs
Teaser: Why is it easy for NPs and PAs to prescribe opioids but not buprenorphine to treat opioid-use disorder?

Headlines: Biological Therapies and Improvements in QoL in Psoriasis
Teaser: This study compared the effectiveness of adalimumab, etanercept and ustekinumab on improvements in HRQoL in patients with psoriasis. What factors are associated with these improvements?

Headlines: The Increasing Use of Cannabis Among Older Americans
Teaser: Might cannabis substitution be a viable policy alternative in the fight against the misuse of opioids as well as the under-treatment of pain at the end of life?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Normal LDL-Cholesterol Levels and Atherosclerosis
Teaser: Does LDL-cholesterol, even at levels currently considered normal, promote atherosclerosis in the absence of other cardiovascular risk factors?

Headlines: Statins and Risk of ICH After Ischemic Stroke or TIA
Teaser: Does current statin use increase the risk of intracerebral hemorrhage among patients with a previous history of ischemic stroke or transient ischemic attack?

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Predicting Risk for Opioid Misuse in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Might something as simple as a single question assessing pain catastrophizing be useful for predicting risk of opioid misuse in chronic pain sufferers?

Headlines: Climate Change, Hurricanes, and Health
Teaser: In this commentary, the authors address the causal attribution of severe and extreme weather events to climate change and its associated health consequences.

Headlines: Coffee and Caffeine Effects on Sex Hormone-Binding Globulin
Teaser: Find out how coffee consumption impacts sex hormone-binding globulin -- and what it means for the risk of type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: New Alcohol Use Disorder Guideline Emphasizes Medication
Teaser: A new practice guideline offers evidence-based recommendations for treatment of alcohol use disorder, including approaches to assessment and treatment planning as well as various pharmacotherapies.

Headlines: Is Drinking Contagious? Analysis of a Drinking Behavior Theory
Teaser: This study explored the effect of social norms on problematic alcohol use by adolescents, while considering the collectivity of drinking cultures theory and the concept of behavioral contagion.

Headlines: Tamper-Resistant Opioids No Panacea for Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Tamper-resistant oxycodone pills are misused less often by injection drug users but have had little effect at a population level on opioid use or harm, a study from Australia finds.

Headlines: 'Eye-opening' Study on Rates of Thrombosis With MPNs
Teaser: For the first time, a population-based study has assessed the rates of thrombotic events in patients with myeloproliferative neoplasms (MPNs).

Headlines: Varenicline Decreases Heavy Drinking in Male Smokers
Teaser: Varenicline is FDA-approved as an agent to assist with smoking cessation. A new study suggests it may be useful in reducing heavy drinking in male smokers with comorbid alcohol use disorder.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Worsening Rural-Urban Gap in Hospital Mortality
Teaser: Do patients living in rural areas of the US have a greater probability of hospital mortality than their urban counterparts?

Headlines: Opioids Associated With Higher Satisfaction With Care
Teaser: Among people with musculoskeletal conditions, those who received opioids were more satisfied with their care, a study found.

Headlines: Cancer Death Rates Continue to Fall in US -- Why?
Teaser: Cancer-related mortality rates continue to decline across the United States, with some of the largest decreases seen in lung cancer among men between 1990 and 2015.

Headlines: Marijuana's Cardiovascular Effects Remain Unknown
Teaser: There is insufficient evidence to determine whether marijuana use can affect cardiovascular risk, a systematic review concludes; prospective studies are needed.

Headlines: US Smoking Rates Down, but 'Long Way to Go' for Quit Help
Teaser: Fewer adults in the United States are now smoking, but financial barriers to treatment that can help with quitting remain -- and only 5% of clinicians deliver standard of care.

Headlines: Diabetic by HbA1c, Normal by OGTT
Teaser: Population-based research found that individuals with normal glucose tolerance yet elevated HbA1c were not uncommon. What are the implications for the screening and diagnosis of type 2 diabetes?

Headlines: Walking Pace and Handgrip Strength as Measures of Fitness
Teaser: Are walking pace and handgrip strength sufficient indicators of cardiorespiratory fitness?

Headlines: Update on Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Teaser: Review molecular features and treatment options for large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of the lung.

Headlines: CAM Use Among US Adults With Headache or Migraine
Teaser: How prevalent is the use of CAM among migraine and headache sufferers? Which modalities are used most often, and why are they selected?

Headlines: Ezetimibe With Statin Therapy for Stroke Prevention in ACS
Teaser: Can the addition of ezetimibe to simvastatin in patients stabilized after acute coronary syndrome reduce the frequency of ischemic stroke?

Headlines: Characteristics, Outcomes of Hyponatremia Due to Polydipsia
Teaser: What do we currently know about the clinical characteristics and outcomes of patients with hyponatremia due to primary polydipsia?

Headlines: Ketamine for Pain Management
Teaser: Ketamine is increasingly used as an off-label analgesic, but are you aware of the potential side effects?

Headlines: Has Underreporting of Cigarette Smoking Changed Over Time?
Teaser: The prevalence of Americans' self-reported cigarette smoking has been steadily dropping, according to recent statistics. But is self-reported smoking data reliable?

Source: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Headlines: Primary Prevention With Statins in the Elderly
Teaser: Recommendations on the use of statin therapy for primary ASCVD prevention in those over 65 differs markedly among guidelines. Are statins being underutilized in the elderly?

Headlines: The Importance of Addressing Youth Mental Health
Teaser: Pediatric health care providers have an important opportunity to address the issue of mental health and depression with their young patients.

Headlines: The Pharmacologic Management of Endometriosis
Teaser: Review the various drug therapies for the treatment of endometriois in this overview.

Headlines: Uterine Fibroids and Miscarriage Risk
Teaser: While uterine fibroids have been linked to pregnancy complications, this study found no evidence to suggest that they increase the risk of miscarriage.

Headlines: Achilles Tendon Repair Using Cryopreserved Umbilical Tissue
Teaser: What benefits might the use of viable umbilical tissue in Achilles tendon repair offer over standard of care?

Source: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
Headlines: Antipsychotics and Risk of Aspiration Pneumonia
Teaser: Antipsychotic medications are widely used in the hospital setting for nonpsychiatric purposes such as delirium or dementia. Do they contribute to the risk of aspiration pneumonia?

Headlines: The Prevalence, Patterns, and Predictors of Chiropractic Use
Teaser: A national survey provides insight into the trends in chiropractic use in the United States in recent years.

Headlines: Gynecologic Cancers: What Every Woman Should Know
Teaser: This article reviews how to counsel women concerning gynecologic cancer signs and symptoms, risk factors, possible preventive measures, and the latest treatments.

Headlines: Trajectory of Body Shape and Cardiometabolic Disease Risk
Teaser: This study examined trajectory patterns of long-term change in body shape from childhood to midlife in relation to subsequent risk of diabetes and cardiovascular disease.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Effectiveness of SBIRT for Alcohol Use Disorders in the ED
Teaser: How effective are screening and intervention strategies for ED patients at risk for alcohol use disorder?

Headlines: Parental Opioid Abuse: Implications for Pediatric Providers
Teaser: Parental opioid abuse can have negative impacts on the health and safety of children. How might pediatric providers help address this growing problem?

Headlines: Varenicline for Smoking Cessation Linked to Cardiac Events
Teaser: Observational results show increased risk for cardiovascular events in patients prescribed varenicline to stop smoking, although researchers say the benefit of smoking cessation may be worth the risk.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
Headlines: Incidence of Lung Adenocarcinoma in Never Smokers
Teaser: Despite a decrease in exposure to secondhand smoke, never smokers continue to be at risk for lung cancer.

Headlines: Gastroenterology Data That Primary Care Teams Need to Know
Teaser: This year's World Congress of Gastroenterology at the American College of Gastroenterology meeting featured several studies whose findings affect primary care. Dr David Johnson highlights the results.

Headlines: Cirrhosis Overview Video
Teaser: This video discusses the pathophysiology of a cirrhotic liver as well as major complications and clinical signs and symptoms of cirrhosis.

Headlines: Co-managing HIV, Hepatitis C, and Opioid Abuse
Teaser: Treating or even curing these infections isn't enough. Without treatment for opioid abuse, the patient will die.

Headlines: Reduce Stress by Reframing
Teaser: Dr Jay Winner describes 'reframing,' a technique in which thinking about a stressful situation a little differently can reduce stress.

Headlines: Is Age-Related Macular Degeneration Declining?
Teaser: An aging population should mean an uptick in age-related macular degeneration cases, but recent data suggest that is not what's happening.

Headlines: Heart Failure: Are Sodium and Fluid Restriction Necessary?

Headlines: What Is Medical Ethics, and Why Is It Important?

Headlines: The History of Medical Ethics
Teaser: Medical ethics has evolved over time. This chapter shows how changes have taken place, and which factors physicians will want to account for in their medical ethical decisions.

Headlines: Target Patients With Gestational Diabetes After Birth to Reduce Risks

Headlines: Psychiatric Assessment Is Key Before and After Bariatric Surgery

Headlines: Trump Highlights Drug Prices, Opioid Crisis in State of the Union
Teaser: The president also urged Congress to pass a right-to-try law granting the terminally ill access to experimental therapies.

Headlines: FDA Acts to Stem Misuse, Abuse of Antidiarrheal Loperamide
Teaser: The FDA moves to limit the number of loperamide doses per package amid ongoing reports of serious cardiac problems and deaths with misuse and abuse of the antidiarrhea medication.

Headlines: HeatSticks Not Such a Hot Solution to Tobacco-Related Disease
Teaser: An FDA committee has determined that a new 'heat-not-burn' tobacco device does not definitively reduce risk for tobacco-related disease but does reduce exposure to potentially harmful chemicals.

Headlines: How Do You Advise Your Patients About e-Cigarettes?
Teaser: The mixed data on electronic smoking can be confusing for both patients and providers.

Headlines: Medical Community Has Sparse Reaction to State of the Union
Teaser: Despite comments from some corners about the opioid epidemic, drug prices, and right-to-try laws, many medical organizations have stayed out of the fray.

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health
Headlines: Sepsis-Related Diagnosis Impacts Interventions and Outcomes
Teaser: How might the presence or absence of a sepsis-related diagnosis impact ED interventions and in-hospital outcomes?

Headlines: State Laws Regarding Use and Sales of of E-Cigarettes
Teaser: This report examined the various state and territorial regulations regarding the use and sales of electronic cigarettes in the US, aiming to better understand the scope of current policy.

Headlines: Inspired Medicine: Getting Patients to Make Healthy Changes
Teaser: Physicians must lead a change in culture, inside and outside of their practices, according to Dr Bert Mandelbaum.

Headlines: Severe, Unusual Cases of Memory Loss Tied to Fentanyl Abuse
Teaser: An unusual amnestic syndrome that is linked to the combined use of fentanyl and cocaine and that was first identified in 14 patients in Massachusetts has been documented in a case in West Virginia.

Teaser: Which strategies may help prevent cerebral vasospasm among ICU patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage?

Headlines: Dementia Drug for Alcohol-Related Brain Damage?

Headlines: Heavy Drinking 'Strongest' Modifiable Risk Factor for Dementia

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Harms Overlooked, Especially in Older Adults
