Headlines: Israel's InterCure to Ramp Up Medical Cannabis Production - Chairman

Teaser: How do health and online risk behaviors differ between adolescents who bully and those who are victimized?

Source: Journal of the American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons

Teaser: What healthcare inequities exist in orthopedic care, and which strategies may help overcome these disparities?

Teaser: When it comes to diagnosing acute compartment syndrome, relying on the guidelines published in medical textbooks may be misguided.

Headlines: An App to Improve Adherence to Topical Therapy in Psoriasis
Teaser: Can a smartphone app which provides daily reminders to psoriasis patients improve short-term adherence to a standard topical treatment regimen?

Headlines: Thyroidectomy for Amiodarone-Induced Thyrotoxicosis
Teaser: Is thyroidectomy an effective way to control thyrotoxicosis induced by amiodarone therapy?

Headlines: Frequency of Use Among Student Tobacco Product Users

Teaser: Smokers who used e-cigarettes were almost twice as likely to quit smoking traditional tobacco products at 1 year, but experts question the study.

Headlines: Opioid Use Following IBD Flares Treated With Corticosteroids
Teaser: What percentage of patients develop new persistent opioid use following a steroid-treated IBD flare?

Headlines: Diabetes Quality of Care and Maintenance in New England
Teaser: The authors suggest a model of a cross-state collaboration, providing a foundation for identifying political and economic forces underlying inter- and intra-state variability in diabetes care.

Headlines: Daily Plate of Fried Chicken Tied to Higher Risk of Premature Death

Headlines: Identifying Children at Risk for Physical Aggression
Teaser: A new study examines risk factors for children who might follow a developmental trajectory of high physical aggression.

Headlines: Vaping and e-Cigarettes in Kids: An Unprecedented Epidemic

Headlines: Dementia Risk May Be Increased in Female Veterans
Teaser: Like their male counterparts, female veterans with these risk factors should also be monitored for dementia, according to Dr Laurie Barclay.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Screening: One Size Does Not Fit All

Headlines: Can Medical Marijuana Help Your Practice Thrive?

Headlines: The Many Forms of HPV: Recognition and Management

Headlines: 5 Best of 2018: Pediatrics Viewpoints

Headlines: Patient Suicide: Protect the Patient and Yourself
Teaser: After a suicide, families may blame physicians and sue for malpractice. The standard of care starts with risk assessment.

Headlines: Understanding the New 2018 AHA/ACC Cholesterol Guideline
Teaser: Experts from ACC provide an overview of the 2018 AHA/ACC Cholesterol Guideline which includes use of new thresholds and risk stratification tools to help personalize preventive care.

Headlines: Diplopia and Upper Eyelid Ptosis in a 74-Year-Old Man

Headlines: Exposure to Secondhand Smoke Among Nonsmokers: US, 1988-2014

Headlines: One-Time Cannabis Use May Alter Teen Brains

Headlines: Poverty, Depression, Substance Abuse Common in Native Americans With HIV

Headlines: Driving High Common in Pain Patients Taking Medical Marijuana

Headlines: Even 'Non-Problem' Drinking by Parents Tied to Mental Health Problems in Kids

Headlines: Pirfenidone Improves Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Survival

Headlines: More Tobacco Retailers, Smoking-Related Illness in Poor Neighborhoods

Headlines: Cancer Mortality Continues to Spiral Downward in the US

Headlines: Stroke Survivors in U.S. May Be Getting Less Healthy

Headlines: Sugary Soda Tied to Higher Risk of Chronic Kidney Disease

Headlines: Cancer Moonshot Takes Aim at Smoking

Headlines: Unexplained Tachycardia 'Triples Cancer Mortality Risk'

Teaser: Which spine surgery patients are more at risk of prolonged opioid usage after surgery?

Teaser: Routine measurement of high sensitivity C-reactive protein as a measure of cardiovascular inflammation has yet to gain traction. Why do clinicians remain reluctant?

Headlines: The Year in Cardiology 2018: Acute Coronary Syndrome

Teaser: How prevalent are coexisting immune-mediated diseases in patients with inflammatory bowel disease, and how might they impact prognosis?

Headlines: Is Remission Achievable in Most Patients With RA?
Teaser: This editorial explores the question of whether sustained remission in rheumatoid arthritis is achievable.

Source: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

Teaser: Evidence suggests that breast cancer survivors are at risk for anxiety, depression, and suicide.

Teaser: Two new joint American Academy of Dermatology-National Psoriasis Foundation guidelines address the management and treatment of psoriasis in adults, focusing on biologics and on comorbidities.

Teaser: Public health officials are grappling with climbing rates of syphilis and drug use in the US, as two public health crises collide.

Teaser: This essay explores innovative approaches that physician health programs are taking to reduce physician burnout. But some factors may actually discourage doctors from seeking support.

Teaser: Might the choice of low- vs. high-fat dairy-food consumption impact a woman's risk of early menopause?

Teaser: Might soy formula feeding during infancy increase the risk of menstrual pain in adulthood?

Source: Western Journal of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care with Population Health

Teaser: A new review explores the potential of the ED as a setting for naloxone distribution for patients who are at risk for an opioid overdose.

Headlines: Did Abuse-Deterrent Oxy Spur Higher Heroin Usage?
Teaser: A new study adds evidence to the idea that efforts to curb abuse of OxyContin may have had serious unintended public health consequences, says Dr Perry Wilson.

Headlines: Guideline Adherence in COPD Patients
Teaser: Are COPD patients consistently receiving recommended treatments according to available guidelines?

Headlines: Gastroschisis Trends and Link to Opioid Prescription Rates
Teaser: Is there an association between opioid use during pregnancy and gastroschisis, a rare but increasing birth defect?

Headlines: Antimicrobial Exposure and the Risk of Delirium
Teaser: Could certain antimicrobials increase the risk for delirium among critically ill patients in the ICU?

Headlines: The Experience of Raynaud's Phenomenon in Systemic Sclerosis
Teaser: A new review explores the patient impact and disease burden of Raynaud's phenomenon in systemic sclerosis.

Headlines: Medscape Psychiatrist Ethics Report 2018
Teaser: Psychiatrists weigh in on the pressing ethical decisions physicians face every day.

Headlines: Medscape Family Physician Ethics Report 2018
Teaser: Family physicians weigh in on the pressing ethical decisions that physicians face every day.

Headlines: Denver to Vote on Whether to Decriminalize 'Magic Mushrooms'
Teaser: Denver voters will decide in May whether to decriminalize possession of small amounts of the hallucinogenic drug psilocybin, which would make it the first U.S. city to halt prosecution of people caught with psychedelic mushrooms.

Headlines: Acute Kidney Injury in HIV-Infected Patients
Teaser: Do patients with HIV have an increased risk of developing acute kidney injury? A new review examines the incidence, risk factors, and pathogenesis among this population.

Headlines: Tumor Mutation Burden in NSCLC: Tissue Versus Liquid Biopsy
Teaser: Tumor mutation burden may be a promising tool to guide immunotherapy, yet many questions need to be answered before adoption into clinical practice.

Teaser: This study aimed to assess the rate of relapse following infliximab de-escalation in IBD patients in remission. How might infliximab trough level impact relapse?

Headlines: Cancer Patients May Need Longer Support to Quit Smoking

Headlines: Drug Monitoring of Naltrexone in Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: Is therapeutic drug monitoring useful for improving naltrexone's moderate therapeutic efficiency in patients with alcohol dependence?

Headlines: Medscape Internist Ethics Report 2018
Teaser: Internists weigh in on the pressing ethical decisions physicians face every day.

Headlines: Meds for Treating Addiction Also Reduce Crime and Suicide
Teaser: Dr Peter Yellowlees on how certain medications for alcohol and opioid use disorders also reduce suicide risk, accidental overdoses, and crime.

Headlines: 'Very Encouraging' Downward Mortality Trend in Cancer
Teaser: Hoping someday to be 'put out of business,' Dr David Kerr is excited about the decrease in cancer mortality rates across Europe.

Headlines: Supplements and CVD: Why Negative Data Don't Dampen Sales
Teaser: Dietary supplements are a $133 billion industry globally, despite a lack of supportive data. Should healthcare providers do more to dissuade patients who persist in taking these pricey placebos?

Headlines: Cardiology Topics to Watch for in 2019
Teaser: Wearables, aspirin for secondary prevention, AI and machine learning, and drug pricing are among the topics to keep an eye on in 2019, according to cardiologists Drs Harrington and Gibson.

Headlines: Marketing e-Cigarettes: New Product, Same Tactics
Teaser: The cat-and-mouse game between the tobacco industry and medical and public health organizations has now moved to a new front: marketing of e-cigarettes and other nicotine delivery systems.

Headlines: The Other Nutrition Crisis
Teaser: By getting to the bottom of what is causing malnutrition in older adults, clinicians can help these patients live healthier, happier lives.

Headlines: Remembering Ricky: Losing a Friend to Suicide

Headlines: The Pendulum Has Swung Too Far
Teaser: Primary care providers weigh in on the ethics of treating chronic pain in an era of growing restrictions on use of opioids.

Headlines: Pregnancy of Unknown Location
Teaser: Different diagnostic protocols for confirming an ectopic pregnancy were compared in a meta-analysis.

Headlines: Relief of Heartburn in Patients With Erosive Esophagitis
Teaser: Does a new potassium-competitive acid blocker, vonoprazan, provide more rapid relief of heartburn than standard treatment with a proton-pump inhibitor?

Headlines: Predictors of Dropout in Exercise Trials in Older Adults
Teaser: Which patients are more likely to drop out of exercise programs? A new study identifies dropout predictors among older adults.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Disease: Current and Potential New Treatments
Teaser: This paper reviews the pharmacological options which are currently available for treatment of Alzheimer disease, as well as potential new agents and approaches under investigation.

Teaser: This brief article offers guidelines for deprescribing benzodiazepine receptor agonists in patients taking them long-term for insomnia.

Headlines: Awareness of Heart Attack Symptoms and Response Among Adults
Teaser: This report reveals suboptimal knowledge of the major signs and symptoms of a heart attack among U.S. adults, especially within certain demographics.

Headlines: Barriers to Behavioral Treatment Adherence for Headache
Teaser: While nonpharmacological interventions, such as biofeedback, CBT, and relaxation techniques have been shown to be effective for headache relief, adherence is low. Why, and how can it be improved?

Headlines: Clinical Management of Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder

Headlines: Metacognitive Training and Delusional Symptoms in Psychosis
Teaser: This study demonstrated the efficacy of individualized metacognitive training, a novel psychotherapy designed to specifically target delusional beliefs in people with psychosis.

Headlines: Teen Hookah Users Run Risk of Heart Disease, Poisoning

Headlines: Lung-Cancer Screens Effective in Asbestos-Exposed Smokers

Headlines: Breast Cancer Risk Tied to DDT Varies by Exposure Timing

Headlines: Enhancing Asthma Control in African American Children
Teaser: This study demonstrated the effectiveness and feasibility of a multicomponent, multi-trigger intervention offered through a public health department to African American children with asthma.

Headlines: Record Deaths From Suicide, Drugs, in Youth a 'National Tragedy'
Teaser: A major increase in the number of young American adults lost to substance misuse and suicide is being described as a national tragedy.

Headlines: Kroger to Start Selling Cannabis-Based Products
Teaser: Kroger Co said on Tuesday it would start selling cannabis-based products in 945 stores, joining the growing number of retailers that are trying to tap the demand for cannabidiol (CBD) products.

Headlines: High Times in Ancient China Revealed in Funerary Cannabis Discovery
Teaser: Marijuana chemical residue has been found in incense burners apparently used during funerary rites at a mountainous site in western China in about 500 BC, providing what may be the oldest evidence of smoking cannabis for its mind-altering properties.

Headlines: Illinois Joins 10 Other U.S. States in Legalizing Recreational Marijuana
Teaser: Illinois on Tuesday became the 11th U.S. state to legalize the recreational use of marijuana by adults after Governor J.B. Pritzker signed into law a bill that also provides for the removal of certain previous drug convictions and will generate new revenue for the financially troubled state.

Headlines: FDA Proposes Shorter Deadline for E-Cigarette Applications
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said it can advance the date for the submission of e-cigarette applications, a proposal that could pile more pressure on companies such as Juul Labs Inc, in response to a ruling on a lawsuit by anti-tobacco groups.

Headlines: Pharmacies May Not Stock Naloxone, Despite Statewide Orders
Teaser: More than three years after Pennsylvania issued a statewide order expanding access to the life-saving opioid antidote naloxone, the product was still hard to purchase in Philadelphia pharmacies, researchers found.

Headlines: Lawyers Pitch Plan to Include Entire U.S. in Opioid Settlement Talks
Teaser: Lawyers representing county and municipal governments accusing drug manufacturers and distributors of fueling the U.S. opioid epidemic proposed a novel plan on Friday that would allow every community nationally to participate in negotiating billions of dollars in settlements.

Headlines: Nurse Accused of Stealing Opioids, Replacing Them With Tap Water
Teaser: At a National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center, a registered nurse allegedly stole opioids and covered up the theft by refilling the depleted syringes with water.

Headlines: Teens With Strong Connections at Home and School May Become Healthier Adults
Teaser: Teens who feel understood by their parents and teachers may grow up to be healthier adults, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Study Backs Recommended Spirometry Cutoff for COPD Diagnosis
Teaser: The guideline-recommended FEV1:FVC cutoff of lower than 0.70 accurately diagnoses clinically significant COPD and predicts COPD-related hospitalization and death, a study found.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose More Likely if Family Member Has Prescription
Teaser: Opioid overdoses may be much more likely to happen in families when somebody in the household has been prescribed these drugs, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Chemical in Toothpaste Tied to Osteoporosis in Women
Teaser: Exposure to triclosan, common in household products such as soaps and toothpaste but recently banned in hand sanitizers, correlates with lower bone mineral density and prevalence of osteoporosis in US women.

Headlines: Father's Smoking During Pregnancy Tied to Asthma in Kids
Teaser: Children who are exposed to tobacco smoke from their fathers while they're in the womb may be more likely than those who are not to develop asthma by age 6, according to a study of chemical changes to DNA.

Headlines: A Tool for Periodontitis Screening in a Medical Care Setting
Teaser: The authors present a quick and easy screening tool for periodontitis, intended for use by medical professionals in a non-dental setting.

Headlines: Psychosocial Aspects of Transplantation
Teaser: Book Chapter: examine key psychosocial issues facing the patient, family, and transplant team.

Headlines: Single Use PICO NPWT Device on Surgical, Traumatic Wounds
Teaser: Learn more on this novel NPWT system and how it can benefit postoperative and posttraumatic wounds.

Headlines: Idiopathic Tumoral Calcinosis in Hand
Teaser: This interesting report describes an unusual case of idiopathic tumoral calcinosis of the hand in an otherwise healthy patient.

Headlines: The WoundWand and Its Novel Use in Burn Excision Surgery
Teaser: This novel surgical ablative tool could play an important role in the future of burn surgery.

Headlines: Alternatives to Acellular Dermal Matrix
Teaser: The use of Gore DualMesh may be a safe, effective, and less costly alternative to acellular dermal matrix in breast reconstruction.

Headlines: Champagne Groove Lipectomy in Abdominoplasty
Teaser: How does the champagne groove lipectomy compare with standard abdominoplasty techniques in terms of costs and complications?

Headlines: Psychiatric Disorders Among Plastic Surgery Patients
Teaser: How often do patients seeking cosmetic plastic surgery suffer from a psychiatric disorder? Are you aware of the signs?
